loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student while her two children attend local secondary school. Myagmarsuren operates a household's good retail business with the help of her husband. She sells a variety of household's consumer goods while her husband helps her to repair an electric products for sale. Myagmarsuren started her business in 2008 selling a stationaries at the local market. After finding success and achieving stable business operations within short period, she expanded her product line to include a variety of household's consumer goods. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her daughter's tuition fees. Myagmarsuren is a hardworking and modest woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more variety of stationaries and households's products in order to increase her product line for her retail business.

loans.use: To purchase additional variety of stationary

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is her children's school fees.
Neema makes natural juice, which she sells from home. Her major customers are neighbors and passersby. Neema faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During cold weather, the demand for soft drinks/juices is low compared to during the hot summer season. Neema also owns rental houses. She hopes to build five more rental houses.
With this 40,000 KES loan, Neema wants to purchase passion fruits, sugar and flavorings. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase passion fruits, sugar and flavorings

loans.name: Nancy Yanine

texts.en:
Nancy lives in the district of Tambogrande, a tropical zone in Northern Peru. The area is primarily populated by individuals who work on small fruit plantations or raise animals. Nancy owns her own home, which she shares with her young daughter. She is a single mother, aged twenty-two.

Nancy sells clothing. She works as a street vendor, sometimes setting up a small display and, at other times, carrying her wares around busy areas. It is a difficult business, but well appreciated by the locals as it offers quick access to general items. In addition to selling clothing, Nancy raises chickens, ducks and turkeys, which she later sells in local markets. From these two activities, Nancy is able to stabilize her income and provide for her daughter.

This will be Nancy’s first loan from Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use the funds to expand her clothing inventory through a bulk purchase. She hopes the improvement in her supply will increase her sales and her profit. Nancy has big dreams for her future and the future of her daughter. She hopes to be able provide an education for her daughter and to see her become a professional.

loans.use: To expand her clothing inventory

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en:
Liberatha is 27 years old. She is married to a mason and has five children who are between five and sixteen years old. All of her children go to school. Liberatha has a beauty salon for ladies and she has run this business for ten years. She would like to get a loan to buy more beauty products, such as hair care and styling products, to sell.

Liberatha says the profit from this business will be used to buy a motorbike to help with transportation. She hopes to have a business valued at over a million Rwandan francs in the future.  

One of Liberatha's clients is seen in this picture. She agreed to have her photo taken while having her hair done at Liberatha's salon.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Ana María Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana María Del Carmen S. D. C. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos D. los cuales los mayores trabajan y el menor se dedica a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a su nieta a la cual cuida durante el día. Ana posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio. Ana es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar D. ella y su familia.
texts.en: Ana María Del Carmen S. D. C., 60, lives in the "departamento" of San Salvador with her husband and three children.  Her two oldest children are grown, with jobs of their own, and her youngest child is still in school.  She also has a granddaughter who she cares for during the day.  Ana owns a grocery business that she operates from her house.  She sells the everyday commodities that everyone needs.  She is applying for a loan so that she can pull together enough money to stock her business and, in turn, proviD. a better service to her customers.  Ana is a very forward-looking woman, always striving to get ahead, and working hard, day after day, for herself and her family.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Nancy Liliana

texts.es: Nancy Liliana V. Z. de 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como jornalero, y con quien reside en San Juan Opico en el departamento de La Libertad. Nancy  trabaja comercializando ropa para damas, y ropa para niñas, su forma de venderla es ambulante y la ofrece por diferentes cantones de San Juan Opico, en donde realiza muy buenas ventas ya que es ropa muy vistosa, la cual le gusta a las personas, así también tiene un precio bastante accesible. Nancy realiza este trabajado desde hace 2 años atrás con el deseo de poder superarse y de salir adelante junto a su esposo. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir más en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de ropa, tanto formal como informal para dama y mayor variedad para niños, de esta forma Nancy se asegura vender más ya que podrá abarcar los gustos de la mayoría de personas y así mismo suplir algunas necesidades.
texts.en:
Nancy Liliana V. Z. is 23 years old.  She lives with her husband, who works as a day laborer.  They live in San Juan Opico in the La Libertad department.  

Nancy works selling clothes for women and children.  She sells in an itinerant fashion in the different cantons of San Juan Opico.  Her sales are very good because the clothes are very attractive, which people like.  Also, her prices are very accessible.  

She is requesting a loan to be able to invest more in her business.  She will buy more women’s clothes, both formal and informal.  She will also buy a greater variety of children’s clothes.  This way Nancy will assure herself of selling more because she will be able to have clothes that appeal to most people.  She will also get some necessities.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 30 years old. Adeline is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Adeline owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Adeline has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Adeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Adeline is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used for working capital & to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Adeline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Don Luis Alberto M. G., es empleado de una Empresa de Acueducto y Alcantarillado, desempeñando el puesto de Fontanero, desde hace 5 años.

Es Soltero, de profesión Técnico en Contabilidad, con cuatro personas a su cargo dos de ellas son menores de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, Municipio de Nagarote, ya tiene 36 años de vivir en este lugar.

Se le otorgó un crédito destinado para Mejorar su vivienda, este es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL, está contento por haber recibido este crédito ya que le permitirá mejorar la casa de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto M. G. has been employed as a plumber in a water supply and sewerage company for the past 5 years.  He is single and an accountant by profession.  He has four people in his care, two of whom are minors.  He lives in the city of León, in Nagarote municipality.  He has lived there for 36 years.

Luis Alberto has been granted a loan to improve his home.  This is his first loan with CEPRODEL.  He is happy to have received the loan since it will allow him to improve his children's home.

loans.use: Housing improvements

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long H. , age 38, is a married villager living in a medium-sized home with her family members in Kompong Tom province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Her husband is a fisherman who fishes along the river, earning approximately $2 USD per day. 

The couple has five children: two are sewing workers, one is a grocery seller, and one is not yet working. She hopes to help her child obtain work, but she has no cash to help make that possible. She would therefore like to request a loan in order to purchase a machine for squeezing sugar cane, which she will give to her child to start a business selling sugar cane juice.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for squeezing sugar cane, which she will give to her child to start a business selling sugar cane juice.

loans.name: Dolly Eugenia

texts.es:
Trabajar la confección a terceros es el oficio que desempeña Dolly Eugenia M. T., quien a muy temprana edad aprendió a coser al lado de su hermana. La falta de oportunidades laborales sumado a su poca preparación y las dificultades económicas por la que atravesaban ella y su esposo,  la obligaron a iniciar su propio negocio. 

Actualmente Dolly confecciona prendas a terceros lo que le ha permitido contribuir para cubrir los gastos del hogar y hacer más llevadera su situación. 

Dolly necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos como telas e hilos y así cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes que cada vez son mayores.
texts.en:
Sewing for other people is what Dolly Eugenia M. T. does for a living. She and her sister learned how to sew at an early age. Dolly started her own business due to the shortage of job opportunities as well as her lack of preparation and the financial difficulties that she and her husband have faced.

Dolly currently manufactures clothes for other people. This enables her to contribute toward the household expenses and make her situation more tolerable. She needs a loan to buy supplies such as fabrics and thread so that she can fulfill the orders of her customers that are becoming overdue.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Gloren

texts.en:
Gloren S. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon.  She is 31 years old.  Gloren is married.  To make a living, Gloren owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & beverages in the local community.  Gloren has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloren joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Gloren has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  Gloren is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages.  This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gloren from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Gloris Grisela

texts.es:
La señora Gloris Grisela Z. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Alex Javier Murillo, Gloris se dedica al comercio tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Gloris tiene tres hijos y con su familia viven en la colonia San Francisco desde hace 12 años.
en su negocio de pulperia vende todo tipo de Abarroteria, refrescos, carnes, embutidos, repuestos para bicicletas y mucho mas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y una parte para la compra de cemento y arena para repellar una pared en donde tiene ubicado su negocio.
 
Doña gloris es una mujer trabajadora y dinamica que le gusta mucho el negocio; nos comentaba que su casa es construida a puras utilidades de su negocio.
Su meta es tener su propio carro.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloris Grisela Z. is 32 years old and in a common law relationship with Sr. Alex Javier Murillo. She works in the retail sector and has a store in her home. Gloris has three children and has lived with her family in the San Francisco neighborhood for twelve years. In her business, she sells all types of groceries, soft drinks, meats, canned goods, bicycle parts, and other items.

This loan will be used to buy groceries. Some of the money will be used to buy cement and sand to repair a wall in her business location.

Doña Gloris is a hardworking and dynamic woman who enjoys managing her business. She says that her house was built using the profits from her business. Her goal is to have her own car. The income she earns is needed so that her family can get ahead.

loans.use: To acquire merchandise and purchase cement and sand to repair a wall in her store.

loans.name: Carmen Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es socia del banco comunal Las Rosas, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos mayores e independientes.
Su trabajo mayormente es en la chacra tiene sembríos de Camú Camú (fruta regional), lleva 1 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, su esposo es el que está al cuidado de las plantaciones, viendo el cultivo y las cosechas para que puedan dar buenos frutos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 comprará:  50 kilos de abono, 1 kilo de semilla de pepino, ½ kilo de semilla de culantro, 1 kilo de semilla de tomate, ½ kilo de semilla de vainitas, 2 kilos de semilla de frejol, 2 kilos de semilla de maní, 2 kilos de semilla de frejol regional.
Todas estas semillas serán sembradas una vez que pase la creciente, para luego ser vendidas en el mercado, de esa manera trabaja la señora Carmen con su esposo para poder vivir.
Agradecen a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de poder acceder a un pequeño préstamo y poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen is a member of the communal Bank The Roses from the Calleria Distict of Ucayali, is 65 years old, married, and has 5 children who are all grown up and independent.

She mainly works in the small farm consisting of Camú Camú (regional fruit) crops. So far she has been working for one year with the loan that Manuela Ramos offered. Her husband is in charge of maintaining the crops by looking after and cultivating the crops for their successful fruition.

With her 1,300 Peruvian Soles loan she will buy: 50 kilos of fertilizer, 1 kilo of cucumber seeds, 1/2 kilo of cilantro seeds, 1 kilo of tomato seeds, 1/2 kilo of green bean seeds, 2 kilos of bean seeds, 2 kilos of peanut seeds, and 2 kilos of regional beans.

All of these seeds will be sewn. As soon as they are grown they will be sold in the market. This is what Mrs. Carmen and her husband do for a living.

They thank Manuela Ramos for the offered loan to continue their work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Chhit

texts.en:
Chhit S. is a Khmer cake seller in and around a busy market in Battambang province. The cake is made from rice which is cooked in bamboo tubes. She typically makes around $3 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. She has been married for many years to Pout Hin, 48, a construction worker, and they have five children; three are single, and two are married. 

Beside this work, she has also been planting rice crops. Presently, Chhit S. is not yet planting crops on her farmland as she doesn’t have enough funds to do. She hopes to use this Kiva loan to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing crops.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing crops.

loans.name: Marianna

texts.en:
Marianna is married, with a six-year-old son. She owns a small business selling food at the local market in Uzhgorod town. Marianna started this business several years ago. She decided to choose a food business because the demand does not depend much on the season or other factors. The store she rents is located in a good spot at the market, bringing many clients who buy food from her. 

Marianna is a very open person. She is able to provide excellent client service. People love to buy from her and come back again. Recently Marianna started a second location. Now she needs a loan to purchase more inventory to put on her new shelves.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to put on her new shelves

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 40 years old, is a retired military man married to Kefah, a 40-year-old housewife. They have four children all under the age of 15 and they live in a rented house in Madaba. 

Mohammad opened a small food market beside his house after retirement to be able to have another income sources to support his family and his young kids. It has been a year now since he opened his business and it has been running successfully in the neighborhood.

Now Mohamad has applied for a loan to buy more goods from the suppliers and to redecorate the food market in order to attract more customers and to have the space to add new products or goods.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell and to redecorate the shop

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Luz has a computer game shop that provides computer facilities, especially games. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to pay for the utilities and maintenance of the computers. Luz is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the utilities and maintenance of her computers

loans.name: Lourdes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lourdes lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas una de ellas es la señora Claudia quien se dedica al comercio de gallinas en el mercado. Ella cría gallinas y luego las vende desde hace varios años  y en este negocio es que invertirá el crédito en purina y vacunas etc.
Los otros integrantes son Manuel quien tiene un taller de costura hace 8 años  e invertirá el crédito en telas e hilos y Gloria se dedica al comercio de gallina.
texts.en:
The Lourdes group is comprised of three hardworking, entrepreneurial, and driven people, one of whom is Claudia. She sells chickens at market. She has been raising chickens and selling them for several years. She will use the loan for purines ***, vaccines, etc.

The other group members are Manuel, who has had a tailor shop for eight years and who will use the loan for thread and fabric, and Gloria, who sells chickens.

***Purine is an organic compound found in meat. Plant-based diets (like chickens would have) are generally low in purines.

loans.use: to raise chickens

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio de 28 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil. Es un hombre trabajador que busca salir adelante en los gastos del hogar.. Es casado y su esposa trabaja vendiendo comesticos por catálogos y tienen un hijo de año y medio. Tiene un taller de bicicleta

Hace un tiempo atrás el era ayudante de un taller y un día decidió ponerse su negocio propio. Labora de 8h00 am a 13H00 pm en su taller. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales para su taller como llantas, tubos, timones y varios cosas. En un futuro su quiere comprar una maquina que le hace falta en su taller y a la vez desea ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julio is 28 and he lives in an urban area of el Guasmo (so named because of a type of tree-Guazuma ulmifolia).  El Guasmo is a poor neighborhood with humble residents (in the past it was a plantation) of Guayaquil.  He is a hard-working man who is looking to get ahead with household expenses.  He is married and his wife also works selling cosmetics through catalogs. They have a year and a half year old son. 

 Julio has a bicycle repair shop. In the past he was an assistant in a shop and one day he decided to set up his own business.  He works from 8 am to 1:30 pm in his shop.  He will use the loan to buy supplies for his shop such as tires, tubes, steering wheels and some other items.  In the future he want to buy a machine that he needs in his shop and also to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his shop such as tires, tubes and steering wheels

loans.name: Nidia

texts.en: Nidia is 54 years old and lives in San Gabriel, Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband. She and her husband have four children who are all married. Nidia is an entrepreneurial person who is willing to fight for her goals. Nidia sells milk from her milk cows. She wants to increase her business by buying another milk cow. Nidia started her business by buying and reselling milk. She was a milk seller in this manner for ten years. With time, she purchased her own milk cow. Now, she works with the help of her husband. Her work is going well and she has many clients who buy her milk. This is her second loan and Nidia hopes it will improve her life and the life of her family. Nidia’s dream is to have a milking machine so that she would no longer have to milk her cows by hand.

loans.use: to purchase a new milk cow

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 41 years old and married with five children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old. She sells sorghum and beans. Her business is well organized. She has ten years' experience in this business and she works from 7 am until 6 pm every day. 

Judith has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more beans and sorghum to sell. Judith will reinvest the profits in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Aside from farming, Thelma engages in selling Avon products to earn additional income. She has operated this business for almost 15 years and usually earns a net profit of 9,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. She has utilized her income to pay the tuition fees and allowances of their four children. 

At the age of 59, she has seen all of her children finish their studies. She wants to continue managing the business to earn a living and save for their future. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy lotion, perfumes, roll on, face powder, jewelry, and shirts to sell in the village. 

In the future, Thelma aims to put up a general store in their house to display her products and sell fruits and vegetables. She believes that her strong determination will make it possible for her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy lotion, perfumes, roll on, face powder, jewelry, and shirts to sell in the village

loans.name: Cesar Daniel

texts.es: El señor Cesar Daniel  de 34 años vive en unión libre con Elizabeth y tienen un hijo que inicia su educación Preescolar; Cesar es un esposo y padre que se preocupa por dar lo mejor que el pueda a su Familia. Hace 5 años su principal única fuente de Ingresos era la venta de artículos de segunda mano como los son: ropa, zapatos, juguetes, muebles, artículos electrodomésticos para el hogar.  Con el ingreso que el obtenía del negocio no era suficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar y fue por ello que se vio en la necesidad de buscar un empleo en el cual recibiera un sueldo fijo pero sin tener que descuidar el negocio, el trabaja de Lunes a Viernes en un horario de 6:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde como operador de costura en una maquiladora desde hace 2 años; pero no pierde la ilusión de que muy pronto podrá dejar ese trabajo y dedicarse únicamente a su negocio, requiere el apoyo para compra de mercancía y tener una gran variedad de productos que le permitan incrementar las ventas de su negocio .
texts.en:
Cesar Daniel is 34 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with Elizabeth.  They have a son who is starting preschool.  Cesar is a husband and father who cares to do the best he can for his family. Five years ago, his main source of income was selling used goods such as clothes, shoes, toys, furniture, and household appliances. 

The income that he obtained from the business was not enough to cover the basic needs of his home and because of that, he needed to find a job where he would receive a fixed salary but without neglecting his business.  For two years, Cesar has been working Monday through Friday from 6:00 am in the morning to 4:00 pm in the afternoon as the sewing operator in a sweatshop.  He does not lose the dream that he'll soon quit that job and devote himself solely to his business.  Cesar requests the support to purchase goods to have a great variety of products to help him increase sales for his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
La señora Aydee nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació. (En la fotografía la señora Aydee está levantando la mano). 

La señora Aydee es viuda y tiene dos hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y responsable que saca adelante a sus hijos, ella tiene una lavandería y dos personas le ayudan con el negocio, ella mayormente trabaja con cadenas D. hoteles turísticos. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

La señora Aydee desD. hace un año que pertenece al banco comunal “Señor D. Huanca” y le va muy bien, ella en su primer crédito que se prestó D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en el mantenimiento D. la maquinas lavadoras. En esta oportunidad Aydee requiere el préstamo para comprar cosas como por ejemplo detergerte, blanqueadores, perfumes y otras cosas más.  

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Señor D. Huanca” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco.  El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. animales menores como cuyes, venta D.  comida, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. tejidos y venta D. miel. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Sra. Aydee was born in the city of Cusco and lives there still. In the photograph she is raising her hand.

Sra. Aydee is a widow and has two children. She is a working mother and is responsible for helping her children to get ahead. She has a laudromat and two people who help her with the business. She mainly works in tourist hotel chains. She has been in this business for 20 years and it is going very well thanks to the dedication she gives to her work. 

Sra. Aydee has been a member of the "Señor D. Huanca" communal bank for one year and it's going well. For her first loan of 600 new soles she invested in the maintenance of washing machines. Now Aydee needs the loan to purchase things such as detergent, bleach, perfumes, and others. 

The members of the communal bank meet every 30 days in the city of Cusco.It is maD. up of workers and businesspeople who are always looking to get ahead and with their daily energy give a better future to their children. 

The majority of the the members live in the city of Cusco and the activities of the other members are, for example, animal sales such as guinea pigs, food sales, grocery sales, honey sales, and clothing sales. Cusco is known for being a very touristic zone, because of it's traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu, is found here.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, bleach, perfumes, and others

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. Conchita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Conchita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Conchita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Napisa

texts.ru:
Компания «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» выражает искреннюю признательность социальным инвесторам Кива за поддержку первого кредита на развитие бизнеса Написы, который был выплачен без просрочек.  
Написа занимается  торговлей продуктами питания, открыв этот бизнес 2008 году. С помощью стартового капитала в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) Написа сумела развить торговую деятельность своего магазина, который приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Первый кредит по линии Кива помог Написе разнообразить ассортимент своего товара и приобрести новых клиентов. Желание не останавливаться на достигнутом привело Напису во второй раз в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента представленного товара.  Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить  в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Bai Tushum and Partners organization expresses sincere appreciation to the social investors at Kiva for their support of the first loan given to develop Napisa's business, which was paid out without delinquencies.

Napisa sells food products and opened her business in 2008. With the help of a starting capital of 20,000 KGS Napisa was able to develop her store business which brings about 15,000 KGS a month. Her first Kiva loan helped Napisa to widen the variety of her goods and acquire new customers. Her desire to not stop on what she has achieved brought Napisa back to Bai Tushum and Partners for the second time for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to increase the assortment of goods. She plans to use the profit from the loan to invest in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods.

loans.name: Miriam Maria

texts.es:
Miriam de 50 años, una mujer trabajadora que a pesar de ser mujer viuda ha sabido cómo salir adelante.
Ella a los 20 años quedo viuda, un amigo de ella le dio la oportunidad de que aprenda a manejar.

Ahora ella ejerce la profesión de taxista, el horario de ella es de lunes a domingo. Desde las 10:00am y termina la jornada a las 22:00pm. La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia.  Es soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 20, 24, 30 y 34 años, actualmente todos son independientes.

Ella solicita el préstamo para darle mantenimiento a sus vehículos. Su sueño es cada día siga creciendo en su actividad, ya que actualmente tiene una empresa de Renta-car (Taxi amigo).
texts.en:
Miriam is 50 years old and she is a hardworking woman. Despite being widowed she has known how to move forward. She was widowed at the age of 20. A friend of hers gave her the opportunity to learn how to drive. 

Today she is a taxi driver. The schedule that she keeps is from Monday to Sunday. She starts working at 10:00 am and she finishes her day at 10:00 pm. The difficulty she faces is theft. She is single and she has 4 children, aged 20, 24, 30, and 34 years old. They are all independent.

She requests a loan to provide maintenance repairs to her cars. Her dream is to keep her business growing more each day. She currently has a taxi company, named Taxi Amigo.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance repairs to her cars.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба проживает в районе Шахринав. Ей 42 года. Она разведена. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Уже шесть лет как Насиба занимается торговлей на рынке. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Nasiba lives in the Shahrinav district.  She is 42 years old, divorced and has four children.  She has a secondary education.  Nasiba has been involved in sales at the market for six years.  She sells children's clothing.  Nasiba is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su grupo familiar, su esposa y 5 hijos, todos son dependientes, Juan por su parte se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, de este pequeño negocio logra recibir ganancias para solventar las necesidades del hogar, este trabajo requiere dedicación, para mantener gordos y sanos a los cerdos, esto lo aprendió de su padre.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de sacos de concentrado, para alimentar a los cerdos, esta compra será muy útil para Juan, ya que por el momento se encuentra este producto subiendo de precio, así podrá comprar varios sacos, con lo que pueda cubrir el dinero del préstamo, para almacenarlo y tener para la granja.
La aspiración de Juan es tener una granja sana y bien alimentada, un crecimiento en su comercio y poder tener para su familia una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his family consisting of his wife and five children who are all dependent on him.  Juan raises pigs.  From this small business he’s able to earn profits to cover household expenses.  The work requires a certain amount of dedication to maintain the pigs fat and healthy; he learned this from his father.  

At present, he’s requesting a loan to buy sacks of feed concentrate for the pigs.  This purchase will be very useful for Juan because at the moment the price of this product is rising and he’ll be able to buy several sacks with the amount of the loan and store them to have available for his farm.  Juan’s hope is to have a healthy, well fed farm, to grow in the marketplace and to have his family in better economic solvency.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate for his pigs.

loans.name: Samad

texts.ru: Самад женат имеет  двоих детей. Он любящий семьянин. У него свой бизнес. В столь трудные времена финансового кризиса содержать семью в достатке нелегко. В своем магазине он продает продукты питания и хозяйственные товары. Более 4 лет он занимается данным бизнесом и успешен в своем деле. Его продуктовый магазин находится возле его дома. На полученный доход он хочет обеспечить детям хорошее образование. Для этого они вместе с женой много работают. Жена работает врачом в местной больнице. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес, приобретя еще новый ассортимент продуктов. Для этого он хочет получить займ и надеется в вашей поддержке. Спасибо за ваше понимание и доброту. Он заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Samad is married and has two children.  He is a loving family man.  Samad has his own business.  It is difficult to provide enough for the family during such difficult times of the financial crisis.  Samad sells food products and household goods in his store.  He has been involved in this business for over four years and is successful at it.  His food store is located near his house.  Samad wants to use the received profit to provide his children with a good education.  This is why his wife and he work a lot.  His wife works as a doctor at a local hospital.  Samad wants to expand his business by buying a new selection of products.  This is why he wants to obtain this loan and hopes that you would support him.  Thank you for your understanding and kindness.  Samad is grateful to you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en: Batsuren is 38 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt/ nomadic tent) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is a clerk and his son is a school student. He started his hairdressing business in 2006 by renting a space in the market. Now (in 2011) that his business is stable, he also has started to operate a barber shop. He also rented a counter in the market to sell cell phones which is right next to his hairdressing place. His new business seems to be highly profitable. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "I can manage two business at once and I don't like to miss an opportunity. This business is already paying off and I want to expand it by selling a broader range of products". He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy phone supplies and cell phones.

loans.use: To buy phone supplies and cell phones

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 1 child. 
Analie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Analie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Analie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Taume

texts.en:
Taume is 43 years of age and is married with nine children.

Taume runs a fishing business, catching and selling ocean-caught fish.  She has four years of experience in this business.Taume needs a loan of WST $2,500 to purchase a new canoe, a fishing net , spears  and flash light. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Taume joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.  This is Taume's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a new canoe, a fishing net , spears  and flash light

loans.name: Wangninagbe Group

texts.fr: WANGNINAGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Inès (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Inès a un enfant scolarisé et à sa charge. Inès vit seule avec son unique enfant. Inès assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Inès a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Depuis sept ans, Inès vend des cartes de recharges, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables dans son atelier. Inès achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Inès et les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAGBE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: WANGNINAGBE is a group composed of 3 people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Inès (the one raising her hand on the picture), is 34 and no longer lives with her husband. Inès has one dependent child who goes to school. She lives by herself with her only child. Inès provides for herself and her child. She quit school at the primary level. Inès has been selling refill cards for prepaid phones for 7 years, which she does from her workshop and brings a substantial profit. Inès buys those items in Benin. It is the first time that Inès and the other members of WANGNINAGBE are applying for financial support from ALIDÉ, in order to strengthen their business and to better meet the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy refill cards for prepaid phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit and buy poultry.

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es: El señor Eduardo, es habitante del municipio de la Borgoña, junto a su esposa quien es comerciante de ropa y zapatos, para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar, no tienen hijos aun, los planes hacia un futuro es poder ampliar la vivienda ya que donde habitan actualmente es pequeño, el se dedica a vender cosméticos, pero el capital de trabajo es muy poco para la demanda de clientes que tiene, por lo cual necesita con mucha urgencia apoyo de financiamiento para poder invertir más y obtener mejores ingresos económicos para sustentar los gastos. Este es su primer crédito que necesita para comprar productos tales como labiales, polvo compacto, cremas, delineadores, perfumes para damas y caballeros entre otros.
texts.en:
Eduardo lives in Borgoña with his wife who is a clothes and shoes merchant to help him with household expenses since they have no children yet.  His future plan is to enlarge the house because where they currently live is very small.

He sells cosmetics but his working capital is too small for the customer demand he has.  This is why he urgently needs financing to be able to invest more and earn higher income to cover costs.

This is his first loan and he needs it to buy lipstick, compact powder, creams, eyeliner and perfume for women and men, among others.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for women and men.

loans.name: Maria Glenda

texts.en:
My name is Maria Velaquez and I sell groceries. I have had my business for four years and my children help me with it. I have a solid customer base because my business is located in a heavily traveled area. My goal is to increase my inventory to have more sales and offer more products. I want to remodel my home and give a better education to my children with the profits.

Loan Use: Flour purchase of wheat, bread, butter, sauce of tomato, candies, softdrinks, churros, vegetables, cinnamon, bags, eggs, coffee

Mi nombre es Maria V. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años y mis hijos me ayudan a la atencion del mismo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi clientela es muy buena ya que mi negocio esta ubicado en una area muy transitada por personas, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para poder tener una mejor venta y surtir de mas productos y con los ingresos que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa y darles un mejor estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de harina de trigo, pan, manteca, salsa de tomate, confites, refrescos, churros, vegetales, canela, bolsas, huevos, cafe

loans.name: Gavkhar

texts.en: Several years ago Gavhar was a famous theatre dancer in Tajikistan. This beautiful woman many times has fascinated people with her skills of dance and acting. During a civil war in the early 90’s in Tajikistan, she and her two daughters went to Moscow.  They worked for over 8 years there at local market and then came back to Tajikistan. With the savings that she made while being in Russia Gavhar decided to start her own business. For the last three years she has been delivering and distributing spare parts from Bishkek to Tajikistan. Gavhar has had a very difficult life but she is an optimist. Recently she purchased a flat and has a plan to reequip it into a shop. That’s why she needs additional capital. The main goal for her is to make as much profit as she can in order to help her two daughters, nine grandchildren and one great-granddaughter.

loans.use: Retail trade (spare parts)

loans.name: Agbontaen

texts.en: Agbontaen E. is a young woman who is 43 years of age. She is married with six (6) children and has been an LAPO client for 2 years. She is experienced in her line of business and has proven her worthiness for a loan from LAPO. She will use the money ($550) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Oyakhire

texts.en: Oyakhire A. is a trained electrician who runs a small business repairing freezers. He is married and lives in Benin City with his wife and one child. He is seeking a loan of $750 to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Sallaymatu

texts.en: Sallaymatu K. is married with four children.  She is thirty eight years old and runs a stall selling peanuts and local products. Sallaymatu’s income supports family expenses and she is determined to do more to increase her profits.  Her previous loan improved her business and she would like a loan of $175 for the same purpose.

loans.use: Expansion of market stall for selling local products.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: George lives with his wife and his 2 children in the Bekaa. This is the fifth time he is borrowing a loan from Al Majmoua. George sells beauty products and has built an important client network at only 36 years old. He is always striving to innovate his business, diversify his products and is looking for continuous development. He wishes to buy enough merchandise to answer to the needs of his clients in terms of variety and quantity.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for his business

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en: Yusif is a 43 year-old married man who lives with his four children and owns a small farm. He lives and works in the small village in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He has two cows and sells milk and yogurt to the local bazaar traders. He has nine years of experience in this field. Since dairy products are in high demand all across Azerbaijan, Yusif has become a very successful businessman in a very short period. The income was enough to cover family needs, but as his children grow, covering family needs has become harder, so Yusif applied for 1200 USD to expand his activities and start selling calves for meat production. The estimated cost for one calf is 300 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. P. began his business four years ago, his wife had a tortilla business in their home which generated many well-served customers. They added some food products, invested approximately fifty dollars, and when they saw their customers asked for more items that they didn’t have they decided to formalize the store. Currently their inventory is very good and previous loans have helped Mr. P. to be able to improve way of life. This loan is needed to purchase eggs as their customers are requesting them; in addition they will purchase detergent and other food items.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor P. inicio su negocio desde hace cuatro años, su esposa a mantenido una tortilleria en su vivienda lo cual le generaba la presencia de algunos clientes que podían ser bien aprovechados y pusieron algunos productos de consumo, invirtió aproximadamente cincuenta dolares, cuando vio que los clientes le pedían otros que no tenia decidido formalizar la tienda, hasta la fecha sus inventarios son muy buenos y las inversiones de los créditos anteriores le a ayudado incluso para poder mejorar su vivienda de habitación, este financiamiento lo necesita para comprar huevos ya que sus clientes se lo piden por mayor además de invertir en detergentes y otros artículos de consumo .

loans.use: Purchase eggs at wholesale prices, detergent, and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Ms. Olinda is a member of the cummunal bank Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay, she earns a living selling groceries. Her business is located at the district market in the Yungay province.

With the loan of $275.00 (S/800.00 soles), which will be paid off in 6 installments, she will purchase 3 sacks of rice and 3 sacks of sugar for her business.

Ms. Olinda is 42 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 underage children. She is able to provide an education for her children with the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Olinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay, su actividad es la venta de abarrotes y su negocio está ubicado en el campo ferial del distrito y provincia de Yungay.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 3 sacos de arroz y 3 sacos de azúcar para implementar su negocio.

Ella tiene 42 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad; con los ingresos que genera su negocio educa a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar wholesale

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sari

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Sari is a grandmother with ten grandchildren. Her four children all are married and live separately. Ni Ketut Sari and her husband is getting older, but they have such a high spirit. To be more productive, Ni Ketut Sari opens a food mart in her house. Ni Ketut Sari sells daily goods such as vegetable, traditional cookies from her neighbor, and a wide assortment of snacks and beverages. Everyday, escorted by her husband, Ni Ketut Sari shops at a pre dawn market in the nearby city. She is home by 5 AM and opens her store. She spends almost IDR 300,000 everyday. (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between IDR 9,000-9,500.00). Her daily revenue could reach IDR 150,000-200,000. Her average profit is IDR 20,000 per day. Since her store is always crowded, Ni Ketut Sari is very excited to work to keep her customers happy.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Ketut Sari seorang nenek dengan 10 cucu karena 4 anaknya semuanya sudah berkeluarga dan tidak tinggal bersamanya. Ni Ketut Sari dan suaminya sudah lanjut usia. Tetapi semangat hidupnya sangat tinggi. Supaya tidak kesepian Ni Ketut Sari membuka usaha dagang dirumahnya. Ni Ketut Sari menjual kebutuhan sehari – hari, seperti sayur - sayuran, kue-kue tradisional yang dititip tetangganya dan berbagai macam makanan dan minuman ringan. Setiap hari, dengan diantar suaminya, Ni Ketut Sari berbelanja di pasar pagi di kotanya. Jam 5 pagi, Ni Ketut Sari sudah sampai dirumah dan mulai membuka warungnya. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Sari mengeluarkan modal hampir Rp. 300.000.- Dan pendapatan perhari bisa mencapai Rp. 150.000.- sd Rp. 200.000.-. Dengan rata-rata keuntungan perhari yang diperolehnya Rp. 20.000,-. Karena ramainya orang yang berbelanja kewarungnya, Ni ketut Sari menjadi semangat untuk bekerja supaya pelanggannya tidak hilang.

loans.use: To add more working capital

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.en:
Jose is 23 years old and is originally from Maputo. He is the sixth son among 9 brothers and sisters, and in 2004 he moved to Ponta D’Ouro following 4 of his siblings. Ponta D’Ouro is a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

Jose completed primary school (up to 7th grade) and since 2005 is a waiter in one of Ponta D’Ouro’s great restaurants (Kaya Kweru). His initial salary was MTn 1,500/ month, but since last year it was increased to MTn 2,000/month (around US$80). He works 8 hours per day, from 7am to 3pm or from 3pm to 10pm, six days per week.

Jose got married 2 years ago, and although his wife Cassilda (20 years old) is now working, they are barely able to save any money in the end of the month. As Jose is a very family-oriented person, he goes personally to Maputo once a month to bring his family money (MTn 1,000) and salute his mother. He pays MTn300 back and forth to Maputo, so in fact he just gives MTn 700 to his parents.

Jose heard about Hluvuku at work, and after seeing a friend repaying his loan, he decided to apply for his first loan ever to improve his living conditions. Today Jose lives in a house with a plastic roof, and with this MTn 3,000 loan he will be able to buy aluminum roofing in South Africa and stop heavy rain from entering the house.

As soon as Jose finishes repaying this first loan, he intends to apply for a second one in order to go to driver’s school and get his license. The school takes 1 month and costs MTn 6,000. Jose believes that he can earn significantly more as a driver (the driver of the restaurant he works for, for example, earns 3 times more than he does). He is a very motivated young man and has many plans, such as building his own brick house and having his own restaurant.

The picture shows Jose with one of his nieces, Edna, at his house.

loans.use: Buy construction material (aluminum roofing)

loans.name: Sareourn Chork Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sareourn C. is the leader of a four person loan group in Chom Teav village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 43 years old, married and without children. She and her husband, Huoy Huy, are subsistence farmers and work together to cultivatable their land. They generate a small income to support themselves. Previously, Mrs. Sareourn C. obtained a loan from AMK to improve her agricultural production. Now she is asking for a loan to buy land in order to build a house for her family in the village.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy K. is 48 years old and has been farming her rice fields in Siem Reap province since 1980. Her husband, Saom Kean, works day to day beside her as they struggle to raise their children. Together they can earn only $2.50 US per day on average. They have seven children, three of whom are already married. Only one child is still in school, and the other three who remain unmarried farm with their parents. For poor farmers, children serve as a kind of guarantee or security. When Soy K. is too old to work she wants to have built a business her children can continue and that also allows them to take care of her. Her loan will go towards buying a small tractor which she will use to plow her farmland each season; she will also be able to leave this investment to her children, who will continue to work as farmers. Soy also has plans to expand into livestock once she can afford the pigs. She is pictured here with a neighbor's pig.

loans.use: To buy a tractor.

loans.name: Mujeres Amistad Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Amistad group is from a pleasant community at the base of Lake Atitlan’s smallest volcano, Cerro de Oro. The women of this group enjoy working in a group to pay off loans because of the mutual help they provide each other and fun group activities.

These women mostly weave traditional indigenous clothing. Others sell food around their neighborhood. The weavers sell almost entirely in the largest town of Lake Atitlan, Santiago and mostly to intermediaries who add embroidery to their pieces and sell them around the lake area.

Although they face competition in Santiago, the extra capital of the loans and their ability to buy wholesale materials helps them remain competitive.

For Josefa T., increased investment leads to increased profit, which allows her to spend extra money on her family. She also maintains two employees which allow her to make about four guipiles per week.

On average the women can produce a guipil without embroidery in two days and sells it for 90 to 115 quetzales (13-15 dollars). At this rate, their only limitation is limited capital. Loans allow the women to get over this obstacle and earn enough money to live a comfortable family life and grow their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase thread to weave and embroider traditional blouses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 27-years-old, married with two children, ages 12 and 8. She has been selling cement and chickens since 2006. She works from 8AM to 6PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $100 from her sales.

Mary now hopes for a loan to buy more cement for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cement to increase her stock.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 10 and 3 years old. She has been a clothes seller since in 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 25 from her sales.

Bahati is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S., 33, is a true entrepreneur. She has a business with her husband, Heak Phat, 33, making rice mill, growing rice, and raising animals. On average, both of them make around US$3 each day. They have two children who are students. Bun S. is asking a loan of $200 USD to purchase more stone to make rice mill. (Mr. Heak is pictured at his home.)

loans.use: To purchase more stone to make rice mill.

loans.name: Yasmina Lucrecia

texts.es:
La señora Yasmina Lucrecia R. L. su edad es de 38 años, el estado civil es soltera tiene 3 hijos, con edades comprendidas entre los 10 años, 8 años y 6 años respectivamente,  cursando la primaria los tres, uno de los propósitos es mantener la actividad activa y de esta manera tener un ingreso mas para su hogar, ya que es la única que aporta al núcleo familiar, otros de sus propósitos es que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que ellos puedan tener un futuro como lo serian en finalizar sus estudios.


La actividad económica de doña Yasmina es mercadería en general (cosméticos y ropa)
El tiempo que ella tiene de estar en el negocio es de 5 años, ella esta activa en un 100%
Ella inicio ofreciendo cosméticos al crédito en pequeñas cantidades para luego recuperar en pagos los días 15 y 3  de cada mes, con respecto al plan de inversión que el destino de este seria para capital de trabajo en los que seria: perfumes, cremas, ropa para dama, ropa para caballero y otros en lo cual esta empresa le brindaría la facilidad de lograr sus metas. Básicamente la necesidad del crédito se da debido a que requiere cumplir con pedidos de sus clientes y no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder cubrir la demanda ya que de no contar con el apoyo de nuestra institución y de programas que le ayuden en su proyecto no seria posible cumplir parte de su propósito.
texts.en:
Yasmina Lucrecia R. L. is 38 years old, and is a single mother with three children, aged 10, 8 and 6 years old respectively, who are all in primary education. One of her goals is to maintain an active business and in this way earn more for her household, as she is the only person contributing to their income. Another of her goals is for her children to continue studying until they complete their education. Yasmina's business is selling general merchandise (cosmetics and clothes) and she has been doing this work for five years. She spends all the time she has on her business, and is 100% dedicated to it. She began offering cosmetics on credit in small amounts, collecting payment on the 3rd and 15th of every month. Her plan is to use this investment as capital to purchase: perfumes, creams, clothes for men and women and other things which will give her the opportunity to achieve her goals. She needs this loan as she needs to fulfil her clients' orders and she does not has enough capital to cover the demands. If she cannot count on the support of our institution and the programs which will help her with her project, it will not be possible for her to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase stock

loans.name: Čaza

texts.en:
Čaza was born in 1969 and she lives in Banovići, a village in Bosnia.  She is married and has two children: an adult son who works as a baker, and a 17 year old daughter who attends high school.  Her husband fought in the Bosnian War in the 1990s and is now disabled. 

Although her husband receives a small disability pension from the government, Čaza is largely the one responsible for supporting her family. She grows vegetables and raises chickens, selling the eggs in the local market. 

Čaza is requesting a loan of 600KM ($400 USD) from Women for Women, International, which she will use to buy more chickens and expand her business.  She hopes that the additional income from the new chickens will help to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Bodé Agathe

texts.fr: Née vers 1983 à  Damè  dans la commune de DANGBO, dame A. Bodé Agathe   est mariée et mère de 1enfant. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement    GF WANGNIME  DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi de la farine et de la boisson. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 110 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1983 in Damè in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Bodé Agathe A. is married and the mother of 1 child. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Wangnime of Hetin Sota, located near the hot springs of Dangbo. She also sells flour and drinks.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Bodé Agathe A. has requested a loan of 110,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Tasileta

texts.en: Tasileta T., 37, is married with 3 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the villagers and general public 3 days per week.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Tasileta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase a gas stove, gas, sausages, soy sauce, bananas and taro

loans.name: Yovany

texts.es:
Yovany es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Yovany es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijas, Yovany es panificadora se dedica a elaborar panes típicos de la zona como wawa, panes al huevo, en un horno alquilado, sus panes los vende de manera ambulatoriamente y también a través de pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
Yovany necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, mantequilla.
Los sueños de Yovany son terminar de construir su casa, brindarles toda las comodidades a sus hijas y que sus hijas sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yovany is a member of the Lila Microfinance Institute. Yovany is a 35-year-old mother with 2 children and a live-in partner. She is a baker who makes regional breads, such as wawa bread (wheat bread eaten to celebrate the day of the dead) and egg bread, in a rented oven. She sells her bread as a street vendor, as well as by order. Yovany needs a loan of 1,400.00 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing flour and butter. Yovany dreams of finishing construction on her house, offering her daughter all the comforts available, and watching them become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour and butter

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: Aida D. est mariée avec 07 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter  et revendre des  perles, de l’encens, de l’eau de Cologne, du beurre de karité et des produits de linge comme l’Omo, le bleu et la gomme arabique. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants.Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Aida D. is married and has seven children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Tenghory Transgambienne for seven and a half years. Her business consists of buying and re-selling beads, incense, cologne, shea butter, and washing products such as Omo (washing powder), detergent, and gum arabic. She wants to strengthen her business. Her income allows her to improve her living conditions and take responsibility for her children's schooling. She is seeking a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell beads, incense, cologne, shea butter, and washing products

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es: Olimpia tiene 55 años, vive con su hija de 12 años en su propia casa. Se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios nativos de su localidad, como papas y quesos. Cada fin de semana viaja a la ciudad capital para vender en los diferentes mercados y también repartir a los clientes que se lo solicitan. Durante 3 años ha asumido el riesgo de perder su mercadería durante el viaje, cuando en tiempo de lluvias hay deslizamiento de tierras en la carretera, lo que le impide avanzar y los productos alimenticios se malogran, esto ocurre durante los primeros meses del año, por lo que ha decidió durante este tiempo vender en su misma localidad. Para el futuro Olimpia desea tener una tienda de abarrotes, por lo pronto seguirá trabajando de esta manera. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y está muy contenta por ser una integrante más de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser partícipe activa del desarrollo del grupo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de más productos, de esa manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, comprará quesos en molde, truchas y otros productos más. El monto que solicita será cubierto en su totalidad.
texts.en:
Olimpia is 55 years old and lives with her 12-year-old daughter in their own home. She sells food products native to her region, like potatoes and cheese. Every weekend she travels to the capital city to sell her wares at various markets and also to make deliveries to customers who have placed orders. For the past three years Olimpia has run the risk of losing her merchandise during the trip because during the rainy season there are landslides on the highway that prevent travel and food products spoil. As this happens in the first few months of the year, she has decided to sell locally during those times. In the future, Olimpia wants to have a grocery store, but in the meantime will continue to work as before. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She is happy to be a member of the community bank and has promised to be an active participant in the group's development. The money that Olimpia is requesting will go towards the purchase of more merchandise. In this way she will increase her working capital, will buy wheels of cheese, trout and other products. The sum that she seeks will be repaid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Aïssetou

texts.fr:
M. Aïssetou est née en 1958 à Nikki une ville historique dans le département du Borgou au nord BENIN. Aïssetou réside à Cotonou depuis 23 ans où elle s’est mariée à BAGRI Kora un employé de la mairie de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Aïssetou a six (6) enfants dont quatre (4) garçons et deux (2) filles, tous scolarisés. Aïssetou vit avec sa famille dans leur propre maison à Kowégbo. Aïssetou vendait de l’igname pilée sur le parc auto de tokpa, marché international du Bénin. Actuellement, Aïssetou vend à domicile des condiments pour la sauce, de l'huile d’arachide et de palme, de maïs en détail, etc. Presque tous les habitants de son quartier viennent s’approvisionner chez Aïssetou. Pour accroître son capital en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Aïssetou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
M. Aïssetou was born in 1958 in Nikki, a historic town in Borgou province in north Benin. Aïssetou has been living in Cotonou for 23 years and she is married to Kora Bagri, an employee of the Townhall of the city of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin.

Aïssetou has six children, four sons and two daughters, all in school. She lives with her family in their own house in Kowégbo. Aïssetou used to sell pounded cocoyams at the parking lot of Tokpa, the international market of Bénin. Presently, she sells out of her home: condiments for stews, peanut oil and palm oil, maize etc. retail. Almost all the inhabitants of her district come to do their shopping at Aïssetou's. In order to increase her working capital so as to better satisfy her clientele, Aïssetou is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for stews, palm and peanut oil, and sacks of maize

loans.name: Jasurbek

texts.en:
Jasurbek B. is a 29-year-old businessman. He is married, and he and his wife have two children. Jasurbek is a farmer, like his wife. They started their farm 4 years ago. In the beginning it was very difficult, because they needed to invest a lot of working capital. With much effort and the help of his wife he was able to move forward and today has a large plot of land. His vegetables are very good quality, which he says is due to the constant irrigation they receive, since the business has a complete underground irrigation system. They sell their products in the fruit and vegetable market of the city. Jasurbek requests a loan for the purchase of fertilizer and seeds. This will allow him to better provide for his family. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kokou Mathias

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un résident du quartier de « dabadacondji », il est marié et père d’01 enfant. Pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il a commencé en 2003 le commerce de céréales qu'il met dans les sacs et dans les bidons et vend en gros et en détail. Il fait ce commerce depuis 2003 et s’approvisionne au marché local de tsévié à l’intérieur du pays. Son stock de céréales est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 13 sacs de maïs, 09 sacs de mil, 10 sacs d’haricots, 05 sacs de riz et assurer le transport.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who resides in the “Dabadacondji” district. He is married and the father of one child. To provide for his family, he started doing commerce in grains in 2003. He puts grain into sacks and drums and sells them wholesale and retail. He has been in this business since 2003 and gets his supplies at the local marketplace of Tsévié, located inland. Since his stock of grain is exhausted, he wants to resupply himself and is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 13 sacks of corn, 9 sacks of millet, 10 sacks of beans, and 5 sacks of rice. He also wants to cover the cost of transport.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, rice, and millet

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 41-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children.

Fouad has been selling and repairing exhaust systems since 1992. He requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase exhaust inventory and tools for his work.

Fouad has been a microcredit client for nine years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business, as well as his financial situation. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his work, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase exhaust parts and tools for his work

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah Q., age 40, is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters who are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Her husband is the pastor of a church. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Hannah is a fish monger who sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square and also supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes the fish herself. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. Hannah's desire is to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Farhat Liaqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Farhat baji, wife of L. A., has lived in a city named Chichawatni, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Her husband sells sugarcane juice; his business grows in summer because people drink a lot of liquid in this season. Farhat baji operates an clothes-embroidering business and she does this work to pay off the utilities. She is seated in a yellow shawl holding a frame in her hands in the photo.

This loan is based on a total of four persons and the other members of this loan are:

Kosar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Rukhsana kosar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Muniran baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugarcane for her husband's juice-selling business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is a 29-year-old married lady with one child. She sells new clothes in Nairobi city where some of her clients are walk-in customers and others are regulars.

Mary was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. She has been in the business of selling clothes for two and a half years. Mary plans to use the funds from this loan as working capital and will buy more inventory for her clothes shop. In the future, Mary hopes to expand her business by opening more shops in the city and she wants to buy a plot of land.
