About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more new clothes to resell

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Rebeca es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Rebeca viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y verduras y de las ferias compra maíz, papa, productos que comercializa en los mercados. Además se dedica a la agricultura de verduras y alfalfa en la comunidad de Totorrilla.
Rebeca necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semilla y para el pago de peones.
El sueño de Rebeca es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a member of the Alondras community bank. Rebeca is married, 50 years old, and has 5 children. Rebeca travels to the different outdoor markets in her region where she sells fruits and vegetables and buys corn and potatoes to commercialize in markets. Additionally, she grows vegetables and alfalfa in the community of Totorrilla. Rebeca needs a loan of 3000 soles that she will invest through the purchase of seeds and use to pay her workers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay workers

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny H. is a woman of faith and courage to overcome poverty that impedes the way of her family to success. She is 31 years old and married to Oliver, who is 34 years old and a vendor. She is a mother to three; a girl and two boys. All of her kids are still young and in elementary grades. She lives in the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines.

In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with hopes of having access to capital for her business of raising hogs. Her previous loans were her capital in starting the business of hog raising and she manages it well and it brings in good income. She wants to continue the business and will make more investments in it.

Now she is requesting a loan of 25,000 pesos as her fifth loan in ASHI to pay for five piglets, 14 sacks of assorted feeds, vitamins and transportation expenses. She believes that her hog raising business will grow and she dreams of expanding it and making it a pig farm. She also dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: To invest in her hog raising business

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La señora Fidelina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 62 años, 03 hijos que ya son independientes y tiene su familia.

Fidelina, es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de verduras y a su edad no tiene dificultad de seguir adelante con el trabajo que realiza, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para ir al mercado central “Pomarosa” de su Distrito, para vender sus productos.

En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que a diario acude a su puesto a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300.00, comprará sacos de yucas, frejoles, racimos de plátanos, limones, culantros y otros productos para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Fidelina, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de las fuerzas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Fidelina belongs to the Micaela Bastidas Community Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is a widow, is 62 years old and has three adult children who have their own families. Fidelina is a woman who is hard-working and a fighter. She is dedicated to selling produce and, at her age, she has no difficulty getting ahead in the work she conducts. She tells us that she feels good about what she does. She gets up at 4AM to go to the Pomarosa central market in her district to sell her products. Currently, she is well-known by her customers who come to her stall on a daily basis to make purchases because she has everything a homemaker needs and it is she who personally attends to them with the charisma she is known for. With this loan of S 1,300, she will buy sacks of yucca, beans, bunches of bananas, lemons, coriander and other products to continue to give better service to her customers. Today, Fidelina feels like a successful woman, with more desire to reach where God pushes her. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for having helped her start her business and also the many other women who wish to grow business-wise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Rev. Sheiku B.'s Group

texts.en:
This are members of a Vocational institute in Makeni. They want a loan of Le 18,000,0000 to help them meet their immediate needs. Some of them want the loan in order to invest in business, some to pay their childrens' school fees and other school related charges and others will like to invest the loan in a house building project. 

Rev. Sheiku B. K. is a teacher at the school and also head of this group. Sheiku wants this loan in order to embark on a house building project he has begun and also pay school fees for his children. Sheiku is a fifty-six years old man, born in Rokupr, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a state registered nurse and they have three children. One of their children is in Senior Secondary School III (SSS III) and the others are in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III). Sheiku is a teacher at this Vocational institute and has been in the teaching profession for seventeen years now.

loans.use: Buy building materials like cements and iron corrugate zincs, and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca tiene 42 años, vive  con su esposo y sus 7 hijos  en su casa propia. Hace 17 años decidió dedicarse a las tareas agrícolas de manera exclusiva y uno de sus cultivos es la alfalfa, la cual vende a las personas que crían animales en su zona, pero también le sirve para alimentar a sus propios animales. Los fines de semana es cuando compra y vende su ganado y esto significa ganancias adicionales a la venta de su alfalfa. Para el futuro, Rebeca quiere intensificar sus actividades, tener más extensiones de terrenos cultivables y más cabezas de ganado.

Este es su 11avo crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y es una de las socias más perseverantes y quien está pendiente del progreso de su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, a direct-seller of cosmetics in her village in Caritan Norte, Tuguegarao,City, has two children: Jennifer -17 years old, a college student studying Chemical Engineering, and Santiago Jr. - 15 years old- a junior high school student.

Maria is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 from the KIVA lenders to purchase additional products to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes that her loan request will be granted. Maria is hoping and praying that she will be able to improve her family's standard of living through the income she generates from her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her cosmetic products sales

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita O. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Teresita is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Afif

texts.en: Afif is a 50 year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.  For the last ten years, Afif has been a taxi driver. Afif is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car and pay for his children's university tuition fees. Afif has been a microcredit client for three years now and has always paid on time. His clients are everyone. Competition is the main obstacle he has been facing. He plans to improve and expand his work in the future, but his main concern now is to give the best education possible to his children so that they can succeed in their lives.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida tiene 57 años, es madre de 4 hijos, los mismos que ya no viven con ella porque ya tiene sus propias familias. En la actualidad vive sólo con su esposo, quien le apoya en todo.

Su actividad principal es la venta jugo de caña, para lo cual cuenta con una pequeña máquina moledora de caña de azúcar en su propia casa que adquirió con mucho esfuerzo. Aida cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es el encargado de moler la caña de azúcar y adquirir el jugo necesario para que ella lo embotelle y lo lleve a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona.
Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año de manera constante y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se mantiene ocupada y activa, además le es muy rentable porque sus jugos son muy demandados y no hay día que deje de vender. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que son personas que ya se conoce y muy responsables. Con el dinero que solicita Aida, comprará más cañas de azúcar para seguir preparar jugo en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Aida is 57 years old, and has 4 sons, who don't live with her anymore because they all have their own families now. Currently she lives with her husband, who supports her with everything. Her main activity is the sale of cane juice, for which she has a small sugar cane grinder in her own home that she bought with a lot of effort. Aida has the support of her husband, who is in charge of grinding the sugar cane and getting the necessary juice that she bottles and takes to sell through different places around her zone. She has been doing this constantly for over a year and has done well. What she likes about her work is that it keeps her busy and active, and it's very profitable because her juices are in high demand and there is never a day when she stops selling it. This is her first MFP credit; she is a member of a communal bank and what she likes about her group is that they are all people she knows, all very responsible. The money Aida is asking for is to purchase more sugar cane and to keep preparing juice in greater quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar cane

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie C. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 33 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Rosalie owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Rosalie joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rosalie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate her business.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Luciana is widowed and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Luciana owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Luciana has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luciana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Luciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Rizkallah

texts.en: Rizkallah is a 30-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Rizkallah has been working as a builder since 2000. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition, especially because he didn’t have a lot of networking. He also had some financial issues. Rizkallah is special in his work because he is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. This is the first time that Rizkallah has requested a loan. Therefore, he requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. In the future, he plans to expand his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la María B. del Barrio Remansito de _C.D.E. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su comunidad.
El comité se Denomina San Roque  están en el Séptimo  Ciclo   con 18  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas.

Cada una realiza una actividad diferente e independiente, con mucho esfuerzo para salir adelante.
La señora Juana P. es una de las integrantes del comité y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Mediante primer crédito que se le otorgó pudo comenzar con su actividad comercial, y actualmente quiere mejorar su negocio ya que cada día cuenta con más mercaderías y para ello ya quiere construir un salón para exponer sus productos, esta actividad los venia realizando visitando las casas de los clientes y también vendía sus productos en su casa, con esto pudo mejorar bastante su negocio. 
Así cada una realiza una actividad diferente con mucho sacrificio y con ello cada una ayuda a su familia, se citan las actividades de cada una.

texts.en:
Maria B. from the Remansito de _C.D.E. started the current committee. She contacted her neighbors and friends to join the committee in her community. It is called Denomina San Roque and is in its 7th loan cycle with 18 members. The group is known in its neighborhood as being very loyal and responsible with each other. Each member has her own independent business that she works hard with to get ahead. Mrs. Juana P. is one of the committee members and she sells cosmetics. With the first loan that she received she could begin her business, and now wants to improve it since every day she has more customers. Because of this she would like to build a room to show her products. She has been selling house to house with her customers and also selling in her home. In this way she has greatly increased her business. So, each member does a different job with a lot of sacrifice, and has been able to help her family. The work of each member is listed below: 1. Juana P. Cosmetics sales 2 Carmen L. Clothing sales 3 Basilia D. Clothing sales 4 Mabel L. Food 5 Arminda L. Clothing sales 6 Rosa L. Casual shoes sales 7 Gricelda L. Food 8 Gladys Ríos Clothing sales 9 Fátima P. Jewelry sales 10 Sergia D. Food 11 Mirian P. Clothing sales and garlic 12 María B. Fruit and vegetables sales 13 María Martínez Prepared food sales 14 María B. Clothing sales 15 Esfigenia Z. Chicken sales 16 Nelsi V. Copetín (snacks) 17 Teofila R. Food 18 Nancy T. Eggs and vegetables sales

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, colognes, face creams, cosmetics and other items

loans.name: Dominga Lucia

texts.es: La Señora Dominga Lucia de 53 de edad, con tres hijos ya adultos, su actividad económica consiste en la venta y elaboración de comida, en el cual se desempeña desde hace 10 años, esta iniciativa surge a raíz de la crisis económica que atraviesa el país y las  familias Nicaragüenses.  La cual la  motivo a obtener  ingresos para su familia subsistiendo de la venta de comida. Ella prepara comida nacional como: gallo pinto, queso frito, enchiladas, tacos, maduros, tajadas, carne asada, pollo frito. La cual ofrece a sus diferentes clientes. Su negocio lo ha administrado de manera efectiva los recursos que le han confiando como organismo de apoyo ya que esto le ha permitido dar educación a su hijo. Es por este motivo que ella solicita este financiamiento utilizado en materia prima necesaria.
texts.en:
Dominga Lucia, 53, has three adult children. Her commercial activity consists in the elaboration and sale of food. She has been in this line of work for 10 years now. She began because of the economic crisis that the country and Nicaraguan families are going through. She needed to produce income for her family's support and she decided to do so through food sales. She prepares national dishes like: gallo pinto (rice and beans), queso frito (fried cheese), enchiladas, tacos, fried plantain, grilled meat, fried chicken for her customers. She runs an efficient business and she has managed her loans well; this has made it possible for her to educate her son. She is asking for funds to buy ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Inaya

texts.en:
Inaya is a 47-year-old married woman. A mother of one dependent child, she opened a small business in the agriculture sector to help her husband with the family's income and to pay for her child's schooling. She works hard with her husband to make profits to be able to finalize the construction and preparations related to their home. She cultivates all types of vegetables according to the season. She also sells plants. 

Today, Inaya is requesting to borrow $1,200 to prepare an agriculture tent to increase her cultivation and be able to make more agriculture products to increase both her sales and income.

loans.use: To prepare an agriculture tent

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en:
This group loan, which consists of 24-members, is located in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mrs. Sokhim L. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a grocery seller who owns a grocery store to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sophat Prach, operates a motorcycle and a trailer offering taxi services to earn for his family.

Mrs. Sokhim L. is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family living.

Mrs. Sokhim L. is 28 years old and the mother of three children: one is a student in the local school while the others are too young to stuD. or work.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Aracelis

texts.es: Aracelis María R. O. tiene 42 años y vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla en La Paz, un  barrio muy comercial en el poniente de la ciudad y un sector que le gusta a Aracelis, porque como dice ella  “la gente está pendiente de uno y nos ayudamos mutuamente”.  Ha estado vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo durante los últimos 3 años con créditos individuales, aunque en su  inicio, hace 10 años, lo hizo en un grupo. Ella hace de todo un poco: tiene un negocio familiar en el que compra pescado en la costa del Caribe para  luego de venderlo en Maicao, ciudad fronteriza con Venezuela,  y en esta última compra mercancías, como ranchos y víveres  para cuando regrese a Barranquilla y venderla a sus clientes; como Aracelis nunca está quieta, trabaja desde hace 15 años vendiendo chance y  hace 6 años añadió mercancías que vendía mediante guías promocionales, este fue su negocio inicial.  Hoy Aracelis pasa  3 horas en las mañanas trabajando en una heladería cerca de su casa donde elabora deliciosas paletas y después se dedica a la venta de chance y a  su negocio actual, que es la  venta de ranchos y víveres y quiere agregar a su vida una nueva actividad y es el servicio de lavadora a domicilio, porque sueña con incrementar sus ingresos para  que cuando su hija pequeña  sea grande   “no le toque tan duro como le tocó a ella”. Ahora está aplicando a  un crédito para comprar esa lavadora y ofrecer el servicio de alquiler y poder iniciar el camino a cumplir su sueño , aprovechando la infraestructura de clientes de  la miscelánea de su hermana que aparece en la fotografía y el conocimiento de su hermano en el arreglo y mantenimiento preventivo de lavadoras.
texts.en:
Aracelis María R. O. is 42 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla in La Paz. It is a commercial area in the west part of the city, it is an area that Aracelis likes because, as she says - people are aware of each other and help each other. She has been connected with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation for 3 years with personal loans, and originally, ten years ago, she was part of a group. She does a little of everything, has a family business where she buys fish on the Caribbean coast and later sells it in Maicao, a city on the border of Venezuela, and there she buys merchandise such as food and general supplies to sell to her customers when she returns to Barranquilla. Since Aracelis never stays still, she has been selling chances for 15 years and 6 years ago she added merchandise that she sold through promotional guides, these were her original businesses. Currently Aracelis spends three hours in the mornings working at an ice cream shop near her home where she makes delicious popsicles, and later she works selling chances and her current business of food and general supplies. She wants to add a new activity, which is providing washing services. She wants to increase her income for her daughter when she becomes bigger. She does not want her to have it as hard as her own life has been. She is currently requesting a loan to be able to buy the washing machine and be able to offer the rental service and get on the road to accomplishing her dreams. She will take advantage the customer base from her sister's store (she appears in the photo) and the knowledge that her brother has in the repair and preventative maintenance of washers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a washer and provide rental services.

loans.name: Merry Chill

texts.en:
Merry Chill C. is from the village of Bularan, Miputak. She is 33 years old. Merry Chill is married, has 3 school-aged and 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Merry Chill owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members. Merry Chill has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP average per month for these activities.

In 2006, Merry Chill joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merry Chill has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair her cab. Merry Chill is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport motor cab used in the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Merry Chill from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport motor cab used in the business.

loans.name: Marck Anthony

texts.en:
Marck Anthony D. P. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 29 years old. Marck Anthony is single. To make a living, Marck Anthony owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marck Anthony has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marck Anthony joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marck Anthony is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marck Anthony from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon D. is from the village of San Jose. He is 35 years old, is married, and has four infant children. Marlon owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. He has been engaged in his business for over twelve years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Marlon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be his twelfth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda A. is from the village of  Cabanaglasan, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Renilda is married and has 30 school-aged children. To make a living, Renilda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Renilda has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Renilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Renilda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Renilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es:
Don Walter es padre de familia de tres hijos, que junto con su esposa, trabajan para lograr dar lo necesario a su familia. Don Walter tiene 43 años de edad, y su trabajo es la toma de fotografía, desde hace varios años, el cual inicio ya que le gusta el escenario de fotografía, a si como ser independiente.
A través de los años logro hacer su casa, de concreto aun faltan mejoras como poner piso en la cocina, pero lo que desea es poder  apoyar a  su esposa con la inversión, ya que se dedica  a la venta de ropa y cosmético el cual es de gran ayuda, ya que ambos dividen los gastos de alimentación, educación, medicina, gastos básicos,  con el objetivo de poder ajustarse ya que todo esta a altos costos, es por tal razón que se esfuerzan a dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Con este préstamo comprara cinco docenas de pantalón wangler  de ambos sexo, camisas para lograr mejores ventas.
Sus planes es seguir aumentando su actividad fotográfica, mediante el financiamiento a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Don Walter is the head of a household of three children, and with his wife he works to provide what is necessary for the family. Don Walter is 43 years old, and has worked for several years in photography, a job which he began since he likes framing pictures and being independent. Throughout the years he built his home out of concrete although it still needs some improvements such as flooring in the kitchen, but what he wants is to be able to help his wife with the investment, because she is devoted to selling clothes and cosmetics. This is very helpful, because they divide the expenses for food, education, medicine and basic expenses with the goal of being able to adjust to higher prices for everything. This is the reason that they strive to give their customers better service. With this loan he will purchase five dozen pairs of wrangler jeans and shirts for both men and women to increase sales. His plans include taking more photographs through long-term financing.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 2 bags of riz and 3 baskets of condiments.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El socio está ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Guido; el tiene 30  años de edad y es conviviente y  tiene 2 Hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de construcción, el socio es obrero y realiza obras, en esta oportunidad el socio quiere comprar un pequeño terreno, para lo cual ha estado juntando y este préstamo le ayudara a completar la cantidad que necesita. El socio es solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar un terreno.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to communal bank "Vamos Juntos" (Together we go); he lives in the neighborhood Arcopata, which belongs to the Santiago district, and Cusco province.

The member is Mr. Guido; he is 30 years old, lives with his partner, and has two children. He alternates his daily work between construction work and is a worker in a construction site. He would like to buy a small piece of land. He already has been saving and this loan will help him complete the remaining amount. The main reason he is requesting the loan is to buy land.

The member is thankful for the people that form a part of this dream by means of this resource and commits to carry out the scheduled loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of land.

loans.name: Deisy Carolina

texts.es:
Deisy es  de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 22 años y  está cursando el 2° año de la carrera de Ciencias Contables en la Universidad del Norte (UniNorte) de la ciudad de Itá. Ella es la segunda entre cuatro hermanos. Su madre es comerciante al igual que su padre.

Deisy actualmente trabaja vendiendo ropas y juguetes para criaturas en un local que comparte  con su madre, donde ella administra sus propias mercaderías que le generan buenas ganancias para sus gastos personales y al mismo tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios. Realiza viajes en forma semanal en el mercado 4 de Asunción para la compra de sus prendas de vestir y los juguetes le provee su padre de Ciudad del Este mediante los viajes que suele realizar a dicha ciudad.

Deisy tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y ejercer su profesión para contar con mejores ingresos y así forjarse un mejor futuro. Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad. Deisy agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio, además de habilitar una línea de crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Deisy is from the city of Itá, is 22 years old, and enrolled in her 2nd year in Accounting Sciences at the Universidad del Norte (UNINORTE) in the city of Itá. She is the second of four children. Her mother is a merchant, as is her father. Deisy presently works selling clothes and baby toys in a stall she shares with her mother. She has her own merchandise and generates good earnings for her personal expenses and at the same time, obtains an income to pay towards her studies. She travels weekly to the 4th market in Asuncion to buy her clothing items, and her father provides the toys from Ciudad del Este when he travels there. Deisy has a strong desire to finish her studies and exercise her profession, in order to count on a better income and fortify herself for the future. She requests a loan to pay the monthly payments required by her school. She is grateful for this loan, which will help with her studies and establish a line of credit with Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay University fees

loans.name: Zainurakhon

texts.en: Zainurakhon M. is 53 years old. She is a widow with three children. Zainurakhon is a market vendor. She sells dishes and plates of an oriental style in the central local market. Zainurakhon has been in this business for 17 years. During these years, the business turned into a successful one, allowing Zainurakhon to support her family. Her business generates the main income for her family. Now Zainurakhon is planning to increase the stock and to purchase the dishes and plates wholesale. For this purpose, she requests 7,000 Somoni. Zainurakhon thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan timely. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing dishes and plates wholesale in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acquire a pruning machine

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa A. is from the village of Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Josefa is widowed and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Josefa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste for sale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles K.  is a hard working business man. The 52 year old married father of 4 children, who are still attending school, sweats his guts out selling bananas from his plantation in a small rural area of Kigarama, Ibanda. He has been doing this business for the last 12 years which he started with advice and support from his parents. He gets many customers who buy his produce for food consumption like; restaurant owners in the area. 

He is able to make an average profit of 364,800 Ugandan shillings monthly. This is a fair earning by any standards He requires a loan that will help him buy more farm supplies like; mulches and manure for his banana plantation.  He will then be able to meet his customer demand and also get more revenue as he looks forward to his family's welfare and education for all his children.

loans.use: To buy mulch for his banana plantation

loans.name: Sofonie De Derak Group

texts.en:
Judex is the coordinator of the Sofonie or Zephaniah group. He lives with his wife and son, Judson. He says that his moS.difficult challenge is finding capital to conduct business because the opportunity is present for those who desire to work. 

Judex is excited to be taking his firS.loan with Esperanza after having heard so much about the great things other associates have been able to do with their loans. He plans to use this loan to inveS.in his two main business activities. He will use part of the loan to add to his savings to repair a motorcycle he had previously purchased. With the remaining portion he will inveS.in a homemade mini movie theater. He will buy extra chairs and purchase DVDs as well. He hopes to use the profits to expand his business, enabling him to be a better provider for his family. 

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients generally. His group is located in De Rak. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of Haiti, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To repair a motorcycle and to purchase DVDs and chairs

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz A. is a hardworking entrepreneur who is always looking for opportunities to grow her business. Through her daily effort, she is bringing her family more hope. 

Over time, she has been able to purchase a fishing boat for her husband to manage and use for fishing. Meanwhile, she is the one who sells his fish directly to people in the local community and the nearby town of Binangonan, Rizal.

The fishing business has brought happiness to Beatriz’s family. Because of its profits, she has been able to support her family’s needs. It has also provided her a way to pay for her only son’s education until college.

Beatriz is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase an additional fishing cage (fish trap) to catch more fish to sell. This will help their business grow and make more profit, which will enable her to attain her goals in life.

loans.use: To buy additional fish traps to catch more fish to sell.

loans.name: Humar

texts.en:
Humar Z. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent.  All his three children attend a local secondary school. 

Humar operates a transportation service with the help of his wife, where he transports people in his town using his own minibus. He drives his bus to transport people while his wife works as a conductor in his minibus. He started his transportation business in 2007 and has gained a lot of experience in his business. He has built a successful and stable operation with his business, and his earnings have enabled him to provide for his entire family. 

Humar needs more fund to repairs his minibus so that they can continue operating their business for a living. Humar is a very clever man and says, " I want to buy one more minibus in order to expand my business."   He is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan in order to purchase tires for his vehicle and make necessary repairs on his vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase tires and make vehicle repairs

loans.name: Mariateresa

texts.es: La Sra. María Teresa tiene 34 años de edad tiene 3 hijos bajo su dependencia, ellos estudian en la escuela de su zona, La Sra.  Maria Teresa es madre soltera porque su esposo la dejó por otra mujer mucho más joven que ella, y su ex esposo no pasa pensiones, además que el lugar donde ellos viven es una casa muy rústica en condiciones no muy habitables para vivir. Quiere mejorar su forma de vida y para ello, solicita un crédito para aumentar el ganado vacuno que le genera ingresos al producir leche y al cual se dedica con mucho sacrificio ya que necesita aumentar sus ingresos comprando otra vaca.
texts.en:
María Teresa is 34 years old and has three children in her care who are all studying in the local school.  Maria Teresa is a single mother because her husband left her for another, much younger, woman.  Her ex-husband doesn't provide them with maintenance.

María Teresa and her family live in a very basic house which isn't in particularly habitable conditions.  She would like to improve her way of life and, for this reason, she is requesting a loan to increase her dairy herd which provide her with income through the milk that they produce.  María Teresa works hard in her business.  She needs to increase her income by buying another cow.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Arajab

texts.en: 34-year-old K. Arajab deals in agro produce  – principally fruits, vegetables, and coffee. He has been in this business for 5 years. He took over this business from his late father, who had many fruit and coffee farms in their area of origin in Namulesa-Jinja.  Arajab also runs a commercial motorcycle business, commonly referred to as boda boda. Weekly, this business brings in 200,000 shillings in profit. With this loan, Arajab says he will purchase more fruits and coffee to resell.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and coffee to resell

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich N., 62, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known for one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. N. sells fruits, earning an income of 5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 20 USD on food and 33 USD on the other necessary expenses. N. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase more fruit to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to stock the store

loans.name: Roel

texts.en: Roel G. owns and operates a general store selling assorted products in his community. He is 39 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Tugas, Baliangao. Roel has been managing his business for five years earns a monthly net income of 8,500. In 2011, Roel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Roel is requesting his first loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock for his store. He plans to use additional income to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his store

loans.name: Oscar Rolando

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene 29 años de edad, reside en el Transito departamento de San Miguel con su mamá, es soltero, administra una tienda y una granja de pollos, estos negocios los comenzó gracias al apoyo de su mamá quien antes manejaba el negocio, trabaja en su propia casa, no tiene un horario establecido y actualmente necesita capital para invertir.
El ha solicitado un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de pollos, concentrado y en mercadería para surtir la tienda.
Esto le ayudara a crecer y fortalecer los negocios, lo que le permitirá atender mejor a los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son crecer y ampliar la clientela y vivir en condiciones dignas con su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 29 years old and lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel with his mom.  He is single and manages a store and a chicken farm.  He began those business thanks to the help of his mother who managed them before.  He works in his own home and doesn't have an established schedule.  Currently, he needs capital to invest.  

He has asked for a loan to invest in the purchase of chickens, chicken feed, and in merchandise to stock the store.  This will help him to grow and strengthen the businesses, which will allow him to better attend his customers.  

His dreams are to grow his clientele and to provide his family with the living conditions they deserve.

loans.use: To buy chickens and merchandise for the store

loans.name: Regina Njeri

texts.en:
Regina has been distributing water in Naivasha town for the last 7 years.  She is 32 years old, married to Atanasio Muriuki and they have one child.  

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy another cart for distributing water as the demand is very high and sometimes she is not able to meet her customer needs.

In future, Regina hopes to diversify her sources of income and open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy another cart for distributing water.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora es una persona muy trabajadora y muy alegre. Ella vive en la zona D. Pampahasi que se encuentra a veinticinco minutos del centro D. la ciudad, vive en casa propia y todos sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta D. dulces y golosinas en un kiosco que esta en una avenida del centro D. la ciudad. Ella trabaja vendiendo en su kiosco desD. hace más D. treinta años. A pesar D. ser una persona mayor ella sale a trabajar desD. muy temprano en la mañana y se queda todo el día en su kiosco. Ella trabaja con emprender desD. hace unos seis años y en ese tiempo siempre demostró ser muy puntual con sus préstamos. Teodora solicita el préstamo para la compra D. chocolates y tarjetas D. teléfono, que son las cosas que mas venD., es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Teodora is a very hardworking and cheerful person. She lives in the Pampahasi area located twenty minutes away from downtown. She lives in her own home and all of her children are grown up and independent. She sells candies and sweets in a kiosk located on a street in downtown. She has been selling in her kiosk for more than thirty years. In spite of her old age she goes out to work very early in the morning and stays all day in the kiosk. She always worked to strive forward and in that time she always demonstrated punctuality with her loans. Teodora is requesting the loan to buy chocolates and telephone cards which are items that sell the most. She is a hardworking and responsible person who is thankful with the support being offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy chocolates and telephone cards

loans.name: Amor Para El Progreso 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Bernandina lives with her three children and their father in a simple setting, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. They live in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a burgeoning tourism industry.

Bernandina is the coordinator of her group Amor Para El Progreso 1, 2 & 3 (Love To The Progress). Her story is not unlike others in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican community, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

Bernandina is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her beauty salon where she sells hair and beauty products. With her loan she will buy a display case and more hair and beauty products. Bernandina will use her profits to invest in her business because she wants to have an improved and sustainable lifestyle. Her most difficult challenge has been to improve her income.

Bernandina thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a display case and more hair and beauty products

loans.name: Phoung's Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Phuong was selected as the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Phuong is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land that she uses to grow rice. She also earns a living by cultivating mushrooms. 

Her husband, Mr. Keom, is a construction foreman who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has four children. Three are attending the local school and the youngest one is 3 years old.

Mrs. Phuong wants to improve her family’s condition, so she is requesting a loan to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina D. is from the village of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Merlina is married and has four young children. To make a living, Merlina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and to pay for the labor cost for farm maintenance. This will be the third loan taken out by Merlina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay labor for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has operated an electronics shop for the past two years, selling items in retail to his neighbours and passers-by. His business's primary challenge is seasonality. 

With the Kshs 70,000 loan he has requested, he would like to purchase electronic items to offer for sale as well as a photocopier for his shop. He decided to join Yehu in order to to access loans to boost his business. 

Peter is unmarried and lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the extended family.

Peter dreams of expanding his electronics sales business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase electronic items to offer for sale as well as a photocopier for his shop

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Epifania is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Epifania buys and sells natural (herbal) medicines in the Philippines. Epifania requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Epifania has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Epifania would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 29 years old and is a married woman with a 1-year-old child. She is a farmer who tills land in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Michelle needs farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers so she applied for a loan to fund her farm. She hopes to earn more and to be able to save for her child’s future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Las Perlitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las perlitas, las integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre ya que en el grupo la mayoría son mujeres y es así como se consideran unas hermosas perlas, la historia es acerca de la señora Lina, ya que es la representante del grupo, ella cuenta con 43 años de edad, está casada con el señor Amadeo con quien tiene 4 hijos, Edmundo, analia, Ariel y pablo, de los cuales solo 3 estudian, la mayor está cursando el primer año de secundaria, y dos más están es quinto y sexto año de primaria, ya que el mayor está casado, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace mas de 7 años.

Doña Lina se decidió por ese negocio, ya que dice que tiene mucha demanda, y le genera muy buenas ganancias, además de que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante, para darles una muy buena calidad de vida, invirtió su crédito en la compra de mas ropa como son: blusas, playeras, vestidos, pantalones, faldas, shorts, camisas y ropa interior, para así tener un mejor surtido.

El sueño que tiene doña Lina y espera algún día poder cumplirlo es el de ampliar  un poco mas su local y para así tenerlo muy bien surtido, ya que es su anhelo mas grande, también para poder mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos y así continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y asegurar su futuro.

Nos dice que los integrantes de su grupo, son personas muy responsables, trabajadoras y puntuales, ya que tienen tiempo de conocerse y se llevan muy bien, puesto que viven en la misma comunidad.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron, ya que gracias a esto su negocio esta mejorando mucho.

Otros de los compañeros de doña Lina son: Elizabeth, francisca, minerva, Edmundo, Sandra, idalia, Emiliana, norma y arlette, quienes realizan variadas actividades como: venta de frutas, madera, pollos, comida, ropa, dulces, zapatos, tamales y algunos abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Perlitas (The Little Pearls).  The members of the group decided on this name as the majority of the group are women and they consider themselves to be beautiful pearls.

This story is about Señora Lina, as she is the representative of the group.  She is 43 years old, and is married to Señor Amadeo with whom she has 4 children; Edmundo, Analia, Ariel and Pablo.  Only 3 of them are at school as her oldest child is married.  Her eldest daughter is in her first year at secondary school, and two others are in the fifth and sixth years of primary school.  Lina works selling clothes, which she has been doing for over 7 years.

Doña Lina decided on this business as she says there is much demand and it generates very good earnings for her.  In addition, she wanted to find a way to advance her children in order to give them a good quality of life.  She will invest her loan in buying more clothes such as blouses, T-shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, shorts, shirts and underwear, so she can offer a better assortment.

Doña Lina's dream, that she hopes someday to be able to accomplish, is to expand her place a little more and have it very well stocked; this is her greatest desire.  She also dreams of being able to improve and increase her earnings, and so continue to support her children with their studies and secure their future.

She tells us that the members of her group are very responsible, hardworking and punctual; they have taken the time to get to know each other, and they get along very well as they all live in the same community.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and to Kiva for the support of the loan that has been granted to her, and thanks to this loan her business is greatly improving.

The other colleagues of Doña Lina are: Elizabeth, Francisca, Minerva, Edmundo, Sandra, Idalia, Emiliana, Norma and Arlette, who engage in various activities such as selling fruit, wood, chickens, food, clothing, candy, shoes, tamales and some groceries.

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as blouses, T-shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, shorts, shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald tiene 20 años; nació en el caserío de Punray, donde ahora vive junto a sus padres y sus 7 hermanos a los que apoya económicamente. Todos ellos residen en su casa que es propia. Este valiente jovencito, ayuda en los gastos económicos de su familia, que por ser numerosa realizan muchos gastos. A pesar de su edad, tiene muchas aspiraciones para seguir estudiando. Todas las mañanas junto a su padre se dirigen a cuidar de sus cultivos de papa; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, ya que tiene que sacar el máximo provecho éstos terrenos que arrienda para poder producir y tener ganancias. Además es muy hábil en la comercialización de su cosecha, en el mercado mayorista de la localidad de Huasahuasi, “capital productora de papa del país”. Con las ganancias obtenidas, pudo comprar chanchos y toros, éste último le ayuda a arar la tierra, así minimiza costos para dicha tarea, ya que anteriormente tenía que contratar peones. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda seguir adelante. Ronald de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Ronald is 20 years old. He was born in the hamlet of Punray, where he lives with his parents and 7 siblings, whom he helps to support. They live together in a house which they own. This courageous youth helps with his family's living expenses - which are high because there are so many in the family. Despite his age, he has great aspirations to continue his learning. Every morning he goes with his father to take care of their potato crop; he takes great care of the crop because they have to get the best out of the plot of land they lease, so that it provides an income. He is also very adept at marketing his harvest, in the wholesale market in Huasahuasi, “the potato producing capital of the country”. With the money earned, he was able to buy pigs and cattle - the latter to help plough the soil. This minimised the cost of ploughing, as previously they had to hire labourers. Ronald belongs to the "Nueva Jerusalen" ("New Jerusalem") communal bank, and this is his first loan with [field partner] MFP. He hopes for a small loan to help him keep moving forward. On receiving your support, Ronald will invest the money in the purchase of a sack of pea seeds for the next planting.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo, a 48-year-old father of three, two of whom are married, while the other is a high school student, is married to Elgrace, who manages a retail shop. Romeo has been engaged in corn farming for 28 years and was able to earn a profit of P9,000 in March, the usual month for corn harvesting. He gave part of the money to his wife to invest in her retailing business, and part was spent for the improvement of their house.

Because of the high cost of farm supplies nowadays, Romeo is requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizer, insecticides and hybrid corn. Another part of the loan will be used to pay labor costs for co-farmers he hires to help him plant corn.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and hybrid corn for his farming.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 48 years old, married and has six children. For the past five years she has raised and sold pigs.

This year Eva became a member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan of 11,500 PHP to buy pig feed. In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
At 53, Ederlina is a widowed woman. Her husband died three years ago from blood cancer. She keeps striving in her business to support herself and her son. She sold fruits and vegetables for a living until she suffered a stroke a year ago. Her son was forced to stop his education to maintain her medication. 

After recovering from sickness, Ederlina ventured into a new type of business: selling clothing. She now manages "ukay-ukay" that is selling branded used clothes and bags from Canada. Her son helps her in the business so she just stays at home and sometimes looks out for customers to buy her products. 

To further grow her business, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy new clothes to sell. She wants to attract more customers and make progress towards the increased income she needs to sustain the business for their daily needs.

loans.use: buy new clothes to sell for her "ukay ukay" business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with two children. She is 45 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Mahayag.

Evelyn sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to  purchase assorted products for her grocery store.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to increase her capital and earn 7,000 PHP a month.

loans.use: to purchase assorted products for her grocery store

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim, 61, resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Kim is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her child is employed at the factory as well to earn money for the family. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 20 on the other necessary expenses. Kim is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius operates a motorcycle transport business to support the family. He has run his business for five years. He also practices dairy farming to supplement his income. In the next five years, he wants to buy a van. 

With his loan funds of 30,000 Kenya shillings, he intends to buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 65 años, es un hombre amable y muy talentoso, convive con su pareja, él aún no tiene hijos pero su pareja sí, que ya son mayores e independiente. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la ebanistería, es un artista diseñanado muebles, pues trabaja con la madera, le da forma y arma sus lindos productos, su especialidad son las sillas, mesas, sofa, entre otros. Tiene un taller que monto en su casa, ahí es donde trabaja todos los días para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Tiene 16 años realizando esta actividad, pero hay momentos que tiene mucho pedidos que necesita contratar personas para que lo ayuden.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de tiempo, es independiente y no tiene que rendir cuentas a nadie, por ello disfruta su trabajo, y gracias a ello logró educar a sus hijos políticos, como hijos si fueran sus hijos. Este será el créstamo número once con MFP le esta yendo bien y esta muy contenta de trabajar con su grupo ya que son muy responsables, esta muy agradecida pues los prestamos recibidos anteriormente le fueron de mucha ayuda y fueron muy bien invertido, espera contar nuevamente con su ayuda. Con el monto solicitado, comprará madera para que pueda tener ya fabricados su muebles.
texts.en:
Orlando is 65 years old.  He is a kind and very talented man who lives with his partner.  He doesn't have children himself but his partner does.  They are grown up and live independently.  Orlando and his partner live together in their own home.

Orlando is a carpenter.  He is an artist who designs furniture.  He works with wood and forms and assembles his beautiful products.  His specialities are chairs, tables, sofas, etc.  He has a workshop which he set up in his home.  This is where he works every day in order to fill the orders from his customers.  He has been in this business for 16 years and there are times when he has a lot of orders and needs to hire people to help him.

What Orlando enjoys about his work is the fact that he chooses how to spend his time, he is independent and he doesn't have to account to anybody.  For this reason, he enjoys his work and it has enabled him to educate his stepchildren as if they were his own children.  This will be his eleventh loan from MFP.  His business is doing well and he is very happy to be working with his group as they are all very responsible people.  He is very grateful as the previous loans that he received were very helpful and very well invested.  He hopes to be able to count on your help once again.  He will use the sum he has requested to buy wood so that he can make his furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Dry Fish Sellers Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Dry Fish Sellers” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 600,000 SLL per member in order to invest in their businesses. This will be the second loan from SMT/Kiva lenders to benefit this group of entrepreneurs.

Fatmata is the leader of this group. She is 36 years old and married, with 3 children who attend primary school.  Fatmata sells dried fish and has been a businesswoman for many years. With the help of this loan, Fatmata will invest in her business by buying about 5 baskets full of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy about 5 baskets of fish

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita, ha tenido que buscar trabajo fijo en zona franca, ya que su negocio de venta de ropa usada, las ventas bajaron, lo que las ganancias eran poca y no estaba solventando sus gastos,devido a esto  toma la decision de buscar trabajo.su sueldo no es alto, pero lo tiene fijo el ingreso del mes.

Ya que es madre soltera y no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie, sus dos hijos estan casados,yc cuenta con el aporte economico de ellos. Con este nuevo prestamo es para poder terminar la construccion de su baño y comprar inodoro, y asi poder tener mejor higiene, ya que estan juntos y no tienen puertas. Lo que comprara materiales de construccion para comenzar la obra. El cual solo por este medio se equilibra para poder pagar todos los gastos, ya que son cuotas mensuales. como planes a futuro es seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rita has had to look for employment in the free zone because in her used clothes business sales have dropped.  Profits were few and she wasn’t making enough to cover her expenses.  Because of this she made the decision to seek employment.  Her salary isn’t high but it is a steady monthly income.  She’s a single mother and has no help from anyone, her two children are married and she gets a little economic help from them.  

The new loan is so that she can finish building her bathroom and to buy a toilet to improve hygiene since they are together and have no doors.  She will buy building materials to start the project.  This is the only way she can balance out and pay all her expenses which are monthly payments.  Her future plan is to continue improving her house.

loans.use: to finish building the bathroom and to buy a toilet.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 49 years old, married and has three sons. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband is a farmer by profession and works in the field. He works very hard and grows different seasonal crops to earn income for his family. 
Salma operates a dairy business and sells buffalo milk to clients in her community. Besides her business, she also performs her household duties very well.

Salma has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for further expansion of her milk selling business. With the loan she will buy another buffalo that will allow her to get a larger quantity of milk to sell and increase her profits. She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past many years. She is confident that a loan investment will be productive for her and will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for a milk selling business

loans.name: Berdimurot

texts.ru: Бердимурот уже три года как занимается скотоводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его сыновья находятся в России на заработках. Он берет кредит для закупа несколько бычков, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Berdimurot has been engaged in animal husbandry for three years. He makes a living by breeding large horned cattle. He is 56 years old. He is married and has seven children. His sons are working in Russia. He is taking the loan to purchase of a few calves to increase the number of cattle.

loans.use: to buy several calves.

loans.name: Chamabele B Group

texts.en:
Jacob is the facilitator of the Chamabele B group. Jacob and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jacob takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Jacob had a good maize yield harvesting 5 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Jacob was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jacob and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jacob will save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Chamabele B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel is 34 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 17 years old. Jessel's husband works as a farmer.

Jessel has been selling firewood to her community for the past 10 years. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month with this business. Jessel plans to use her loan to buy more firewood to sell. Jessel hopes for this loan to help improve her business. She also hopes for her family's living situation to improve.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Luz Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Rocío es una mujer que se dedica a pleno a su único hijo de 15 años, ella hace todo lo que está en sus manos para poder sacar a su hijo adelante. A Rocío le hubiese gustado poder estudiar para convertirse en Abogada, pero por algunas complicaciones sus padres no pudieron pagarle la carrera profesional. Rocío es de la ciudad de Ica, la que se encuentra ubicada en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.

En la actualidad ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, en promedio trabaja 12 horas diarias, lo que le permite tener un ingreso de S/.44.

Ella piensa que su negocio tiene éxito por la rápida atención que brinda a sus clientes, también se dedica al cuidado de niños con la finalidad de generar un ingreso adicional y pagar todos los gastos que asume mensualmente.
Gracias a los prestatarios Kiva ella podrá implementar nuevas bebidas en su tienda, esto le permitirá satisfacer los nuevos pedidos de sus clientes, vender más y generar el dinero que necesita para poder cumplir su sueño “Tener una tienda bien grande”
texts.en:
