Rocío is a woman completely dedicated to her only, 15-year-old, son.  She does everything in her power to move him ahead.  Rocío would have liked to  go to school to become a Lawyer but because of some complications her parents were unable to pay for her professional career.  

Rocío is from the city of Ica which is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country’s capital, and is called by Peruvians “The Land of the Sun.”  It is known in Perú for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.9 in 2011), its grape, asparagus and olive production and, above all, as the source of Perú’s traditional beverage, Pisco.  In this hot, arid climate we find the member’s house and her business.  She currently sells soft-drinks.  On average, she works 12 hours a day which allows her to earn an income of 44 soles.

She believes that her business is successful because of the quick customer service she provides.  She also works taking care of children to earn extra income and pay all her monthly expenses.

Thanks to Kiva lenders she will be able to stock new beverages in her store to fill new customer orders, sell more and generate the money she needs to reach her dream of “Having a really big store.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (soft-drinks and beer).

loans.name: The United Group

texts.en:
Amidu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Amidu was born in Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and the couple have one child together who is attending secondary  school. Amidu sells stationery and has been doing this business for seventeen years now.

With the help of this loan, Amidu and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Amidu will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy exercise books to add to his business. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy exercise books to add to his business inventory.

loans.name: Fuigaveve

texts.en:
Fuigaveve is thirty-eight years of age and is married with one child. She owns & operates a business venture, selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local community members.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  She needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase raw materials such as pandana leaves to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 560 talas or US $233 per week) to expand the business.

In 2010, Fuigaveve joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fuigaveve's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase more pandana leaves to make mats for sale.

loans.name: Munhdelger

texts.en: Mrs.Munhdelger is 43 years old, lives with her husband and her three children in small house in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Mrs.Munhdelger is a good behaved and hardworking woman. Her husband name is Batmunh, he herdsman. Her older son name is Lhagvadorj, he go to the high school, her older daughter name is Tserendolgor, she goes to the secondary school, her younger daughter named Byambadulam, goes to the secondary school. She started retail trade business in 2010. Her monthly income does not usually meet her family's necessities. She is requesting 3,000,000MNT loan to purchase goods from Ulaanbaatar for her business. Mrs.Munhdelger goal is own grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase goods from Ulaanbaatar for her business

loans.name: Jlg-017(A)-Thanneerpalli Group

texts.en:
Davamani is 34 years old and is from Kulithalai in rural Tamil Nadu. She finds it hard to make ends meet with her meagre income of Rs. 9,500. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity.

Davamani's family of five is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, the family members are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in her family are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

Joining hands with two others whose families also face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Davamani has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives, the group now seeks a loan of Rs. 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet.

loans.name: Erika Guadalupe

texts.en:
Hello. My name is Erika and in my country one of the traditional breads is the rosquilla. I manufacture and sell these. I ahve been doing this for a few years now and make a good income. Demand has grown and I have several orders from resturants and general stores. This is a family business since my husband collects the orders. This business helps support my children and me.

Loan Use: Purchase curd, corn, butter, salt, firewood and other materials

Hola me llamo Erika y en mi pais uno de los panes tradicionales es la rosquilla, me dedico a la elaboracion y venta. Tengo algunos años de dedicarme a este negocio del que he obtenido buenos ingresos y la demanda ha crecido ya que tengo varios pedidos de restaurantes y pulperias. Este negocio es familiar ya que mi esposo me ayuda a entregar los encargos. Los ingresos que percibo me ayudan a mantener a mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de cuajada, maiz, manteca, sal, leña y otros

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar was born in 1972 in Yenikand village, Salyan region. She is married and has 2 children. She has been a cattle breeder since 2004. She is a role model to many woman. 
She requests a loan of $800 to buy 2 pregnant calves She works hard for the success of her children. She wants to improve her business and her revenue, which will result in better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy 2 pregnant calves

loans.name: Sule

texts.en: Mrs. Sule H. is a lovely and faithful mother of two children. She is 29 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells plastics and rubber to the community. She hopes to use the loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock of fruit

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: For taro plantation owner Tin, her family of six is her main priority and because of this, she does everything to provide for them, no matter what. When she first heard about SPBD, she requested assistance and with her first loan, purchased supplies to start her business.  Thus, the business is flourishing and she would like to buy chemicals and fertilizers to ensure that the products are of the best quality.  Money from the sales will help to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 53-year-old mother of three and a resident of the Tandiika area in Dar Es Salaam city. She keeps poultry--both broilers and layers. She has been in business for the past 7 years and helped her sustain her family with income from her birds. She supplies her poultry to nearby restaurants and individual customers do come to her home. Anna is in need of $550 to help her boost her business.

loans.use: To increase her poultry business

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is 23 years old and married. She has been selling bags, some of which are made by her husband, who is a tailor. Sometimes she sells sandals on credit and usually earns $3 per week. She is requesting a $125 loan as additional capital for her business. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda Espinal is a young mother with responsibility for 2 school-age children. Her children have been the reason why she works so hard selling clothing in Chinandega.

Brenda started her clothes-selling business 8 years ago, but in order to start this business she had to quite studying, because her family's situation was becoming more and more difficult and her little ones were being born.

The business is very profitable for her. Sales have increased considerably each year and she has been able to invest more into the business.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for the past two years and is pleased with the loans she has received as they have been given to her in opportune moments, helping her to meet the needs of her business and those of her clients. She has a record of 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Brenda Espinal es una joven madre con 2 hijos a su responsabilidad el cual se encuentran en la edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido la razón por la que ella muy esforzadamente trabaja en la venta de ropa en Chinandega.

Desde hace 8 años Brenda inicia su negocio de venta de ropa en su localidad pero para poder haber iniciado este trabajo tuvo que dejar de estudiar porque la situación de su familia se ponía cada vez más difícil y además estaban naciendo sus pequeños.

Este negocio es muy rentable para ella, hoy en día sus ventas han incrementado considerablemente al paso de los años y ha podido invertir más en su negocio.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos año por lo que se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Es importante destacar que ella tiene un record de 10 créditos.

loans.use: Investment in her business.

loans.name: Truong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Truong Thi Y., 36 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva's partner) since 2003. Her husband is a disabled veteran (He lost one arm). Mrs. Y. is pretty much the sole bread winner in the family. Her two children are still small, making her life even harder. She always try to best use her loans. She has used the loan to buy sundry goods to wholesale. Her family income has improved significantly over time. She is able to furnish her house with a television and a refrigerator. Mrs. Y. is applying for another loan of 400 USD to buy more sundry goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong NguY., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trương Thị Yến, 36 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2003. Chồng là thương binh mất một cánh tay, công việc kinh tế gia đình chủ yếu trông vào chị. Hai con còn nhỏ, hoàn cảnh khó khăn, chị Yến luôn tìm mọi cách để sử dụng đồng vốn vay có hiệu quả. Qua các năm vay vốn chị dùng tiền vay về lấy hàng tạp phẩm về bán buôn cho các hộ gia đình bán lẻ. Đến nay gia đình kinh tế đã dần dần nâng lên, chị đã sắm được các vật dụng như tivi, tủ lạnh ... Chị đang làm hồ sơ vay thêm vốn về để đi lấy hàng về bán. Mức xin vay của chị Yến là 400USD

loans.use: Buy sundry goods to wholesale

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao H. is 56 years old, is a mother of ten children, and works as a farmer on her rice field. Each day she generates approximately $0.50 of profit. To supplement their household income, her husband also works as farmer and typically earns $0.50 per day as well. Five of their children work in a garment factory in Phnom Penh and earn a salary of $80 per month. The couple is seeking a $600 loan from Kiva to purchase sand, wood, and other raw materials to renovate their house because the house is old and needs improvements.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to renovate their house.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta I. has been in business for four years now. She runs a flea market business in the City of Apia selling shoes. This business has helped Elisapeta support her family, especially her children's education. She has a very good loan history and has already paid back her previous loans with no difficulties. Elisapeta has 5 grown up children, with two of them working now, and three still in school. She is requesting a loan of $1000 which she will use to purchase 3-dozen  shoes for her business and also iron roofing for her house.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for her flea market

loans.name: Lucia's Msimamo Group

texts.en:
Lucia is married and has two children, ages 8 and 6. Lucia owns a small food sales business, which she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 7 am to 6 pm at her food store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$50.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items for sale. Lucia will share this loan with her sub-group members Halima and Tausi, who earn money selling bananas, charcoal, and clothes.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Mpagi, Kyosiga Group

texts.en: M. Godfrey, 30, has a "boda boda" (a term used for the motorcycle business in Kayunga). He is married with four children, all in school, and he looks after orphans belonging to his late brother. Godfrey purchased his small "Mate" motorcycle second hand one year ago.   It has been giving him a hard time, and now he needs a loan to fix his motorcycle’s engine. His dream is to buy a new and much bigger motorcycle called "TVS" or "Bajaj." He believes that as long as he is still in his lending group, Kyosiga, he will achieve his dream.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle engine.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef, a 44-year-old married man, father of 1 child, lives in the area of Nabatieh in South Lebanon. Youssef uses his small truck to sell vegetables around his town and from one village market to other. He needs the amount of USD 1,200 to purchase a bigger pick-up truck. Once he gets this larger truck, he will be able to increase the merchandise he is selling and therefore increase his income and improve the livelihood of his family. Youssef has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 4 years and always repays his loan on time.

loans.use: USD 1,200 to purchase a bigger pick-up truck

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 33-years-old and married with two children, ages 17 and 15. She began selling clothes in 2006. She works from 8AM to 6PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Jane has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and she want to open a new business (kiosk).

loans.use: To buy more clothes and open a kiosk

loans.name: Assumane Chical

texts.pt:
Assumane Chical C. tem 40anos nasceu em Nampula, estudou até 8ªclasse, é casado e pai de três filhos: um menino de 13anos, um menino de 3anos e uma menina de 1ano, só o mais velho já vai a escola.

Assumane mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira com Suazilândia em 1977 a procura do emprego, trabalhou alguns anos como guarda numa residência e conseguiu abrir uma banca no mercado central de Namaacha. Assim Assumane decide abandonar o emprego e dedicar se ao negócio,hoje ocupa três bancas, vende produtos de primeira necessidade, conta com ajuda dos seus dois sobrinhos que vivem com ele e dá lhes mensalmente um subsidio de 500,00mtn . Trabalham das 7h as 22h  tem como melhores produtos (lâmpadas,  fios electricos e colas), tem um rendimento mensal de 6.000,00mtn,  não consegue poupar mas já tem sua casa propria e construiu um pequeno estabelecimento comercial no mesmo terreno que vai funcionar como mercearia e vai trabalhar a sua esposa. Para alem da sua familia Assumane sustenta sua mãe que vive em Nampula enviando lhe em cada seis mêses um valor de 1,000.00mtn.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Assumane com Hluvuku e com Kiva no valor de 11,000.00mtn que será usado na compra de produtos para suas bancas, está confiante que vai reemblosar o valor antes do prazo. Pretende pedir mais emprestimo para comprar uma viatura para lhe ajudar nas compras, pois gasta muito dinheiro pelo transporte.
texts.en:
Assumane Chical C. is 40 years old, was born in Nampula, studied until the eighth grade, and is married with three children: a 13-year-old boy, a three-year-old boy, and a one-year-old girl. Only the oldest attends school. In 1977, Assumane moved to Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland, to look for work. He worked for a few years as a guard in a residence and was able to open a booth in the central market of Namaacha. Thus, Assumane decided to leave his job and dedicate himself to his business. Today he has three booths and sells basic products with the help of his two nephews who live with him. He gives his nephews a monthly allowance of 500 MT. They work from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. selling the best products (including lamps, electric wire, and adhesives). They earn 6,000 MT per month. He has not been able to save, but he already owns his own home, and has built on his land a small commercial establishment that will function as a grocery store, tended by his wife. Besides his family, Assumane supports his mother, who lives in Nampula, sending her 1,000 MT every six months. This is Assumane’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. The loan is for 11,000 MT and will be used to purchase products for his booths. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan before the due date. He intends to request another loan to buy a vehicle to help with his purchases, because he spends a lot of money on transportation.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Mwanaisha's Jiwezeshe Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 30 years old. She is widow with 2 children aged 9 and 5 years old. She has run her own school since 2006. Everyday she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Mwanaisha is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with shop owning, juice sales, fish and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa C. tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casada, y tiene una hija de 11 años de edad. Trabaja en un colegio de Managua y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de perfumes y zapatos, tiene 4 años de experiencia en estas ventas, y 8 años de trabajar para éste colegio. El negocio de las ventas lo inició debido a la necesidad de tener más ingreso para sustentar a su familia. El préstamo solcitado será usado para la construcción de un baño en su vivienda, ya que actualmente no tiene uno completamente acondicionado, y desea darle mayor comodidad a su familia
texts.en:
Rosa C. is 42 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood. She is married and has an 11 year old daughter. She works at a school in Managua and in her free time she dedicates herself to the sale of perfumes and shoes. She has four years of experience in these sales and has been working for the school for 8 years. She started her business in sales because of her need to increase her income in order to support her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to build a bathroom in her home as she currently does not have one that is fully equipped and she wishes to provide the most comfort for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom.

loans.name: Tozagul

texts.ru: Калонова Тозагуль проживает в районе Шахринау. Имеет свой бизнес. Имеет столовую на центральном рынке района. Замужем и имеет троих детей. В данный момент помещение в котором она работает необходимо сделать ремонт. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом со сроком в 12 месяцев. Ремонт в помещение поможет привлечь новых клиентов и соответственно увеличить прибыль.
texts.en:
Tozagul K. lives in the Shahrinau region. She is married and has three children. Tozagul manages her own business - a cafe at the region's central market. Currently the space where her cafe is located is in need of improvement. To finance the construction Tozagul needs to take out this loan for the next 12 months. Improving her cafe will help her attract new clients and increase the profits from her business.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement of retail space

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. is 30 years old and married with three children. Her husband is an automobile mechanic. She sells foodstuffs like yams, melon seed, pepper, etc. With the festive period fast approaching, she hopes to stock her shop to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en: Firangiz  was born in 1964, is married and has one child. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, and is now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Bahmanli village. She has been in the clothes-selling business for five years, and she is requesting a loan so she can improve her business and better provide for her child.

loans.use: To buy clothes stock for her business

loans.name: Hugo Danilo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo tiene la edad de 56 años, se dedica a la carpintería desde hace doce años, negocio que inicio con ahorro de su trabajo anterior, que era la construcción, un trabajo cansado pero se gana bien, , don Hugo reside en Memorial Sandino, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 12 y 14 años de edad, que estudian la primaria en el colegio del barrio, sus planes es poder terminar de construir su casa ya que es la mitad de piedra y tabla es un poco insegura, con esta solicitud va invertir en materiales de construcción para construir las paredes de concreto y poder ofrecer una casa digna a su familia, esta es su cuarta solicitud en Afodenic y han sido de muchos beneficios para su familia ya que ha podido poco a poco  lograr sus metas, lo cual espera seguir trabajando para cada día mejorar las condiciones de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Hugo is 56 years old. He has worked in carpentry for twelve years. He started his business with savings from his former job, which was in construction, a job which was exhausting but paid well. Mr. Hugo lives in Memorial Sandino with his wife and two children, who are 12 and 14 years old and attend the local primary school. Their plan is to try to finish the construction of their house, which is already half built out of stone. Lumber is not very strong, so with this loan Mr. Hugo will invest in construction materials so that he can build concrete walls and be able to offer his family a dignified place to live. This is his fourth loan from Afodenic, and the loans have greatly benefited his family because little by little they have been able to achieve their goals. He hopes to continue working so that each day he can improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his home

loans.name: Fatai

texts.en: Fatai is 40 years old and married with 3 children. He sells dried yams for making yam flour. He is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase more dried yam to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried yam to sell

loans.name: Nelva Florencia

texts.es:
Nelva es socia del Bancomunal El sembrador.
Nelva es casada, tiene 43 años  dos hijos de 20 y 22 años trabajan y estudian en instituto. 
Nelva siempre se dedico a trabajar en ventas de muchas cosas pero ahora sé esta dedicando mas a  la venta de queso, reparte a domicilio a sus vecinas, en la semana  trabaja  limpiando casa  tres veces por semanas; Vende gaseosas y cerveza en su casa.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió ha organizarse en el negocio y como administrarlo, sus ventas aumentaron, le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal son muy familiares y amenas.  
Nelva necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para comprar cerveza, gaseosa y queso.
El sueño de Nelva es que su capital aumente para poner una tienda y abrir una cochera en un terreno que tiene.
texts.en:
Nelva is a member of the communal bank "El sembrador". She is 43, married, with two children 20 and 22, both working and studying. Nelva always works selling many various things, but now she sells cheese, distributing it to the homes of her neighbors. During the week she also works cleaning house 3 times per week. She sells soft drinks and beer from her home. Since she has been in FINCA, she has learned how to organize her business and how to administrate it, and her sales have grown. She enjoys the communal bank meetings, they are very family-like and pleasant. Nelva needs a loan of US$275 to buy beer, soft drinks, and cheese. Her dream is to increase her capital in order to have a shop and to open a garage on some land that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer, soft drinks, and cheese

loans.name: Yawo Amen

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a eu une formation en cuisine, en 2008 il a ouvert son propre cafetariat qu’il a appelé « cafetariat BARRACK », les gens de son quartier viennent manger chez lui les soirs mais souvent il réalise plus de bénéfice les week-ends, son stock de produits de première nécessité pour les activités du cafetariat étant presque épuisé il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter  04 boîtes de MILO, 30 boîtes de lait, 02 cartons de spaghetti, 15 plateaux d’œufs et des légumes. Il est marié et a 01 enfants, c’est avec cette activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a trained cook and in 2008, he opened his own cafeteria that he calls « cafetariat BARRACK ». People in his neighborhood come to eat at his place in the evenings, but he often makes more profit on the weekends. Since his stock of staples for the preparation of meals is almost expended, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 4 tins of Milo (cocoa drink powder), 30 cartons of milk, 2 cases of spaghetti, 15 trays of eggs, and some vegetables. He is married and has one child, and it is this business that allows him to support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of staples for his cafeteria dishes

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри Исобоева  1962 года рождения, замужем имеет 4 детей. Торгует на рынке более 7 лет. Раньше торговала не далеко от своего дома мелочами. После получения займа поменяла свой бизнес на торговли обувью. она торгует тапочками и сланцами. Самый ходовой  товар у нее это тапочки, в основном покупают женщины. Зимой она продает зимнюю обувь, сейчас сезон весенней-летней обуви. Планирует расширить сезонный товар на лето.
texts.en:
Mehri I. was born in 1962, she is married with 4 children. She has been trading at a market for over 7 years. Previously, she was selling small items near her home. After receiving a loan, she changed her business and now sells shoes. She sells house shoes and flip-flops. Her best-selling products are house shoes, which are mostly purchased by women. In winter Mehri sells winter shoes. Currently, it is the season for spring and summer shoes. With the loan she plans to expand her product offering for the summer.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Ndèye Coumba

texts.fr: Ndèye Coumba S. est une veuve de 50 ans avec 6 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle voudrait renforcer son activité de vente d’habit qu’elle a toujours mené. Ses revenus lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ndèye Coumba S. is a 50-year-old widow with six children who are in her care. She would like to bolster her clothing business, something she has always worked at. Her revenues enable her to improve her children's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in clothing

loans.name: Egide

texts.en:
Greetings from H. Egide, a 28 year-old married man with 4 children of the following ages: 9, 7, 5 and 3 years old. He lives in Jali sector, Gasabo district of Kigali city, capital of Rwanda. This entrepreneur owns a retail shop in Jali district. This shop contains different kinds of merchandise. This entrepreneur is seeking his first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company and with this loan Egide will buy more mechandise especially a lot of sugar and salt and soaps. This entrepreneur has the monthly profit of approximately $310 and his wife does not produce an income.

Mr. H. started this business in the year of 2003 and he has 2 regular workers to help in running this business. He opens his shop at 7:00 A.M and closes at 7:00 P.M every day. With the increased profit he will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: Expand the business.

loans.name: Armando Richard

texts.es: Armando Richard es una persona muy trabajadora de 40 años que se dedica a la confección de "Polleras" (ropa típica de Bolivia para mujer, es una especie de falda larga.). El comenzó con esta actividad gracias a su madre, ya que ella también se dedica a la costura. Actualmente él y su familia viven en su propia casa. Armando trabaja con esta actividad hace más de 15 años, durante los cuales también aprendió acerca de cocina tradicional de nuestro país. Él es muy responsable y esmerado con su trabajo ya que todos los clientes que tiene están muy contentos y satisfechos con los trabajos que él realiza.
texts.en:
Armando Richard is a hard working 40 year old who sews "Polleras" (typical Bolivian women's clothing - a type of long skirt). He started in this line of work thanks to his mother, who was also a seamstress. He and his family own their own home. Armando has made Polleras for 15 years, and he has also learned about traditional Bolivian cooking. He is very responsible and conscientious and all of his customers are very happy and satisfied with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rolls of fabric

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
S. akossiwa exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de boissons alcoolisées locales appelées « SODABI », elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de cartes de recharges. Elle s’approvisionne en boissons à l’intérieur du pays à KOUVE. Son stock actuel de sodabi a diminué, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 07 bidons de sodabi et des cartes de recharges.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
S. Akossiwa earns revenues through commerce in a local alcoholic drink called "SODABI". She has included with this commerce the sale of recharge cards (for mobile phones). She supplies herself from within the country, in KOUVE. Her current stock of sodabi is diminished. Wanting to stock up again, she is requesting a loan to buy seven drums of sodabi and some recharge cards. She is married and the mother of four.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages and recharge cards

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. Mary sells kenkey at Amissanu in Elmina, which she has done since 2001. Her husband is an ex-civil servant. Mary uses her income to pay for rent and other bills. Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize to increase production of the kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to build a provision store.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to increase production of the kenkey.

loans.name: Zacharie

texts.fr: Zacharie est marié et est père de trois enfants. Zacharie vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin . Zacharie n'a jamais été à l'école. Zacharie est né des parents pêcheurs et très tôt, il fut initié à la pêche qui est la principale activité de son village natal. Mais depuis quatre ans, Zacharie s'est mis à l'exploitation de sable lagunaire qu’il vend. Zacharie a besoin de moyens financiers pour acheter des matériels de travail. C’est la raison pour laquelle Zacharie sollicite crédit d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Zacharie is married and the father of three children. He lives with his family in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. He never attended school. He was born to parents who fished. And very early on, he was introduced to fishing, which is the principal activity of his native village. But four years ago, Zacharie started making use of lagoon sand, which he sells. He has need of funding to buy equipment and supplies for work. This is why he is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for his business

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
This is Cornelia C., who is 40 years old. Her husband Apolinario, age 52, is a street vendor. They have six children, only two of whom still attend school.

Cornelia has been selling soft drinks, bottled water, biscuits, candy, and newspapers to commuters for a couple of years. She also offers mobile phone credits. The business is going well because her small place is in a bustling area right at the foot of a busy train station used by commuters who always need a cold drink. She makes P30, 000.00 a month from this activity.

Cornelia likes her work a lot because she meets a lot of people and she sometimes engages them in interesting conversations. She uses her earnings to cover family’s expenses and she’s saving so she can have a bigger "sari-sari" (general) store in the near future. Her small space is always a victim of frequent clearing operations done by the city hall operatives.  

Cornelia needs a loan of P27,000.00 to expand her business. This is her 10th loan from the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. What she likes most about her fellowship group is the level of trust and camaraderie among all the members. She will use the loan money to apply for business accreditation with a prominent telecommunications company, which will provide easier access to mobile phone credits.   



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. 

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Mobile phone credits

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a member of the Maendeleo  borrower group in Nzonwe, Mbeya. She is 39  year old  woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 18, 16, and 13 years old.

Neema has owned a  charcoal business  for  2  years, she works 10 hours a day and she  earns a monthly profit  approximately  40,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Neema`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she  requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her  business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of  this loan, Neema hopes to save more money and expand  her  business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal  for  sale

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha es una mujer trabajadora y muy colaboradora, vive en el distrito D. Manantay, tiene 49 años y es madre D. cinco hijos, D. los cuales tres son mayores D. edad y dos son menores, se dedica a la venta D. granos como frijol , arroz, maíz, ella venD. en el puerto D. Pucallpa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, él se dedica a la venta D. madera. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesús D. Nazareth” desD. hace seis años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en abarrotes, ella necesita un crédito D. 2000 soles que será utilizado para comprar granos. La meta D. Martha es  tener una tienda D. abarrotes en general.

loans.use: compra de granos para luego venderlo en los mercados.

loans.name: Yany Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Jenny es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Locumba” del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 19 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo, vive en el Barrio Casani, ella  tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudios de educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace medio año, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de corderos.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde, la señora Yeni vende los corderos luego de mejorarlos en las ferias zonales.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando y educar a su hijo.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones, los ahorros y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 60 years old and a resident of Larion Alto, Tuguegaro, City. She and her husband were blessed with six children: Marites, 39 years old; Gilbert, 36 years old; Michael, 34 years old; Mary Jane, 28 years old; Junel, 26 years old and Mary Ann, 23 years old. All of them are married and live separately from Isabel and her husband. Isabel has been a hog-raiser for more than ten years. She started this kind of business to assist her husband in providing the needs of their family and also for their farming business. Her children are their inspiration to work hard and for them to have a progressive way of living.

Isabel is applying for a loan from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP20,000. This amount will be used to buy more piglets for her piggery, in order for her to have an increase in income. She is hoping that the lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets

loans.name: Jumakul's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Jumakul, 56 years old. For 10 years, she and her husband have been breeding livestock and trading in sheep. Then they invested about twelve dollars to purchase cattle. This investment has turned into a monthly income, which is 10 times more than the original amount. They have raised three children. The eldest daughter, 32 and the middle son, 27, both are married and live separately. The little son, 22, is a college student. He is the only one who still lives with parents. Jumakul’s husband stays at home and is busy looking after cattle, whereas Jumakul goes to the cattle market and she is the one who makes all the purchase and sale deals. They used to keep and sell sheep. Afterwards they switched to horses. Animal husbandry has appeared to be a quite profitable business for Jumakul and her husband as due to it, they have been able to give all their children a proper education and marry their daughter. In recent times, Jumakul and her husband have noticed the tendency of people to buy sheep more than they do horses, as they are cheaper. They have applied for this loan and hope that by means of this loan they will be able to invest it in purchasing and breeding sheep. They hope to increase the total population of their cattle and marry their son in the near future. Jumakul has three partners: Duishokan, 44, is a mother of two children. Her husband works as a taxi-driver. Duishokan stays at home and looks after cattle. She breeds a special strain of sheep called “Gissar strain”. Duishokan needs a loan to purchase one more sheep of that kind. Zinagul, 50, and her husband work as dentists. They have four children. Zinagul is making preparations for her son’s wedding. Therefore, she has applied for this loan to buy a sheep. Nestandarajan, 47, is a housewife. She keeps some cattle at home and sells milk. Her spouse is a schoolteacher. He teaches geography. Nestandarajan needs a loan to buy milk.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase and breed sheep

loans.name: Gertulde

texts.en:
Gertulde is 42 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 6 and 16. She lives in the Gicumbi district of Rwanda, in Northern Province, approximately an hour-long drive from Kigali city.

Gertulde has worked with livestock for five years and knows how to manage her business well. She employs five people to help her care for her milk-producing cows (only one of which is shown in the photo). 

Gertulde is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to plant herbs for her cows and buy needed supplies. If this strategy is successful, her business will be able to produce much more milk which will increase her monthly sales dramatically.

Any profits resulting from this loan will be reinvested in her business and also allow Gertulde to feed her children more and better food.

loans.use: To purchase herbs and feed for her cows as well as supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama la pochota  porque asi  se llama la población donde habita la mayoría de las personas que conforman este grupo;  Está localidad esta ubicada en el municipio de Tlalixcoyan en el estado de Veracruz.  El grupo está conformado por  6 señoras que se conocen pues viven en comunidades muy cercanas entre si.  Éste es su primer  préstamo con Fundación Realidad.

El representante del grupo se llama Beatriz L. V.. Beatriz es casada, tiene  40 años, estudió hasta el 6° año, y tiene en total 1 hijo varón.  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, y necesita el préstamo para surtir los pedidos de sus clientes.  Sus clientes se expresan muy bien sobre ella y comentan que es una señora muy trabajadora ya que ella recorre varias comunidades cercanas a su casa en donde vende su mercancía.
Beatriz desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, y obtener mayores ganancias y así seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Anahí V. R.  también está en el grupo la pochota . Ella tiene 28 años, estudió hasta el 3er año de secundaria, y tiene en total 1 hija mujer.  Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y necesita el préstamo para surtir más de mercancía su pequeña tienda la cual tiene en sociedad con su mamá, quien también atiende el negocio.  
Anahi,  desea este préstamo para invertir en  su negocio, y tener un mejor surtido y con el tiempo llegar a ser una de las mejores tiendas en su comunidad y así tener mejores ganancias  con las cuales  ella y su familia  puedan vivir mejor ya que su esposo se dedica a la siembra de temporada por lo cual ve su ganancia hasta la cosecha de la misma.

Los otros 4 integrantes se llaman Nidia E. P., Esperanza Guzmán R., Guadalupe R. Sánchez, Paula U. Domínguez, y quieren préstamos para invertir en sus negocios como son: venta por catalogo ,venta de abarrotes y café Internet.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called “La Pochota” because that is the name of the town where the majority of the group members reside. This town is located in the municipality of Tlalixcoyan in the state of Veracruz. The group consists of 6 women that know one another and live in nearby communities. This is their first loan with Fundación Realidad.

The representative of the group is Beatriz L. V.. Beatriz is 40 years old and married. She studied up to 6th grade and has one son. She sells men and children’s clothing and she needs the loan to meet her customer requests. Her customers speak highly of her and they mention that she is a very hardworking woman since she travels to several neighboring communities where she sells her merchandise. Beatriz would like this loan to expand her business and obtain higher earnings so that she can continue improving her quality of life.

Anahí V. R. is also in the “La Pochota” group. She is 28 years old and has one daughter. She studied up to her junior year of high school. She sells groceries and needs the loan to stock up her small store, which she runs with her mother, who also attends to the business.

Anahí would like this loan to invest in her business and have a better assortment. With time, she wants it to become one of the best stores in their community, and as a result have better earnings with which she and her family can live better. Her husband works in seasonal agriculture, for which he sees earnings until the harvest of the crops.

The other four members of the group are Nidia E. P., Esperanza Guzmán R., Guadalupe R. Sánchez, and Paula U. Domínguez. They are asking for loans to invest in their businesses which are: catalog sales, grocery sales, and an internet café.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock their stores

loans.name: Lerma's Group

texts.en:
Lerma R. is from the town of San Antonio Jones,Isabela. She is 43 years old. Lerma is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lerma R. group.

Lerma is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP weekly.

In 2009, Lerma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina B. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Lolina is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lolina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lolina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolina is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lolina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their two children. He has been selling spare parts from old used cars since 1995. He is well-known because he treats his clients well, and also because he repairs and prepares the used parts for selling before offering them for sale. His clients can be anybody from his region. Jihad requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase more spare parts for his garage. This is the first time that Jihad has requested a loan. 

When he first started his business, he had no difficulties. Jihad decided to start his business because he wanted to have independent work. He used to work as a blacksmith, so he had some experience from his previous job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase old cars' spare parts for his garage.

loans.name: Juana Leonarda

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 5 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió hasta cuarto de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de comida.

Juana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela R., que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo aumentar su capital e implementar su negocio.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar arroz, papa, carne, fideos, verduras, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener un restaurante propio. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las bromas con las socias
texts.en:
Juana has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Calceteras” for 5 years. She lives in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román and departament of Puno. She is 39 years old, has a common law marriage and 4 children. She went to school up until the fourth year of secondary school. She sells food. Juana tells us that the first loan she asked for from Movimiento Manuela R., which was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital and outfit her business. She will ask for a loan of S/. 500.00 nuevos soles. With this she will be able to buy rice, potatoes, meat, pasta, vegetables, etc. Her dream for the future is to have her own restaurant. What she likes the most about her Communal Bank are the meetings, and the jokes with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE RICE, POTATOES, PASTA, VEGETABLES, ETC.

loans.name: Dunia Lizeth

texts.es:
la sra. Dunia Lizeth P. M. tiene una pulperia en la aldea del Chichicaste, Jamastran, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "DUNIA" actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 4 años. Dunia es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería,  ese es un robro de mayor afluencia en esa zona, tienen un hijo el cual depende a un 100% de ellos.
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio, ella cubre a un 100% los gastos personales, Dunia es Bachiller de Administracion de empresa, pero en la actualidad sigue cursando sus estudios superiores, y es pasante de la Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Honduras, en la metodologia a Distancia, dichos gastos los cubre con los ingresos del negocio.
necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio y asi tener mejores ventas y mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Ms. Dunia Lizeth P. M. owns a general store in the town of Chichicaste, Jamastran. Her business, which goes by the name of "DUNIA," has been around for 4 years. Dunia is married to a man who works in agriculture and stockbreeding, the most lucrative fields in the area. They have one son who depends on them 100%.

With the income from this business, she covers her personal expenses 100%. Dunia has a certificate in Business Administration, but she is currently enrolled in distance learning courses at the Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Honduras. She covers her university tuition with the profits from her business.

She needs a loan in order to restock her business, thus boosting both sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, lard, rice, soap, bathroom tissue, pasta, coffee, chicken, eggs, flour, dairy products, and grains

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Jiguiya sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 39 ans,  5 enfants et vivant à égalité dans les familles polygames et monogames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts précédents ont été  correctement remboursés. 
Elles font la vente  de céréales,  de pagnes wax, de savons et d’articles divers de boutique (cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, dattes etc.).
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4sacs de 100kg de riz, une douzaine de cartouches de cigarettes de marques différentes, 10 pièces de pagnes wax, 5 centaines de morceaux de savons traditionnels et 7colis divers articles (bonbons, allumettes, dattes etc.). .
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. Elles vendent  à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Jiguiya mainly married women averaging 39 years old, with 5 children who live equally in polygamous and monogamous families. They live in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods in the town of Sikasso which is in the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their eighth collaboration with the micro-finance institution of Soro Yiriwaso so that they can meet the needs of their customers. All of their previous loans have been accurately repaid. They sell grains, pagnes wax (colorful cloth), soap and an array of corner-store goods (cigarettes, candies, matches, dates etc.) With their new loan count on buying four 100 kg bags of rice, a dozen cartons of cigarettes (various brands,) 10 pieces of pagnes wax (cloth,) 500 bars of traditional soap and seven parcels of various other items (candies, matches, dates etc.). They stock up at the main market in Sikasso and in the surrounding villages. They sell from home, at market, and in the neighborhood via rolling carts. They accept both cash and credit to a mixed clientele of men and women. They plan to each make a monthly profit of on average 30,000 FCFA from which one portion will cover the needs of their families or put into savings and the other portion will be invested in their business.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an array of goods

loans.name: Anusha

texts.en:
Anusha is 30-year-old married woman with two children: one son and one daughter. They are providing her with good help. She lives in Kekanadura, Matara in southern Sri Lanka.

Anusha has a business selling lunch packets consisting of rice and curry, and she has lots of experience in this type of business.

Anusha has requested a 25,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is a very active, honest and hardworking woman. She wants to increase the family income and hopes to do so with the improvement of her lunch-packet business.

loans.use: To purchase some equipment for her business

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: El señor Mario José  tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, los cuales ambos son menores de edad estudiando uno en primaria y el otro en secundaria. El señor tiene un negocio de venta de medicinas, los cuales distribuye desde su casa y además de manera ambulante a pulperías y farmacias. Cabe señalarse, el señor empezó con este negocio desde hace 31 años, el empezó vendiendo medicinas con un hermano, después observo que el negocio era rentable y empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. Este crédito solicitado por el señor será invertido en la compra de mas mercadería, ya que actualmente tiene varios pedidos que necesita suplir, además que su negocio ha estado creciendo bastante por lo que necesita mayor inversión. Su sueño, es poner una pequeña farmacia que sea estable y que brinde las mismas ganancias que está recibiendo ahora que anda vendiendo ambulante.
texts.en:
Mario José is 53 years old. He is married and has two children who are both young in age. One is in primary school and the other is in secondary school. Mr. José owns a business selling medicine, which he distributes from his house and also traveling to local stores and pharmacies. It should be noted that Mr. José started this business 31 years ago. He started selling medicine with his brother, and then realized that the business was profitable and started working for himself.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in buying more merchandise, since he has many orders that he needs to fill. Also, his business has been growing so much that he needs to invest more. His dream is to have a small pharmacy that is stable and that brings in more income than what he is receiving now as a traveling salesman.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 32 years old, married to Peter Mburu, and they have four children who are currently in school.

Ruth has been farming for the last seven years, growing crops and rearing livestock. She recently started rearing rabbits, a venture that has proved to be very profitable.

Ruth was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her fourth loan. She has repaid her previous loans successfully and on time. She is requesting a loan to build a new rabbit house, increase her livestock, and build a greenhouse where she will plant tomatoes and onions.

Ruth hopes to use the profit from her loan to develop her rabbit-rearing business and become a big supplier of rabbit meat in the local market.

loans.use: To build a new rabbit house, increase her livestock, and build a greenhouse to plant tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Aros Shaher Group

texts.en:
Shekib is the group leader of 'Aros Shaher' group. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two children. He has got a bicycle repair shop in which he is busy seven days a week and all his family members benefit from the income he generates. He needs the loan to purchase some required bicycle spare parts for his shop, and besides, he needs some tools. 

He is happy and wants to say that he can improve his business and hopes to have a bright future.

loans.use: purchase some  bicycle spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Eudisa

texts.en: Eudisa B. is 58 years old and proud of the record she and her husband have achieved of growing their fishing business and repaying their loans on time. In order to continue this growth and increase her income, Eudisa has applied for a new loan through ASHI. She will use the loan to catch additional fish to sell in a local wholesale market. Though Eudisa’s small company does not make a lot of money, she takes satisfaction in the fact that she and her husband support their family without help from others. Because of their hard work, one of their children is in college, and she hopes to be able to persuade another, who is 18, to do the same thing.

loans.use: To expand a small fishing business

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Issa D.  a plus de 38 ans, polygame et père de six  enfants dont 4 garçons et 2 filles. Il réside avec ses quatre femmes et leurs enfants dans sa propre maison à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture et autres, il s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage et commercialisation de  produits agricoles tels le pois sucré et les noix de karité il y’a 10 ans. 
Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes de l’extérieur, mais les ressources financières nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. 
Ainsi, il  décida d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il a bénéficié de deux prêts  individuels qui ont été  tous correctement remboursés. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il sollicite ce troisième prêt pour d’acheter, 30 sacs de pois sucré, 1 tonne de maïs, 5 sacs de mil et 10 sacs de noix de karité. 
Il s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso  pour d’abord les stocker dans son magasin situé au nouveau de Médine Sikasso. Ensuite il les ramène à Abidjan et à Bobo Dioulasso (respectivement dans les républiques de Côte d’Ivoire et Burkina Faso) sur commande des usines de fabrique de jus de pois sucré et de beurre de karité. Il vend les céréales à la fois en gros et en détail.    
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 315 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa D. is over 38 years old, and is the polygamous father of six children, of whom four are boys and two are girls. He lives with his four wives and their children in his own house in Médine, one of the working-class boroughs of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After practicing several unsuccessful activities –farming being one of them- he soon began ten years ago stockpiling activities and commercialisation of agricultural products such as sugar peas and shea nuts. Given his amount of experience, he enjoys a strong reputation and even receives a number of orders from outside the country. Unfortunately, he lacks the financial means to satisfy these requests. He therefore decided to join Soro Yiriwaso where he has already been granted two loans, both repaid in full. Wanting to satisfy an ever-increasing customer base, he is requesting a third loan to buy 30 bags of sugar peas, one ton of corn, 5 bags of millet, and 10 bags of shea nuts. He gets his supplies from villages in the vicinity of Sikasso and stockpiles them to start with at his store in the new area of Médine in Sikasso. He then transports the products to Abidjan (Côte d’Ivoire) and Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso), in response to orders from factories producing sugar pea juice and shea butter. He sells grain crereals both wholesale and retail. He hopes this loan will enable him to reach monthly earnings of 315,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover most of his own expenses, those of his family and to pay the loan interest. The remainder will be reinvested in his business activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Rosa Emma

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 38 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Corinto, departamento D. Morazán, es casada, vive el  esposo y su única hija Kenia que tiene 14 años D. edad, la actividad que realiza es cuidado y alimentación D. ganado y cerdos para venta.
El oficio se lo enseñaron los padres, todos los días recorre 3 kilómetros D. distancia hasta el lugar donD. esta el pasto para el ganado, su jornada inicial D. 6:00 am, orD.ñando las vacas para sacar leche, luego alimenta al ganado; ella está solicitando  un crédito para compra D. cerdos y concentrado; para cuidado y alimentación. Para luego venderlos cuando ya estén listos.
Los sueños D. Rosa son continuar son el negocio D. compra y centa D. ganado, apoyar al esposo con la agricultura, tener estabilidad económica, apoyar a los hijos con los estudios, mejora la calidad D. vida D. la familia
texts.en:
Rosa, age 38, lives in the Corinto municipality in the Morazán department. She is married, and she lives with her husband and their only child, 14 year old Kenia. Rosa takes care of and feeds cattle and pigs to sell. Her parents taught her this traD.. Everyday she travels three kilometers to the pasture for the livestock. Her work day starts at 6:00 a.m. She milks the cows and then feeds the livestock. She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and concentrated feed in order to take care of them and to feed them. Then she will sell them when they are ready. Rosa’s dreams are to continue with her business of buying and selling livestock, to help her husband with the farming, to have financial stability, to support her children’s education, and to improve the family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and concentrated feed

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua K. is a married woman with four children. Her husband is a farmer. She sells bags of charcoal in Elmina. Ekua has received junior high school education. She has been selling charcoal for five years. She helps her husband with the general welfare of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita M. is from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. She is 47 years old. Carmelita is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Carmelita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional parts needed to better provide her service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika M. lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  She is the single mother of two children.  In 1993, in order to find a way to earn a living for her family, Zulaika began her business  in trade. She started selling woman’s clothes at the market using her initial investment of 15,000 KGS. Due to supreme efforts and her strong determination to provide a better life for her children, Zulaika managed to multiply her investment and broaden her business by opening a second sales point at the local market. To widen her assortment of goods, Zulaika got her first loan, which was used as intended and repaid correctly.

Unfortunately, in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh, Zulaika lost her business, which was robbed and looted. But Zulaika didn’t give way to despair and braced herself to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this reason, Zulaika is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her activity.  Zulaika believes that the only way out of different complicated situations is mutual understanding and moving forward together.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase woman's clothes for resale

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima Ghulam Murtaza's Group

texts.en:
G. fatima G. M. is a widow who lost her husband a few years ago when he died unexpectedly. She is the mother of two sons, both of whom work. They left school after completing their 10th standard and started to work in order to supplement the family’s income. G. fatima’s elder son works in the government sector while her younger son is a tailor by profession. The family lives in Gujrawala, Pakistan, which is one of Pakistan’s main industrial cities.

After her husband’s death G. fatima started a PCO (a public phone facility where people pay for their calls by the minute) in her home for the people in her neighborhood. She uses one of her rooms for this purpose. She has been in business for the last seven years and has successfully developed trust in her business by providing her customers with good quality services. She is a client who is very aware of her responsibilities.

G. fatima has applied for a loan, her second from Asasah, for her PCO business. With the loan she will buy calling cards and a telephone set to provide better calling services for her customers. She is hopeful that her income will definitely increase after making such an investment.

loans.use: To buy a phone set and calling cards for her PCO

loans.name: Las Gualupitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Gualupitas. El nombre se debe a que en esta comunidad son muy devotos a la virgen de Guadalupe y Gualupitas es una palabra derivada de ello. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes y está ubicado en Tehuacán, Puebla en México. 

Julia C. D. es integrante del grupo Las Gualupitas, ella tiene 48 años de edad; no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos dos varones y dos mujeres. Julia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, negocio que inicio hace ocho años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercancía, con la finalidad de hacer crecer su negocio invirtiendo también en la venta de comida, ya que está a la orilla de la carretera y es lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Sus clientes consideran que es una persona muy trabajadora, higiénica y de impecable reputación. La  Sra. Julia se siente agradecida por este préstamo ya que podrá realizar los planes que se había propuesto y que por un momento los vio difícil de alcanzar, pero con este crédito dice la señora solo están a la vuelta de la esquina. Ella espera seguir haciendo crecer su negocio y hacer remodelación de él.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Gualupitas.  The name originates from the fact that in this community they are very devoted to the Virgin of Guadalupe and Gualupitas is a word derived from it.  The group is composed of 11 members and is located in Tehuacan, Puebla in Mexico.

Julia C.D. is a member of this group.  She is 48 years old and didn't have the opportunity to study.  She is married and has a total of 4 children, two boys and two girls.  Julia sells groceries, a business that she started over eight years ago.  She is applying for a loan to purchase merchandise, with the final outcome of expanding her business and also investing in the sale of food, since she is located on the side of the road and has had customers request this service.  Her customers consider her to be a very hard-working woman, hygienic, and with an impeccable reputation.  Senora Julia is grateful for this loan since she will be able to fulfill her plans that had seemed so far and difficult to reach but now seem to be just around the corner.  She hopes to continue to grow her business and remodel it.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma lives in a two-room brick house with her family in a city named Jaranwala, which is located in Punjab Pakistan and is famous for its agriculture industry. She is a housewife, stays at home and does her household responsibilities.  She is the mother of two daughters who are less than four years of age. 

Her husband has a business selling flavored juice in cartons. He supplies the juice in cartons to different general stores in the city. He gets the juice in cartons at wholesale and earns a good profit by selling them.  He is the only breadwinner of his family and as his daughters are growing, he has to face their education expenses as well.  So in order to complete their needs, he has to grow his business. 
 
That’s why Asma has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy cartons of juice in bulk quantity and increase his selling. Asma is hopeful that by investing money, her husband’s business will improve and she will be able to send her daughters to school when they become of school-going age. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she built good credit behavior and attended every meeting. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hand is Asma".

loans.use: To buy cartons of flavored juice in bulk quantity for reselling

loans.name: Pino Suarez Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Pino Suarez” ya que así se llama la calle en donde está ubicado, en el Estado de Hidalgo, México.Rosa Hernández es integrante del grupo, ella es casada y tiene un hijo de 14 años, el cual es su dependiente económico. Rosa no cuenta con estudios, pero se dedica a la venta de dulces y enchiladas desde hace 21 años afuera de su casa, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio, ella se siente muy contenta al solicitar su crédito pues podrá invertir para estas fechas y acreditar más su negocio para el día de muertos, ya que de acuerdo a la tradición los dulces y enchiladas son típicos de la región.
Observaciones: La señora Araceli A. G. se movio al momento en que se tomo la foto y sólo se le ven los ojos y cabello.
texts.en:
This group is called "Pino Suarez", because that is the name of the street in which it is located, in the Mexican state of Hidalgo. Rosa Hernández is a member of this group. She is married and has a 14-year-old son, who is her dependent. Rosa has no education, but she has worked selling sweets and enchiladas outside her home for 21 years. She seeks this loan to buy inputs for her business. She is very happy to get this loan because she will be able to invest and establish more business for the Day of the Dead, as sweets and enchiladas are traditional for this region. 

(Note: Araceli A. G. moved while the picture was taken and you can only see her eyes and hair.)

loans.use: Invest in business and make seasonal purchases

loans.name: Mayra Yalila

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra F. es socia del banco comunal Despertar, vive por la ciudadela de los Chóferes en la ciudad de Cuenca, conocida también como la Santa Ana de los cuatro Ríos, es una ciudad del centro sur de Ecuador, capital de la provincia del Azuay. Cuenta con una gastronomía muy variada la que cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes y su gente es muy cordial y amable.

La señora Mayra es comerciante y labora junto a su esposo, esta actividad la viene realizando hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como son queso y yogurt, su producto los vende recorriendo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de lunes a sábados.
 
Doña Mayra tiene 30 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 8 y 1 año de edad,  su primer hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.

Es socia de ESPOIR hace 3 años y todos los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más producto lácteo para su negocio. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mayra F. is a member of the Despertar (Wake Up) communal bank.  She lives in the Chóferes neighborhood in the city of Cuenca, also known as Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos.  It is a city in south central Ecuador and is the capitol of Azuay Province.  It boasts an extremely varied cuisine which captivates the palates of its visitors, and the people are very warm and friendly.

Mayra is a businesswoman who works with her husband, and she has been doing this job for three years.  She sells dairy products like cheese and yogurt.  She makes traveling sales Mondays through Saturdays from 9 in the morning until 6 in the evening.
 
Mayra is 30 years old.  She is married and has two children, ages 8 and 1.  Her first son attends a school in the city.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in a relative's house.

Mayra has been a member of ESPOIR for three years, and all the loans have benefited her business.  She will invest the new loan in purchasing more dairy products for her business.  Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: Buy cheese and yogurt

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mrs. Uk B. is 45 and the mother of two children. One of her children is already married and the other one is single. The children are employed and share in the responsibilities of the family. Uk B. stays at home to complete her daily routine, which includes cooking and caring for her kids.  She very much relies on the income from her husband’s work - he drives a motor taxi. He normally provides this service every day with his old motorcycle. Uk B. is taking out her loan to replace her husband's taxi as it breaks down frequently.

loans.use: To replace a taxi.

loans.name: Ketemon Ene

texts.en:
Ketemon has been in livestock farming in Naivasha town for the last six years. She is a 50-year-old lady married to Leulele K.. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy 15 sheep and 10 goats in oder to meet the high demand during the festive season.
