In the future she hopes to be a major supplier of livestock to slaughter houses in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep and 10 goats to rear and sell later during the festive season

loans.name: Mujeres Del Campo Group

texts.es: Doña Santa Pascuala C. A., tiene 30 años D. edad, soltera, no tuvo oprtunidad para estudiar pero se ha esforzado para apoyar económicamente asu familia, se dedica a una tienda D. comsumo general, empezó con un pequeño ahorro y ahora ya tiene 8 años con este negocio y tambien se dedica a la crianza D. animales con lo que tiene 5 años D. experiancia, le va bien pero desea aumentar su capital D. trabajo. Contando con ese entusiasmo deciD. reunir a otras 9 compañeras para formar un banco comunal con el proposito que cada una D. ellas logre contar con un capital D. trabajo y para las que ya tienen un negocio incrementarlo, cada una D. las integrantes del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades productivas las cuales mencionamos: crianza D. animales, confeccion D. pantalones, tejido D. sabanas, tienda D. consumo diario y venta D. helados. Esperan que con este prestamo logren alcanzar su objetivo D. aumentar su negocio e incrementar sus ganacias, Doña Santa Pascuala sueña con ver una tienda granD. y surtida para poder atender D. la mejor manera sus clientes.
texts.en:
30-year old Doña Santa Pascuala C. A. is single. She did not have the opportunity to go to school as she had to earn money to help her family. She runs a general store which she opened using a  small amount of money she had saved. She’s had this store now for eight years. Santa Pascuala also has five years of experience raising animals. All is going well for her, and for this reaS. she wants more money to invest in her businesses.

Enthusiastically she and nine friends decided to form a community bank so that each could get a loanl. Those already with businesses would invest in them. Each member of the group has a different kind of work such as raising animals, making pants, making sheets, running a general store, and selling ice cream. They hope to achieve their goals of expanding their businesses and increasing income through this loan. Doña Santa Pascuala’s dream is to have a large, well-stocked store so she can proviD. better service to her customers.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda D. is from the village of Danao. She is 47 years old. Brenda is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Brenda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Brenda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Brenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Brenda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Brenda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mary Chor

texts.en:
Mary Chor, 23 years old, is a farmer from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is married and has 2 young children. Mary Chor plants and harvests rice and corn crops and sells it to rice traders. She does her best, to give her family better living conditions. 

Mary Chor applied for a loan from CEVI which she will use to fund her farm. She needs additional seeds and fertilizers.  Mary Chor is hopeful that with this investment, her harvest will increase.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mairambubu's Group

texts.en:
These loans are especially important for women, because their number in the labor force is increasing dramatically each year. More and more women are forced by life conditions to sacrifice time with their children at home in order to earn money.

Mairambubu R., 52, is the treasurer of this group. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in the village of Kochkorka, an agricultural area with considerable trade. Her other two children already live independently and earn incomes by reselling potatoes. Mairambubu herself used to have a business, which she had to quit because of lack of capital. Now she has opened a small shop by a bus stop. She hopes this strategic location will help her gradually increase her sales. Her products mainly include drinks and snacks, which are often bought by passengers.  Mairambubu’s rent payments are high, so she hopes to attract more customers and achieve more sales through attentive service and lower prices. These humble beginnings will help her secure a good life for her family members. She has already raised enough money to make her children's lives better. Mairambubu really hopes for good returns from this business and believes in success.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience foods

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: La señora Nilda se dedica a elaborar masitas las mismas que las comercializa. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de materia prima como ser harina, azúcar, huevos y demás insumos necesarios para continuar con su negocio que es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención de su familia.Vive  en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene dos  hijos. La cliente se siente satisfecha con los préstamos que le otorgamos desde el año 2005.
texts.en: Nilda makes pastries similar to the ones sold in stores. The loan is needed to buy raw materials such as flour, sugar, eggs, and other supplies needed to sustain her business, which is the main source of income for supporting her family. She lives at home with her parents in the Catahuma area in the city of La Paz. She has two children. Nilda feels satisfied with the loans she has received since 2005.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, and other supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora A. is from the village of Bayabo, Tumuini, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Flora is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Flora owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Flora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Flora is requesting a new loan of 24000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional groceries to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Flora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: María Luz Dary

texts.es:
María Luz Dary M. vive en Medellín e inició su negocio hace 12 años mientras trabajaba con su esposo vendiendo sandalias. Después de aprender el oficio, se independizó de su esposo y empezó a vender otros productos como ropa de niños, medias, camisetas y ropa interior.

Inicialmente María Luz Dary era una persona muy tímida porque venía del campo, pero rápidamente tomó la decisión de tener su propio negocio y dejar atrás su timidez y por eso ahora consigue por su propia cuenta el dinero para ayudar a su familia.  Ella ahora quiere aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y por eso necesita el dinero para incrementar su inventario de productos. Con esto lo que busca es poder ofrecer mejores cosas para sus clientes y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida como hasta ahora lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
María Luz Dary M. lives in Medellín.  She started her business 12 years ago while she worked with her husband selling sandals.  After learning the trade, she started working independently from her husband and started selling other products such as children's clothes, tights, t-shirts and underwear.

María Luz Dary used to be a very shy person because she came from the countryside.  However, she quickly took the decision to own her own business and leave her shyness behind.  She now works for herself and makes money to help her family.  María would now like to increase her sales volume and needs money to do this, so that she can increase her product inventory.  She would like to be able to offer better products to her customers and continue improving her quality of life as she has done up until now.

loans.use: to buy stock

loans.name: Maria Ludy

texts.es:
Maria tiene 19 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en el caserío La Colorada, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope, un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú.

Maria se dedica a la confección de manteles y servilletas. Ella borda sus productos con cintas de variados colores, lanas e hilos de seda. Vende sus productos a pedido a sus vecinos y amistades en su caserío y zonas aledañas. También ofrece sus artesanías en ferias y otros eventos locales. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la venta de aves de corral, los cuales cría y engorda en un pequeña terreno cerca de la casa de sus padres. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende en el mercado local y a los negociantes que suelen visitar su zona. Con estas actividades, Maria puede ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares y también puede solventar sus gastos personales. Desea invertir en su negocio de artesanía con la compra de telas e hilos para sus bordados. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión podrá responder a la demanda que tiene para sus productos y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María, 19, is single and doesn’t have any children.  She lives with her parents in La Colorada, located ten minutes from the city of Mórrope, a district populated with humble, hard working people who are farmers.  It’s located in Lambayeque Province in northern Perú.

María makes tablecloths and napkins.  She embroiders her items with ribbons of assorted colors, wool and silk thread.  She sells her products on order to her neighbors and friends in her settlement and in adjacent ones.  She also sells her crafts at markets and other local events.  In addition, she also sells barnyard fowl that she raises and fattens up in a small piece of property she has near her parents’ house.  When the animals reach a good size and weight she sells them in the local market and to merchants that tend to visit her area.  

With these activities, María is able to help her parents meet family expenses as well as cover her personal spending.  She wants to invest in her crafts business buying fabric and thread for her embroidery.  She has, therefore, thought it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a 1000 new sol loan.  This investment will allow her to respond to customer demand for her products and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for her embroidery.

loans.name: Midote Group

texts.fr: MIDOTE est un groupe constitué de quatre personnes dont la présidente (celle dont le doigt est levé sur la photo) est nommée Emilienne. Les membres du groupe sont des amies et vivent ensemble dans le même quartier.  Née le 22 Mai 1968 dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi, Emilienne vit depuis trois ans à Eoca à Abomey Calavi. Emilienne est une veuve qui a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Emilienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants. N’ayant pas été à l’école, Emilienne vend depuis quatre ans environs, des produits vivriers et du charbon de bois à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et de nourrir sa famille. Emilienne s’approvisionne au marché de Glazoué au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Emilienne sollicite un financement auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu.
texts.en:
MIDOTE group is composed of four persons. Its leader is Emilienne (raising her hand in the photograph). The members of the group are friends and live in the same neighborhood.

Emilienne was born on May 22, 1968, in the commune of Abomey Calavi, and for three years, she's been living in Eoca in Abomey Calavi. She's a widow with three children who all attend school and whom she has to support. She lives with her children.

Having never attended school, Emilienne has been selling food products and charcoal at her house for about four years. This enable her to provide for herself and feed her family.

She gets her supplies at the market in Glazoué in Benin. Emilienne is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to expand her business and increase her revenue and her income.

loans.use: to buy food products and charcoal

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn, 43, is from the village of Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with two adult-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn runs a snack vending business in her local community. She has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. This will be her 10th loan cycle with PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Klade

texts.en:
Klade lives in West Point. She's married and has two children, one is nine and the other is twelve, who both stay at home with their parents. 

Klade has been selling clothes and assorted goods for the past eleven years, she enjoys doing this business because she uses the profit to send her children to school. 

She's requesting a loan to purchase used clothes and a refrigerator for her business, she plans to expand her business and buy a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes and a refrigerator for her business

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. Arceli has a retail shop that sells RTW or ready to wear clothing like t-shirts, underwear & blouses. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of t-shirts & blouses.
Arceli is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arceli hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts & blouses to sell

loans.name: Norjmoo

texts.en:
Norjmoo is 51-year-old widow who lives with her three children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her older two children help with the family business and the youngest one attends the local secondary school. 

She manages a construction materials business and a pool service in her town. She started her business in 2007 and has been able to build a strong customer base. She purchases her construction materials 1-2 times a month from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. During summer she conducts her construction business. She also manages a household goods trading business to supplement her earnings during winter. Now she is one of the experienced businesswomen in her town. She is a polite and kind woman who says, "I am planning to expand my business in order to better my life." She is requesting a 350,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Rafael Octavio

texts.en:
Rafael Octavio is 42 years old and married.  He owns a small convenience store that he operates with his wife.   

Rafael Octavio will use the loan to buy additional grocery items, including milk, cheese and cream.  His dream is to have his own house one day.

loans.use: to buy milk, cheese and cream

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario de 63 años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa propia, sus hijos viven independientemente, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Morropón que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Mario  es brindar el servicio de transporte público, ya que cuenta con su propia mototaxi, la cual lo trabaja mañana y tarde movilizando personas que viven en Morropón y también a los distintos caseríos de la zona, cuenta con su propia clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir sus gastos de su casa.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi y realizar algunos arreglos en su casa.  Mario es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el fin que en un futuro pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario is 63 years old.  He lives with his wife in his own home and his children live independently.  His home only has electricity.  It is located in Morropón district, in Piura department.  The people in these areas farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Mario's business is providing a public transport service as he owns his own motorcycle taxi.  He works mornings and afternoons, transporting people who live in Morropón and the small villages in the area.  He has his own customer base and is able to cover his household expenses with the income that he makes.

Mario has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi and make some repairs to his home.  Mario is very well known in his area because he is always looking out for his family's well-being with the goal of providing them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi and to replace some parts

loans.name: Kiprono

texts.en:
Kiprono is a father of six children who are all in school. He has been a farmer for the last 13 years in his hometown of Litein. He employs two farmhands and produces milk, tea and eggs for the local market. His family fully relies on farming for their livelihood.

Kiprono has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will help him diversify his business and improve his family's living standards. He says he is also focusing on building a modern dairy unit for his animals.

Kiprono says animal diseases are a challenge but surmountable.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru:
Гулшан умная, честная и добросовестная женщина. Она вдова и сама воспитывает троих детей. Она занимается купля продажей ювелирных изделий более 12 лет.  Данный бизнес она начинала с мизерной суммы денег. Гулшан одна воспитывает своих детей и ей трудно обеспечить их, и она всегда нуждается в поддержку.  Каждый день рано утро она уходит из дома и вечером вернется домой. Денег, которые она зарабатывает, хватает только на ежедневные расходы и ей хотелось бы получит займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки нового ассортимента ювелирных изделий, чтобы расширить свой бизнес и улучшить её жилищное условие.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Gulshan is a smart, honest and hardworking woman. She is a widow and is raising her three children alone. Gulshan has been reselling jewelry for the last 12 years and has started her business with a tiny amount of money, expanding slowly. She is raising her children on her own so it is hard for her to provide for them and she always needs support. Every morning Gulshan leaves home and comes back late at night. The money which she makes is only enough for day-to-day spending and it's hard for her to save for the future. For this reason Gulshan would like to take out a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase more jewelry in bulk and expand her business, increasing her profits and improving the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new jewelry inventory for her store

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna has a business selling charcoal within the village where she lives. She has been doing this for eight years. She is 42 years old and married to Romeo, who is her helper in selling their charcoal. She desires to buy more charcoal stock in order to increase her sales income and minimize her expenses in going to and from the place where she buys her products. She is providing her customers with products that they ask for, because she would like to gain more customers to patronize her business.

With her desire to buy stock of charcoal, she is requesting a loan amount of 10,000 Philippines pesos. She hopes that she can be able to maintain her business in order to provide the allowances of her children and to save money for her security purposes for when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for the retail business.

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Savet (shown in the photo) and her husband, Chamreun, are rice farmers. Additionally, Savet also sells Cambodian noodles in her village and her husband sells firewood. They have been married since 2001 and have five children – three sons and two daughters. Two of the children are in school while the other three are still young. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Savet is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to help maintain her farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Esterlita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and also dried fish. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. Esterlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Rinata

texts.ru: Рината – молодая предпринимательница из г. Токмок.  Ей 24 года, не замужем. Будучи инициативной от природы, Рината начала свой бизнес в 18 лет с начальной суммой в 3,000 сом (KGS). За шесть лет она добилась хороших результатов – сумела приобрести в собственность павильон с торговым оборотом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS).  В стремлении к новым высотам, Рината обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» в третий раз за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в ремонт квартиры.
texts.en: Rinata is a young entrepreneur from the town of Tokmok.  She is 24 years and single.  Being gifted with initiative from nature, Rinata started her own business when she was 18 years old, using a sum of 3,000 som (KGS).  During the course of six years, she achieved good results - she was able to buy a pavilion with a goods turnover of 25,000 som (KGS).  Reaching for new heights, Rinata requested a loan in the sum of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai Tushum and Partners" company to expand merchandise assortment.  She plans to use the profits from the loan to repair her apartment.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Solidario Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es:
Solidario las esmeraldas,  integrado por doña Ángela Daniela de 21 años, Vera Judith  de 27 años y Eva Judith de 47 años.
Doña Ángela la lider del duo se dedica a la vente de cosméticos y ahora también a la venta de pan en su casa todos los días es la misma rutina  claro ella lo hace para asegurar la vida de sus futuros hijos,  vende en su local todos los días mantiene abierto todo el día pero hay veces que sale también a vender sus productos por catálogos para tener un mayor ingreso toca puertas busca a sus conocidas y esta solicitnaod este credito para la compra de pan para su panaderia. En cuando a doña vera Judith sigue con su venta de regalos y  piñatas ella las hace asegura que ha sido de ayuda el crédito anterior no duda que este le ayude aun mas, doña Eva también sigue con su librería todos los días desde temprano atiende a sus clientes y procura mantener variedad para que la visiten seguido. Las tres señoras han visto un cambio en su vida y ahora desean refinanciar y así incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Solidario las Esmeraldas is composed of Ángela Daniela who is 21 years old, Vera Judith who is 27 and Eva Judith who is 47. 

Ángela, the leader of the group, makes a living selling cosmetics, and now also bread, out of her home. Every day is the same routine. Of course, she does it to secure the lives of her future children. She sells in her shop every day. She stays open all day but there are many times that she also leaves to sell her products through catalogues in order to have a greater income, knocking on doors and seeks out acquaintances. She is asking for this loan to buy bread for her bakery. 

As for Vera Judith, she continues with her sale of the gifts and piñatas that she makes. She assures that the previous loan has been helpful and she does not doubt that this one will help her even more. 

Eva also continues with her bookstore. Every day, starting very early, she serves her clients and tries to maintain variety so that they visit often. 

The three women have seen change in their lives and now want to refinance and thereby increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy bread to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 57-year-old married woman. She has seven children, aged from 10 to 22 years old. She describes herself as hardworking and dedicated. She operates a grocery store, where she sells cabbages, tomatoes, and onions. She has been involved in this business for nine years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a very busy residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. She will use the loan of Kes 50,000 to add to her stock of vegetables. Her goal is to expand her business to a wholesale grocery shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to add to her stock of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and kale.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora María De Los Ángeles le está haciendo falta la reparación del techo. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material que es madera, clavos, lámina y papel granito especial para el techo, el actual que tiene está en malas condiciones y quiere repararlo antes de que llegue la temporada de lluvias y el invierno.
Doña María De Los Ángeles es viuda y se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y nueva, este es el ingreso que tiene para pagar el crédito, ya que sus hijos le ayudaran con los gastos familiares. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio que le dejó su esposo y que esté en mejores condiciones para protegerse de enfermedades.
texts.en: Maria De Los Ángeles needs to make some repairs to the roof of her house.  She requests a loan to buy materials including: wood, nails, composite asbestos and cement corrugated laminate, and special granite paper for roofing.  The roof that she has now is in bad condition, and she wants to make the repairs before the winter, which is the rainy season.  Maria De Los Ángeles is a widow, and she has a business selling used and new clothing that is her source of income to repay this loan, since her children help her with the household expenses.  She wants to improve the property that her husband left her so that it will be in better condition and will protect them from illness.

loans.use: to repair her wooden roof

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosie is 45 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Rosie has a sari-sari (general) store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years.

Rosie requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Luteshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Luteshi SHG Group in Western Kenya! 

Ruth takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ruth had a good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ruth was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Ruth will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

Ruth is the facilitator of the Luteshi SHG group. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Luteshi SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ruth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Maria Theresa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Maria Theresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria Theresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap, 47, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Her husband is a fisherman. All of her children are employed at a garment factory. Pheap is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase an engine for her husband to install in his boat in order to make his fishing journey easier. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business of fishing and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase an engine for her husband's fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy snails and dried fish she will resell.

loans.name: Up Rising Group

texts.en:
Sia is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sia was born in Taima Nimikoro, in eastern Sierra Leone, about forty years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has three children who are attending secondary schools. Sia sells bottles of water, drinks, provisions, etc. She has been a businesswoman for twenty-five years now. 

With the help of this loan, Sia and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Sia will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy bottles of water, drinks and provisions in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is 36 years old and is married. Unfortunately her husband physically abused her and finally abandoned her with two children. She had to support her two sons and decided to open a food business because she loves to cook. Initially she rented a place and started to sell breakfast and lunch. By working hard she was able to save some money and bought her own place. Now she needs to pay for a sanitary license in order to operate her business without problems. For this reason she is requesting a loan of US $ 475 to re-model her place, obtain the license and also better the installations so she can give her clients better service.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Clementina tiene 36 años de edad y esta casada, pero desafortunadamente su esposo la maltrataba físicamente y la abandono con dos hijos. En esa época ella entonces tuvo que hacerse cargo de su familia y entonces lo que hizo fue en poner un negocio de comida que era lo que ella sabía hacer bien. Inicialmente alquilo un local y empezó vendiendo almuerzos y comidas corridas, trabajando duro logro que su negocio creciera y pudo juntar dinero para comprar su propio local de comidas. Ahora ella para poder tener su puesto es necesario tener un permiso sanitario que le permita operar sin problemas, por ello esta solicitando un crédito de US$ 475 para realizar una remodelación de su local, lo que le permitirá obtener el permiso de sanidad, y al mismo tiempo mejorar sus instalaciones para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To make over her business place

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Selling kenkey, a local food, is a popular activity at a community called Abokobi in Ghana. Charlotte produces and trades in kenkey in her community. She has a good market for her business. She has been a trainee of Kraban Support Foundation's TEACH programme and benefited immensely from the record-keeping training program. She needs a working capital loan of $750 to support her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Barasa

texts.en: Barasa is married with five children, all in primary school. He started his business in 2002 in order to sustain his family. He has not undertaken any formal training, but he is an active member of his local community’s self help group dealing with poverty eradication and fighting against HIV/AIDS.  With a loan from PEMCI, he will be able to increase his cereals stock and to open a cereal store. Through his business, he has been able to fight hunger in the community and provide a good example to the others in the area.

loans.use: To increase his cereals stock

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
Petra is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She makes corn tostadas which she sells in the streets of the city of San Cristobal. With the loan she wants to buy firewood and corn to stock up and this way obtained better profits selling our products. She belongs to the group “Dulce 3” together with Mrs.Teresa Sanchez who cross-stitches blouses made of cloth which she sells in the city of San Cristobal de las Casas. With the loan, Mrs. Teresa will buy cloth and thread for cross-stitching.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

PETRA TIENE 48 AÑOS, CASADA, TRES HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES CAMPESINO. ELLA SE DEDICA HACER TOSTADAS DE MAIZ LAS CUALES LAS VENDE POR LAS CALLES DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL, CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE COMPRAR LEÑA Y MAIZ PARA ALMACENAR Y ASI OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS CON LA VENTA DE SUS PRODUCTOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO DULCE 3 JUNTO CON DOÑA TERESA SANCHEZ SANCHEZ LA CUAL TRABAJA BORDANDO BLUSAS DE MANTA LAS CUALES VENDE EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS. CON EL PRESTAMO DOÑA TERESA COMPRARA TELAS E HILOS PARA BORDAR.

loans.use: To sell tostadas

loans.name: Sery

texts.en:
Sery C. is a dynamic, 40-year-old single mother. She is an expert in hairstyle and has more than 17 years of experience in her activity. She lives with her son in Marcory, a suburb in the south of the Abidjan District.

C. is well-known in the Marcory open market where she has been exercising her talents for years. C.'s revenues are mainly used to take care to household expenses and the educational costs for her son. She would like now to go above the day-to-day survival living and establish a sustainable source of revenue that can help her to face the educational costs for her son who is now in secondary school. She wants to open a cosmetic sales store as an ideal complementary activity to her current business.

loans.use: Sery Cyprienne, hairdresser, will use the loan to open a cosmetics store

loans.name: Zulfa

texts.en: Zulfa is 30-year-old mother of five and a resident of Tandika in the Dar Es Salaam region. She runs a grocery store and sells fresh vegetables. She has been in business for the past six years. She now wants to expand her store into a bigger shop. She is in need of $550 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
For ten years now, Martha Luz has devoted herself to wholesale and retail sales of cosmetics, watches, undergarments, shoes, and gold or silver plated accessories. She began her business with an initial capital of C/$10,000.00, her own savings. Like so many others, she began her business as a traveling merchant, managing to acquire a stall in the central Chinandega market after much hard work. Martha is happily married and has two school-aged children who are her main source of motivation, as she wants to provide them with a better future. She has around two years experience working with CEPRODEL. During this time, she has held 12 credits that she has used to increase her inventory and improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

MARTHA LUZ SE DEDICA A LA VENTA AL POR MAYOR Y DETALLE DE COSMETICOS, RELOJES, ROPA INTERIOR, CHINELAS, PRENDAS DE PLATA Y ORO LAMINADO DESDE HACE 10 AÑOS. EL NEGOCIO LO INICIA CON UN CAPITAL FRUTO DE SUS AHORROS DE C$10,000.00. AL IGUAL QUE EN LA MAYORÍA DE LOS CASOS COMENZÓ VENDIENDO DE MANERA AMBULANTE SIN EMBARGO LUEGO DE MUCHO ESFUERZO LOGRA ADQUIRIR UN LOCAL EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL DE CHINANDEGA.

MARTHA ES CASADA Y SU FAMILIA CONSTA DE SU FELIZ MATRIMONIO Y DOS HIJOS QUE AUN ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, LOS CUALES HAN SIDO SU PRINCIPAL MOTIVO DE ESFUERZO YA QUE DESEA BRINDARLES UN FUTURO MEJOR A ELLOS.

CON CEPRODEL YA LLEVA TRABAJANDO ALREDEDOR DE DOS AÑOS CON UN RÉCORD DE 12 CRÉDITOS LOS CUALES LE HAN SERVIDO PARA INCREMENTAR SU INVENTARIO Y MEJORAR SUS VENTAS.

loans.use: Expand her inventory

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Mr. Eusebio I. Candia is married and has three minor children that attend a school in the neighborhood. Together with his family he devotes his time to agriculture and the raising of cattle. They are hard-working people and very well liked in their neighborhood.

Don Eusebio has a well stocked grocery store that generates good revenues. He can depend on a large clientele since he treats them all so well.

Mr. Eusebio’s dream is to increase his inventory of products which would generate more sales and increase his revenues, making him able to provide a better future for his family.

With the loan proceeds he wants to buy products for his grocery store, such as consumer goods for the home and perishable and non perishable food products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Eusebio Insfrán Candia es casado, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que asisten en un colegio de su barrio. Se dedica junto con su familia a la agricultura y ganadería. Son personas trabajadoras y muy queridas en su barrio.

Don Eusebio tiene una despensa bien surtida que le genera buenos ingresos. Cuenta con una amplia clientela, gracias al buen trato que se les brinda.

El sueño de Eusebio es poder aumentar su stock de mercaderías para que esto le genere mas ventas y así tener mayores ingresos y poder darles a su familia un futuro mejor.

Con el crédito quiere comprar mercaderías para su Despensa, artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar, productos comestibles perecederos y no perecederos.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory such as consumer goods for the home and perishable and non perishable food products.

loans.name: Karla Del Socorro

texts.es:
The market of Santa Ana in Chinandega is distinguished by it's many restaurants and places to eat, where different products are offered to customers, who visit the market daily. Mrs. Karla M. has been preparing and selling food here for 38 years from her own space in the market. Ever since she began her business she has felt very satisfied, because, even though preparing food and working with fire can prove to be complicated, she is happy because it has allowed her to support her humble home and her small son, as she is a single mother.

To improve her business, Karla has been working with CEPRODEL and receiving loans that have benefited her very much, improving her profits and allowing her to purchase larger quantities of products. To date, she has had 12 previous loans.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega se caracteriza por ser un local donde existen muchas comiderías donde se ofrecen los diferentes productos a los clientes que diariamente visitan el mercado. La señora Karla M. desde hace 38 años se dedica a elaborar comida y venderla teniendo su propio tramo en este mercado de la ciudad de Chinandega. Desde que inició el negocio se siente muy satisfecha porque a pesar de lo complicado que es preparar los alimentos por el hecho que interactuar todo el tiempo con en el fuego, ella se siente contenta porque este es el sustento de su humilde hogar y de su pequeño hijo ya que es madre soltera.

Para la mejora de su negocio, Karla ha acudido a CEPRODEL para recibir créditos que le han sido de mucho beneficio porque ha obtenido mejores ingresos a raíz de la compra de mayores cantidades de productos para la elaboración de la comida. Actualmente su record es de 12 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Pem

texts.en: Mrs. Pem S., 47, is a mother of three children and works selling grocery products, making on average $5 a day of profit. Her husband, Mr. Nhem Bunheng, 48, is a mechanic, earning $2.60 a day. Two of their children are students while one is married and lives separately. This couple expects to expand their business with the loan from Kiva, which they will use to purchase more grocery products to sell in large quantities.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
It requires a lot of capital to invest in transport business. It also requires a lot of guts & determination to make it work. Mrs Nguyễn Thị Chí is 46 years old. She and her husband had used a loan from TYM to buy a truck to start up a transport business since they live near a brick factory. They have signed a contract to assure the delivery of bricks to the company's customers. This business is stable. They make about 370-400 USD a month. Her husband drives the truck all day, she's at home raising poultry. She is very busy but she always participates in TYM group meetings. This time she applies for a loan of 1200 USD to repair the truck so it does require a lot of money. In the future, she will apply for other loan to invest in retails.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Đầu tư vào kinh doanh vận tải là một trong ít số dự án có vốn đầu tư lớn, đòi hỏi phải mạnh dạn, dám nghĩ dám làm. Với lợi thế ở gần nhà máy gạch men gốm sứ, chị Nguyễn Thị Chí, 46 tuổi, và chồng đã huy động vốn của gia đình và vay của Quỹ mua xe tải chở hàng. Chị ký hợp đồng với nhà máy vận chuyển gạch men cho khách hàng ở nhiều nơi, nhiều tỉnh. Công việc nhiều và đều dặn nên thu nhập rất ổn định. Thu nhập hàng tháng của cả gia đình từ 370-400USD. Chồng đi chở hàng cả ngày, chị Chí ở nhà chăn nuôi. Công việc bận rộn nhưng chị vẫn luôn tích cực tham gia vào các hoạt động của cụm. Vòng vốn tới chị đầu tư để đại tu và nâng cấp lại cho xe nên vốn vay cần cũng lớn, chị Chí dự định xin vay 1200USD. Thời gian tới kế hoạch của chị là tiếp tục vay vốn lớn để đầu tư mở cửa hàng buôn bán kinh doanh dịch vụ tổng hợp

loans.use: Repair her van

loans.name: Nanding Diarra

texts.fr:
Nanding Diarra Sané, 50 years old and married with 7 children in her care, is a member of the village bank of Niaguiss Néma in Ziguinchor. She would like to buy palm oil, lemon juice, and peanut paste for resale. With the income from this business, she will take care of health, clothing, and educational costs for her children. She is asking for her 12th loan, which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Nanding Diarra Sané, 50ans, mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Niaguiss Néma à Ziguinchor. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du jus de citron et de la pâte d’arachide pour revendre. Avec les revenus tirés de son commerce elle prend en charge les frais de santé, d’habillement et de scolarité des enfants. Elle sollicite un 12ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, lemons, and peanut paste

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
We started building an additional room in our house because these houses are too small. As you can see, I have boarded up the windows. I am requesting a loan of $700.00 so that I can both finish building the extra room and add safety to my home by installing window security bars.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

En la casa donde vivo, ya habíamos empezado a construir un cuarto más; dado que estas casas son muy pequeñas y como podrán notar tengo de ventanas unas maderas, solicito $700 dlls. Para darle seguridad a mi vivienda colocándole unas protecciones en sus ventanas Y terminar la construcción de dicho cuarto.

loans.use: Finish building additional room

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
A resident of the Cantón Patzij neighborhood in the town of Nahualá, Sololá, since he was 18 years old, Jesus has worked as a craftsman carving wooden masks. By means of this work he earns the income needed to cover his expenses including food, clothing and his children’s education. He went to ASDIR in order to increase his working capital to be able to purchase raw materials and tools. Later he plans to hire or create jobs for other people to meet the demand for his products. Currently he is selling in the town of Nahualá and with a little more capital he would be selling in nearby towns and increasing his income thereby offering a better quality of life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Residente del Cantón Patzij, Nahualá, Sololá, desde que tenía 18 años se dedica a la Artesanía “Tallado de Mascaras en madera”, por medio de este trabajo obtiene sus ingresos económicos para sufragar los gastos alimenticios, ropa y estudio de sus hijos, esta persona acude a ASDIR para ampliar su capital de trabajo y así comprar materia prima y herramientas; luego piensa contratar o generar empleo a otras personas y poder cubrir la demanda de sus productos, actualmente está vendiendo en la población de Nahualá y con un poco más de capital estaría vendiendo en otros municipios cercanos y mejorar sus ingresos para brindar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Working capital to purchase raw materials and tools

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with 3 children aged 10, 8, and 6. She became a clothes seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Alice now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Radhia

texts.en: Radhia K. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. Her residential and business area is at Buguruni in Dar es Salaam. She is a pharmacist. Her business is two years old. The business income meets her family's daily needs and covers school fees for the children. Her business plan is to run a wholesale pharmacy. She is requesting a loan of US$ 525 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maryam Ali Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Maryam is 37 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 1 and 16 years old. She has been a firewood and vegetable seller since 2005. Everyday she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Maryam is now looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mtumwa, who has a business dealing with coconut, handbag and cassava sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.name: Fabia Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Fabia Patricia O. Loaisga, tiene la edad de 33 años, su estado civil es de soltera, tiene 1 hija con la edad de 14 años  que actualmente esta cursando el sexto grado de primaria uno de los sueños que ella  tiene   es de poder llegar a tener su casa propia para compartirla con su hija ya que para ella esto seria una prioridad para el futuro de su hija de este modo no pase necesidades de andar alquilando, ya que con lo gana no es realmente lo suficiente para poder cumplir este sueño, a corto plazo. Otros de sus propósitos es que su hija logre tener una educación universitaria por consiguiente coronar una carrera  que le favorezca y que sea de provecho en cuanto a factibilidad de empleo inmediato.  

En lo que se refiere a su actividad económica esta es la comercialización de cosméticos exclusivamente de la línea AVON y ZERMAT, teniendo casi catorce años en este negoció, vendiendo productos como: perfumes, cremas, body, pintura de labios y un sin numero de productos comercializando a través de catálogos visitando casa en casa en donde sus clientes puedan escoger el producto de su preferencia. Doña Fabia desea el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de los productos que sus clientes le solicitan de esta forma satisface la demanda de los clientes y una de las medios por los cuales podría lograr sus sueños es por medio del apoyo que le podría brindar Fundación león 2000 con la ayuda de otras organizaciones con el fin de cumplir con estos
texts.en:
Fabia Patricia O. Loaisga is 33 years old and she is single. She has one daughter aged 14 years and she is attending grade 6. One of ther derams is to have her own house to share with her daughter because this would be a priority for the future of her daughter. She doesn't want her to have to keep renting and find herself in need. In the short term the earnings she is accumulating are note enough to make this dream a reality. Another one of her goals is to provide her daughter with a university education and to have a career that she loves and that she will be able to have work immediately.

In what pertains to her financial occupation it is the sale of cosmetics, especially Avon and Zermat brands. Having almost fourteen years in the buisness selling products such as: perfumes, body creams, lipsticks, and countless other products that she offers through a catalogue, visiting house after house where her clients can select the products they prefer. Fabia requests this loan as working capital so that she will be able to purchase products that her clients have ordered and in this manner satisfay the demands of her clientele. One of the ways she will be able to make her dreams come true is through the support that comes from Fundacion Leon 2000 and with the help of other organisations.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Onorhon

texts.ru: Туйчиева Анорхол разведенная женщина. Возраст 38 лет. Имеет троих детей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке"Саховат" города ДУшанбе. Для развития бизнеса планирует увеличить товарооборот, путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Onorhon T. is divorced. She is 38 years old and has three children. She has a shop in the Sakhovat market in Dushanbe. In order to develop her business, she plans to increase sales by taking out a loan. She plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Née vers 1983 à   HETIN DOGODO dans la commune de DANGBO, dame  B. Madeleine est mariée et mère de 3enfants et 2 allant à l’école. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement    GF WANGNIME  DE HÊTIN SOTA  situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du poisson. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 110 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1983 in Hetin Dogodo in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Madeleine B. is married and the mother of 3 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Wangnime of Hetin Sota, located near the hot springs of Dangbo. She also sells fish.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Madeleine B. has requested a loan of 110,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. sells cooking oil and vegetables such as tomatoes, pepper, onions, etc on a small table top in the local market square.  She buys most of her vegetables from farmers in her community to resell. Lydia travels to the city to procure the rest of her goods. She has been in business for ten years.

Lydia is 48 years old, married with two sons. The first has completed university and the other is in junior high school. Her husband is a head teacher in one of the basic schools in their community. She works hard to support her husband and take care of the family.

She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. Lydia's desire is to increase her profit margin so she can own a kiosk to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and cooking oil

loans.name: Marddy Elieth

texts.es: La Sra. Marddy  tiene un negocio de alquiler de cuartos, lo cual es rentable ya que muchas familias Nicaragüenses no tienen una vivienda donde vivir y alquilan cuarto, es triste la situación, pero hay que subsistir es por eso nace la idea de hacer cuarto para alquilar, desde hace trece años brinda este servicio que sastiface al cliente como a sus ingresos, tiene 34 años de edad, reside en laureles norte y con una hija de 13 años de que espera brindarle sus estudio y sea una joven profesional. Esta es la primera solicitud de crédito en Afodenic que espera invertir en infraestructura en embaldosar su casa como las paredes para una mejor presentación y bienestar de su familia. Sus planes a futuro es seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa y poder seguir ofreciendo sus servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marddy has a business renting rooms, which is profitable since many Nicaraguan families don't have a house in which to live and thus rent rooms, which is sad, but they have to have somewhere to live, from where the idea of renting rooms was born. She has been providing this service for three years. She is 34 years old, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood with her 13 year old daughter, for whom she hopes to provide an education and would like to see become a professional. This is her first loan with Afodenic, which she hopes to invest in infrastructure, tiling the floor of her house as well the walls for a better appearance and the well-being of her family. Her future plan is to continue making improvements to house and to continue providing services to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to tile the floor in her house, which is currently a dirt floor

loans.name: Oyelayo

texts.en: Oyelayo S. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. He sells bags of pepper. He is requesting a loan of $1025 to purchase more bags of pepper to sell. He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of pepper to sell

loans.name: Zahida Aslam Masih Group

texts.en:
Zahida A. M. is the group loan leader of another five women from her community. She is 37 years old and married. She owns a two room brick house in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, where she has lived with her family for the past twenty years. 

She has two sons and two daughters, all of whom attend school close to home. Her husband, A. M., has been an auto-rickshaw driver for the past five years. Zahida runs a beauty salon from her home, where she sees a good number of customers. She uses her income to pay school fees for her kids and puts the remainder into her salon. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance lender in Pakistan), and is applying for a new loan to purchase items such as cosmetics, creams, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

The other members of the group will use the loan as follows:
Ailas S. Y. and Asma R. M. will use their portions of the loan to buy cosmetics and creams for their beauty salons. Violet Y. M. will buy medicines for her clinic. Mahtab Zahid would like to purchase a video camera for her movie making business. Farida K. I. will use the loan to pay the remaining installments of her vehicle named “Shahzore.” 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for beauty salon

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Sabina es casada, tiene 51 años y 8 hijos, Sabina tiene un puesto en el mercado Vivanco en donde vende carne, los animales los compra en las ferias de la región. Además Sabina se dedica al engorde de animales.
Sabina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos y comida balanceadas.
Los sueños de Sabina son tener una granja de pollos y que sus hijos estudien para ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Nobility Communal Bank. Sabina is married, 51 years old, and has 8 children. Sabina has a stall at the Vivanco market where she sells meat from the animals she buys at regional markets. In addition, Sabina works fattening animals. Sabina needs a loan of 1,000 soles, money which she will invest in the purchase of pigs and balanced nutrition. Sabina dreams of having a chicken farm and that her children will study to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and balanced nutrition

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
Y. Suhrob is 21 years old. He has a successful business selling flour at the local market in Khujand town. Suhrob sells an assortment of good quality flour. Because he buys the flour wholesale, his prices are cheaper than his competitors. Thus he has many customers who will even make a purchase of his flour straight from his house.

His mother (pictured) helps him with the business. Today he has a great demand for his goods and that is why he wants to take out an individual loan. Suhrob has requested a loan of $1,200 to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory. He promises to repay the loan within nine months.

Suhrob is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and, in the near future, to make his own family. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: Florentina, a sus 50 años es madre soltera y trata de brindar a sus hijos el amor y cariño de madre y padre, aunque un padre es irremplazable, pero con el apoyo que tiene en su familia le da la seguridad de que sus hijos no carezcan de cariño y afecto. Desde que tuvo 20 años se dedicó al comercio en mercados y diversos centros comerciales, pero con el tiempo logró ahorrar lo necesario para instalar su propia bodega, negocio que viene funcionando por más de 15 años y le está generando buenas ganancias gracias a la ubicación donde se encuentra. Pero lamentablemente sufrió un asalto a su tienda que perjudicó su economía y salud, a consecuencia de lo ocurrido solicitó el apoyo de una sobrina, quien ahora le ayuda a atender su negocio todos los días por las mañanas, evitando que Florentina se sienta  sola, ya que sus hijos estudian. No se dejará doblegar por las circunstancias, nos dice, al contrario, tiene pensado incrementar nuevamente su mercadería, y surtir con gran variedad de productos su bodega que promete ser mejor que antes. Florentina es fundadora de su grupo, este es quinceavo crédito con MFP, y le agrada pertenecer a un equipo señoras que le apoyaron en los momentos más difíciles. Con los 2500 soles que solicita aumentará su mercadería y surtirá su negocio con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Florentina is a 50 year-old single mother trying to offer her children the love and affection of both mother and father. A father is irreplaceable, but with the support of her family she can provide her children with security, and they do not lack care or affection. Since the age of 20, Florentina has dedicated herself to commerce in the markets and different commercial centers,and over time was able to save enough to set up her own store, a business that has been operating for more than 15 years. The business is generating good income thanks to its location. Unfortunately, Florentina suffered a robbery that harmed both her finances and her health. As a result, she requested help from a niece, who now helps her run the business every day in the morning, so that Florentina won't be alone while her children are at school. She has not given up because of her circumstances, Florentina tells us. On the contrary, she is thinking of expanding her inventory, and stocking her store with a great variety of products that will promise to be better than before.

Florentina is a founder of her group, and this is her fifteenth loan with MFP. She enjoys being part of the team of women who support her in the most difficult moments. With the 2500 soles she is requesting now, Florentina will increase her inventory and stock her store with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 34 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ali owns a snack stand. He makes all type of sandwiches and he is famous for his sandwiches.  His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ali requests a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his snack stand. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.
When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash and had to face the competition. Ali decided on doing this business because of his experience  -  he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his snack stand

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora Zoraida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Primavera” y vive en la AA.HH. La Primavera Mza. B – Lte. 3, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre D. 03 hijos que aún dependen D. ella ya que son estudiantes.

Agradece a sus padres por haberla apoyado en sus estudios D. Cosmetología ya que supo valerse D. esto para implementar su pequeño salón D. belleza, ubicada en su misma casa, en un espacio bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes.
Nos cuenta que hoy en día le va muy bien, ya que es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos, realiza diferentes tipos D. tintes, peinados y cortes, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

Con este préstamo D. S/1,000.00, invertirá comprando sus materiales D. trabajo como: laca en frascos, tintes D. cabello en diferentes colores, talcos, shampoos y cremas para el cabello.
También brinda el servicio D. manicure y pedicure y para esto comprara esmaltes D. diferentes colores

Es ella quien toma las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias D. su negocio. En lo personal, se siente una mujer independiente, decidida, más segura y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por brindarle el apoyo para iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Zoraida, belongs to the community bank "La Primavera" and lives in AA.HH. La Primavera Mza. B in the Moyobamba Province, San Martín state. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of 3 children who are students and still depend on her. Thanks to the support of her parents she studied cosmetology and used these skills to start her small beauty salon business, which is located in her house and is well implemented to serve her clients.

She is currently doing very well since she is known by her friends and neighbors. She performs various types of dyes, hair styles and cuts for ladies, gentlemen and children.

She is asking for a loan of $350, that will invest buying work materials such as lacquer bottles, hair dyes in different colors, powders, shampoos and hair creams. She also provides manicure and pedicure service and buys nail polish in different colors. She is the one who makes the decisions about expenses and profits of her business. She feels as an independent woman, determined, more confident and responsible for the payments of the shares. She thanks Manuela Ramos for providing her support to start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials such as dyes, lacquers, nail polish and shampoo

loans.name: Akande

texts.en: O. is 42 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks and has been in the business for five years. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to enable her to meet her customers’ needs. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo, quien es comerciante, y con su hija que está estudiando en la universidad. Desde muy joven se involucró en la venta de comida porque apoyaba a su madre en esta actividad, y al fallecer ella, Adilia heredó el puesto en el mercado. Desde entonces, hace 40 años, viene ejerciendo el mismo oficio de su madre, de lo que se siente muy orgullosa. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque dice que “nació para esto”, además tiene una exquisita sazón, pues sus clientes la visitan constantemente para saborear las comidas típicas de su región. Con MFP ya tiene 10 préstamos y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque entre todos sus compañeros se comprenden y pagan sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas regionales y también mandará a ampliar y ambientar adecuadamente su puesto.
texts.en:
Adilia is 55 years old. Her husband is a merchant and her daughter is a university student. Since she was a young woman, Adilia has been selling food because she helped her mother in this line of work. After her mother passed away, Adilia inherited her vending location in the market. She is very proud to have been doing the same work as her mother for 40 years. She enjoys her work because, in her words, she was “born to do this”. She also has a wonderful time being with her customers, who visit her frequently to taste her traditional regional foods.

She has already had 10 previous loans with MFP. Adilia enjoys working with her communal bank group because the members understand each other and pay their installments responsibly. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase the necessary ingredients for making her regional dishes. She also would like to expand her business and create a pleasant environment for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing meals

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Marguerite est âgée de 65 ans. Marguerite a fait des études primaires. Mais, c’est des produits alimentaires que Marguerite vend, à savoir : maïs, farine de manioc, tomates fraîches, etc. C’est depuis son jeune âge que Marguerite est dans cette activité. Marguerite est à son septième crédit avec ALIDé. Marguerite a besoin de ce prêt-ci pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Marguerite, 65, attended primary school, but she sells foodstuffs, for example maize, manioc flour, fresh tomatoes, etc. She has been doing this since she was young. Marguerite is on her 7th loan with ALIDé. Marguerite needs this loan to increase her working capital so as to respond efficiently to her clientele's demand.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 6 sacks of 100 kg of maize and 2 big baskets of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: To make a more comfortable settlement, a lady who had married to Thol, 38, a man who spread its service as a local construction provider, Samiem in the age of 36 has taken to build her wooden house for her family. She owns a grocery store in front of her house selling food ingredients, and household needs for almost one year. She has two children all of whom are still young and attend school.

loans.use: to build her wooden house for her family.

loans.name: Akuma

texts.en:
Akuma T. is currently in the business of selling charcoal in the store and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She is 30 years old and married with a husband who is a soldier. She has two children and both her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor bike.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: S. is 26 and her husband’s name is Mr. Chenda, age 29. S. and her family reside in Battambang province, in Cambodia, where she owns a small grocery business in her home. She sells some items to her villagers and passers-by across the road in front of her shop. Besides the grocery business, she and her husband also do farming work in the village. S. was married years and has given birth to a lovely young child, who is enrolled in the primary school. S. is busy selling her items everyday and never wastes time. Recently, her inventory has been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is looking for a $500 loan.
