Victoria, desde hace quince años, diariamente transita las calles de su ciudad en su pequeña movilidad (triciclo), ofreciendo una inmensa variedad de frutas y verduras por temporadas; ahora la encontramos vendiendo diligentemente sus deliciosos y nutritivos choclos, producto bandera de su país Perú, que por esta temporada tiene gran demanda por la población.Ella es una diligente y emprendedora madre de tres hijos, que trabaja arduamente junto a su esposo, Francisco, quien se desempeña como obrero en una mina muy lejana de su pueblo, con el único propósito de ofrecerles educación y bienestar a sus retoños.El deseo de Victoria es aumentar aún más sus productos, para que con la comercialización de estos pueda generar mayores ingresos económicos, para finalmente ahorrar y terminar de refaccionar su pequeño domicilio, que muy ávidamente construyó junto a su compañero de toda la vida, su esposo. Para concretar sus planes Victoria solicita un préstamo y les extiende su compromiso de reembolsarlos en un lapso de seis meses. En estos momentos ellos esperan ansiosos tu respuesta.

loans.use: More capital in order to offer more products

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị A., 40 years of age, lives with her husband and 3 children. She tends her beef stand at the open market near home while her husband, Trần Xuân Hòa, is buying cows for meat from nearby provinces and butchering them for her stand. From their beginning of purchasing wholesale beef, now Hòa butchers for their own, and also extra for supplying to other small meat stands. The family’s business has been steady for 5 years now. It requires more capital for expansion so she applies a special loan of 1200USD. The family’s monthly income is 150USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị A. năm nay 40 tuổi sống cùng chồng và 3 con. Công việc chính của chị là bán thịt bò ở chợ trong khi chồng chị, A. Trần Xuân Hòa, mua bò từ các tỉnh lân cận mang về mổ thịt cho vợ bán. Gia đình chị A. làm công việc này được 5 năm nay. Bắt đầu từ chỗ chỉ đến các lò mổ lấy thịt, đến nay gia đình chị đã tự mổ thịt bò và cung cấp cho các cửa hàng nhỏ. Công việc này đòi hỏi một nguồn tài chính tương đối lớn nên chị đã đề nghị Quỹ TYM cho vay mức vốn đặc biệt là 1200USD. Mức thu nhập bình quân một tháng của gia đình chị A. hiện nay là 150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Purchase more cows for meat.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Dominga M. is a 58 year old woman who is married with three children. Although all of her children are grown and living outside of the house, Maria still works everyday in her convenience store to earn income for her and her husband. While her husband is working in construction, Maria is busy making Biscochuelos (honey bread), pies, Empanadas, and other snack foods.

There is great demand for her homemade foods and with this loan she will continue baking more goods for her store and her customer’s craving during the afternoon snack time in Paraguay (called Merienda). Along with buying more ingredients, she will also purchase more general grocery goods to be sold in her convenience store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her convenience store such as sugar, meta, dairy, and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Kireka B6 A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rehema N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to boost business. Rehema is 33 years old and is divorced. She has 6 children ranging from age 13 months to 16 years old and five of them go to school. Each week, Rehema makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Rehema has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rehema is joined in her small group by Christine N., Aminah A., Harriet M., and Anna A.. Christine N. has a business selling clothes and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Aminah A. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to add to her business. Harriet M. operates a canteen business and wants to add stock. Anna A. is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To add in more working capital in cloth business

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Residing in Lomé for more than 10 years, Mrs. Afi A. comes from Yopé, which is located 40 kilometers from Lomé. She was born on July 15, 1975 and is married with two children. A very dynamic woman, Mrs. Afi A. retails charcoal, yams and other vegetables, smoked fish, and other foodstuffs in the Adidoadé neighborhood in Lomé. At present, her stock of charcoal is almost gone.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 725 to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal which she intends to sell during the rainy season, when the price of charcoal is high.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Installée à Lomé depuis plus de dix (10) ans, Madame A. Afi est originaire de Yopé localité située à 40 Km de Lomé. Elle est née le 15 juillet 1975 et est mariée avec deux enfants. Très dynamique, Madame A. Afi est revendeuse de charbon de bois, tubercules, de légumes, de poissons fumés et d’autres produits alimentaires dans le quartier Adidoadé à Lomé. Présentement son stock de charbon de bois est presque épuisé.

A cet effet, elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 300.000FCFA pour acheter trente (30) sacs de charbon de bois pour pouvoir vendre en saison des pluies, période pendant laquelle le charbon de bois coûte cher.

loans.use:
Stock up on charcoal for re-sale

Faire le stock de charbon de bois

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa S. is 58 years old, married, and a member of the village bank of Niaguiss Néma in Ziguinchor. She buys palm oil and lemons at the weekly market and also fresh fish, which she transforms into smoked fish in Agnack. Awa goes to sell these products in Dakar. She has significant experience in this business, which she has run for several years. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Awa S., 58 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Niaguiss Néma à Ziguinchor. Elle achète de l’huile de palme et du citron dans les marchés hebdomadaires et le poisson frais qu’elle transforme en poisson fumé à Agnack. Awa va vendre ses produits à Dakar. Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité qu’elle mène depuis des années. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, lemons, fresh fish, and wood

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Strength and will are Edith’s main qualities. Since she was a child, she displayed her abilities of being enterprising and diligent, which is why her business endeavors have given her the opportunity to achieve anything that she resolved to do. Thanks to the delicious juices that she sells and her great customer service, she has obtained faithful customers who frequent her stand on a daily basis in order to drink her nutritious nectars. Edith would like to expand her business, so she plans on purchasing chairs, benches, and a blender to offer her customers greater comfort and speedy service.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Su fortaleza y voluntad, fueron las principales características de Edith, quien desde niña demostró ser emprendedora y diligente, es por ello las actividades a las que se ha dedicado le han otorgado la posibilidad de concretar lo que se ha propuesto.Gracias a los deliciosos jugos que ofrece y sobre todo a la buena atención que brinda logró obtener asiduos clientes que diariamente concurren a su puestito para consumir sus nutritivos néctares.El deseo de Edith es ampliar e implementar su negocio, para ello tiene pensado adquirir sillas, bancas y licuadora para mayor comodidad y una rápida atención de sus clientes.

loans.use: Improve business space for greater customer comfort

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say M. and her husband, Mr. Voeurn Vin, are traditional healers who can generate a small profit in Soben (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Even though they do not have any children, they live in poor conditions because inflation has increased a lot in Cambodia.

They are currently in an old house, so Mrs. Say M. is requesting a loan to buy timber to build a new house. Mrs. Say M. used a previous loan from AMK to buy a new motorbike so they could sell their traditional medicine treatment door-to-door.

Mrs. Say M. was not available, so her husbend, Mr. Voeurn Vin, appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a new house

loans.name: Faithful Group

texts.en:
These group members are Ramatu Kamara and Aminata B.. They named their group Faithful. They are requesting a loan of Le 1,200,000. The former sells ground-nuts and palm-oil during the raining season (between April and September) and "gara lappers" (locally dyed clothes) in the dry season (October to March). Like the former, the latter also sells garas during the dry season, and market food and fire woods during the raining season. This is because, during the rains, edible products sell more than clothes.

Ramatu is the leader of the group. She is now 33 and is single with one child. She was born in Makeni and has been in this business for over 3 years now. Ramatu's previous loan helped her a lot. She was able to pay her child's fee for the National Primary School Exams. She was able to solve most of her numerous problems out of the proceeds she gets from the business. With a new loan, she expects to buy a total of 10 bags of ground nuts and 12 "batters" (5 gallons make a batter) of palm-oil. Previously, she was trading with only 5 bags of rice and 6 batters of palm-oil.

loans.use: Expand on their businesses.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia belongs to the Communal Bank Glorioso.

Victoria is married, 42 years old, and has 3 children. Zenobia has a store in her house located in the Rioja area of San Juan Bautista, where she sells groceries, fruit, beverages, gas. She runs this business with her husband and children every day of the week. Zenobia travels monthly to Lima to buy various candies and new products that she can sell in her store. Zenobia is planning on implementing a clothing store.

Zenobia needs a loan of 1050 soles to invest in buying snacks, chocolates, and a variety of juices.

Zenobia dreams that her children will grow up to be professionals, of improving her business and having a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Zenobia es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.

Zenobia es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Zenobia tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el jr. Rioja en el distrito de San Juan Bautista, en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, bebidas, gas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos y esposo, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana, Zenobia viaja mensualmente a la ciudad de Lima para comprar golosinas variadas y productos novedosos que pueda vender en su tienda. Zenobia tiene proyectado implementar una tienda de ropa.

Zenobia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, chocolates, jugos variados.

Zenobia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y tener una tienda de ropa.

loans.use: Zenobia needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy snacks, chocolates and a variety of juices.

loans.name: Gulush

texts.en: Gulush R. is a 61-year-old grandmother and the mother of two sons. She is very proud that, even at this age, she is able to manage her own business. She started her business in 2000 and since that time it has been her main source of income. She currently has two cows and her main income comes from selling dairy products. She and her husband are on a pension now. Gulush is planning to purchase one additional cow to increase her income. For this purpose she requests  a loan of $800 USD. This is his first request for loan, and she promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.ru:
Файзуллоева Рукия, 1975 года рождения. Она замужем и у нее 3 детей. Начала свой бизнес 15 лет назад с продажи товаров народного потребления. Сейчас у нее широкий ассортимент продовольственных товаров и товаров народного потребления. Это разновидность консервов, печений, макаронных изделий, чая кофе и таких товаров как мыло, стиральные и чистящие порошки и т.д. 
Свой товар Рукия закупает в оптовом рынке Сафарцентра и продает на рынке Баракат города Турсунзаде. Для увеличения товарооборота хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для закупа консервов и макаронных изделий.
texts.en:
Rukiya F. is married and has 3 children. She started her business 15 years ago by selling consumer goods. Currently, she has a wide assortment of food and consumer goods. This includes canned goods, cookies, pasta products, tea, coffee and goods, such as soap, detergent and cleaning powders, etc. Rukiya purchases her goods at the Safarcentre wholesale market and sells them at the Barakat market in Tursunzoda. In order to increase her goods turnover, she wants to obtain a $1200 loan for purchasing canned goods and pasta products.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase canned goods and pasta products

loans.name: Comlan Déo

texts.fr: Marié et père de trois enfants, D. Comlan Déo vit à Aného où il a appris le métier de chauffeur. Et comme il n'exerce pas pleinement son métier de chauffeur, il s'est lancé dans le commerce de bois et chevrons de tecks qu’il achète au préalable et les revend aux charpentiers et menuisiers. Pour développer ce commerce qui est prometteur, il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock. Ce qui lui permettra d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et de faire face aux charges de sa famille
texts.en:
Married and the father of three, Mr. Comlan Déo D. lives in Aného, where he learned to be a chauffeur. And since he doesn't fully work as a driver, he got started in the commerce of wood and teak roof beams that he buys beforehand and resells to carpenters and cabinet-makers. To develop his promising business, he is requesting this loan to increase his inventory. This will enable him to raise his sales figures and to cope with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell lumber and teak beams

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie Omoregbee is a hair stylist and also sells grooming supplies in her salon. She is 35 years old and married with one child. Her husband makes a living building furniture. Julie has applied for this loan to buy more supplies to sell. She says thank you to all the people who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long P. earns a living as a local used-clothes seller.  She was born in 1952 and is a widow who is currently living in Kompong Tom province.  She has been selling used-clothes for more than three years, and is earning an average of $2 each day. 

She has two children; both of them are married and are employed as fish sellers.  Two of her cousins are living with her and are working as rice farmers. 

Long P. works hard every day at her small business and has a lot of regular customers who recognize the good clothes she provides.  Recently, she has been selling all her clothes in a store.  Hence, she seeks a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Mr. Yon Mouk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Yon M. is 46 years old and is the father of four children; two are employed in a garment factory with the others attending a local school. Mr. Yon M. is the village bank president selected by the members. The village bank consists of twenty members, and is located in Preak Traeng village in the Kandal province. The members plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Yon M. and his wife, Mrs. Yon Savon are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, they earn very little rice revenue to supP. their family members. To improve their standard of living, Mr. Yon M. is asking for a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions.

Three members in this group have loans that are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product, because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate D. is forty–two years old. She is married with four children, a boy and three girls. Kate says her son is in the junior high school while the others are in the basic school. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. 
Charlotte trades to help her husband provide for the family. She deals in food stuffs such as cocoyam, plantain and some vegetables. Her husband is a palm nut farmer.
She procures her goods from farmers in the surrounding communities. She sells in her house to customers who come to buy. Her children also sell in their neighborhood. Kate has been in business for eight years. She wants a loan to buy her  goods in bulk.
She desires to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy bulk cassava and plantain

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces.
Teofila es soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Teofila es Técnica Dental, tiene un laboratorio dental en su casa, para lo cual cuenta con 2 empleados, brinda servicios a diferentes consultorios dentales.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de material dental.
Los sueños de Teofila son que su hija tenga una buena educación, mejorar el local de su laboratorio y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Willows Community Bank. She is single, is 23 years old and has one child. Teofila is a dental technician. She has a dental laboratory in her house, and she has two employees. She offers different dental consulting services. Teofila needs a loan for 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of dental supplies. Her dreams are for her daughter to have a good education, to improve the setting for her laboratory and to have financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dental supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria de 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños en edad escolar. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad ocupando un espacio que implemento al frente de su casa. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 3 años, y es la fuente de ingresos que complementa el trabajo de su esposo, para el sustento de ella y de sus hijos, a quienes les brinda lo necesario para sus estudios. A Gloria le agrada mucho su trabajo, ya que gracias al mismo y su carisma al atender, cuenta con una gran clientela. Esta es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, además le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque le hay mucha confianza y comunicación entre todos sus integrantes, lo que facilita su trabajo de grupo, y su buen desempeño ante su asesora de crédito. Gloria invertirá el dinero en la compra de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 24-year-old married mother of two school-age children. She sells groceries and staple items from a space in the front of her house. She has had the shop for three years, and it is already a good source of income. Gloria's earnings, coupled with those of her husband, cover their household expenses and provide for the education of their children. Gloria really enjoys her work, and thanks to her charm and customer service, she has a very large clientele.

This is Gloria's first loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA. She has enjoyed working with her community bank because there is much trust and communication among the members, which facilitates the functioning of the group and assures their good evaluation from their loan advisor.

Gloria will invest this loan in the purchase of groceries and staple goods.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Reygie

texts.en:
Reygie A. is 30 years old. She is married and the happy mother of three children. Her husband is a hardworking farmer. They both work hard for the future of their children. Reygie lives with her family in Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental, Philippines.

Reygie buys and sells fruits and vegetables in their village. She peddles her products every day. Sometimes, she just has her stall standing by their residence and entertains walk-in customers. Reygie works with determination on her business because she considers herself the breadwinner of the family. All of her children go to school and all are still dependents of Reygie.

For now, Reygie is planning to rent a stall in the market. According to her, this is much better than peddling. In order for Reygie to reach her plans, she wants to take advantage of the loan opportunity given by HSPFI (a Kiva partner). She is now applying for loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00. This amount would cover her rent expenses and additional stocks of fruits and vegetables. She is aiming for a higher income, and she plans to have savings for future use.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Mateo A. quiere construir un cuarto en su vivienda por que en la casa donde vive es muy pequeña y no es nada cómodo vivir en ella ya que todos viven apretados. El con el tiempo ha ido formando un patrimonio para su familia con ahorros de toda su vida ahora ven una nueva opción de poder terminar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Mateo A. wants to build a room in his home because the house where he lives is too small and not at all comfortable given that they all have little space. As time has passed he has been building his patrimony for his family and now with his life’s savings has the opportunity to finish his project.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Victoria es casada, tiene 34 años y 5 hijos, Victoria vive en la selva ayacuchana en donde tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Victoria también compra y vende cacao, café.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de café y cacao.
Los sueños de Victoria son aumentar su negocio y comprar una computadora para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the community bank Llamkasum, which means "we work" in Quechua. Victoria is married, has 5 children and is 34 years old. Victoria lives in the Ayacucho jungle where she has a shop in her home where she works every day selling groceries, vegetables and fruit. Victoria also buys and sells cocoa and coffee. Victoria needs a loan of 1050 soles to purchase coffee and cocoa. Victoria's dream is to grow her business and buy a computer for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee and cocoa

loans.name: Lidia Maria

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Bancomunal San Juan.
Lidia es casada tiene 57 años, cinco Hijos D. todos mayores e independiente.
Lidia empezó poco  apoco dando servicios, con una maquina, conforme ahorra compraba otra maquina, actualmente tiene mas D. diez maquinas ella da servicio D. confección a las empresas que exportan prendas D. vestir.  
DesD. que esta en Finca gracias a los prestamos ha podido capitalizarse, aprendió a invertir y ahorrar.
Lidia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para  cambiar D. calamina y poner piso D. loseta.     
El sueño D. Lidia es exportar prendas D. vestir.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Community Bank San Juan.

Lidia is married, she is 57 years old, and she has 5 grown children.

Lidia started out providing tailoring services, at first with only one sewing machine. When she saved enough money she purchase additional sewing machines, and now she has more than ten sewing machines that are used to make clothing for export.

Since she has been with Finca (Kiva Field Parnter) she has been able to capitalize on the loans, learning along the way how to invest and how to save money.

Lidia requires a loan in the amount of 1000 soles to remodel her flooring and install tiles.

Lidia's dream is to become a clothing exporter.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel the flooring and install tiles

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32 year old Josephine A. from Mwanza. She is married. Josephine has been running a charcoal business since 2008. She sells charcoal, which is small, black pieces of dry earth that are used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two people. Josephine currently earns about 273USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500USD in order to purchase charcoal stocks in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Josephine thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal stocks in bulk.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier G. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP lo cuales fuero para mejorar su vivienda y los pago puntual mente. En esté momento desea poner la losa de concreto al frente de su casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario, para poder comprar el material ya que el se dedica a la construcción en horario adicional a su emplea realizara la mejorar.
      Es por es que está solicitando un préstamo,porque quiere que su familia tengo mejor lugar y seguro donde vivir.
      La persona que nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Agdelina Ortiz quien es la persona que aparece en la foto, ya que el señor Francisco se encontraba trabajando.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Javier G. has already had two credits from FVP which were to improve his home and he repaid them punctually. Now he wishes to put a paving stone in front of his house, but does not have the money necessary to be able to buy the material because he is working on the construction during additional hours he needs to undertake the improvement. It is because of this that he is requesting a loan, because he wants that his family has a better and safer place to live. The person in the photo is his wife, Agdelina Ortiz, because Mr. Francisco was working at the time.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Placing a paving stone in his house

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
L. señora Nancy L. desD. hace 6 años estableció una papelería frente a su casa llamada “Los Pinos”. Este negocio lo puso pensando en el bienestar D. sus hijos ya que así no descuidaría el cuidado D. ellos por que estaría trabajando en su misma casa. ElL. recomendada por otro cliente se da cuenta del apoyo que se ofrece en esta institución y se interesa en pedir un préstamo para surtir su negocio. Como se viene L. temporada D. L. compra D. útiles escolares elL. quiere comprar más mercancía para tener mucha variedad D. artículos escolares y el cliente se vaya satisfecho D. los precios. 
A si elL. tendrá más ingresos en su negocio y así ayudara a su esposo con los gastos familiares y estudios D. sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
6 years ago, Nancy Lucia established a stationary store across the street from her house called "Los Pinos" (The Pines). She created this business thinking about the well being of her children because so that she would not neglect caring for them by working from home. She was recommended by another client who was impressed by the support that this institution offers, so she became interested in requesting a loan to stock up her business. Because the back-to-school season is coming up during which people buy school supplies, she wants to buy more goods to have a variety of school supplies and keep her clients happy with the prices. In this way, Nancy would have more income for her business and be able to help her husband with the family expenses and studies for her small children.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up goods

loans.name: Chiku

texts.en:
Chiku is a member of the Zilipendwa borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 14,12 and 7 years.

Chiku started her own business selling potatoes and banana 4 years ago,she works 13 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 66,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Chiku`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more potatoes and banana.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Chiku hopes to save money,pay school fees,get,more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more banan and potatoes

loans.name: Jeninah

texts.en: Mrs. K. Jeninah is a promising business lady, aged thirty years old and owns a saloon in kabwohe trading center. She is a married woman with three children. She has been in the business for over five years. She is using the loan to invest in her business by stocking hair chemicals, hair treatments, hair foods, rollers, etc for the excellent service to her customers. Also she owns a piggery farm and she will invest partly in the pig business. Her future hope is to increase on the returns from her saloon business and pig business

loans.use: To invest in her business by stocking hair chemicals, hair treatments, hair foods, rollers, etc for the excellent service to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acheter des outils de travail

loans.name: Emomkul

texts.ru: Эмомкул Куканов проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Жена работает в школе учителем. Сам Эмомкул более 13 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Старший сын находится на заработках в России. Кредит просит для покупки крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Emomkul K. lives in the Yavan region. He is 46 years old. He is married and has seven children. His wife works as a school teacher. Emomkul has been doing animal husbandry for more than thirteen years. He feeds and sells cattle. His oldest son is working in Russia. He is asking for a loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en:
Batnasan B. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Dornogobi province in eastern Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her three sons all attend a local secondary school.

B. operates a small grocery shop in her town, providing a variety of food products to her customers. She opened her grocery shop in early 2009 after previously selling her goods from a rented stall at the local market. The move has quickly proven to have been a good decision and she is already making plans to expand her shop. Her business progress and earnings have enabled her to greatly improve her family's quality of life.

B. is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase more products to expand her product line.

loans.use: To purchase more products to expand her product line

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema R. is a married Tanzanian businesswoman. She runs a café selling a variety of baked and fried foods and soft drinks in the Tandika district in Dar es Salaam.  The goods are purchased from the city markets and the soft drinks from the soft drinks agency. They are bought wholesale and retail.  She has been in the business for five years and she manages to meet her daily family and business needs with the income. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a single man. He's 22 years old. He has been working in furniture since 2005 to provide, along with his father, better living conditions for the family. Today, Ali is asking for a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy merchandise needed for his business so he can satisfy the heavy demands of the market and help increase his income.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie C. is from the town of Dela Cruz Bamban Tarlac. He is 40 years old. Jessie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jessie has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and give him the ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jessie from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Djiguisseme sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana coura, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parentés et exercent  le commerce d’articles divers (habits, chaussures, encens, condiments alimentaires etc.)
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et exigeante,  ce groupe de femmes décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire et les quatre prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 100Kg de graine d’encens, 5 à 10 pièces de bazin, 50 à 100 paires de chaussures en plastique et une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires (trois sacs de 50Kg d’oignon, des poivres, des cubes maggi,  des spaghettis et des boites de concentrée de tomate). La plupart de ces marchandises est acheté à Bamako et sont revendus au marché de Fana et aux domiciles des femmes à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 22 500FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. 
Elles ambitionnent de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus telle que la teinture.
texts.en:
The six members of this Djiguisseme group are married women with an average age of 40 and on average, 4 children. They live in big traditional families with their husbands and children in the town of Fana, Fana Coura neighborhood, Sous-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali.

They met through being neighbors and/or being related to each other, and they sell various items (clothing, shoes, incense, condiments, etc.) So as to satisfy their ever-growing and ever more demanding clientele, this group of women decided to work with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 5th solidarity loan, and their four preceding loans were correctly reimbursed. With this loan they expect to buy 100 kg of incense grains, 5-10 lengths of "bazin" (undyed damask cloth), 50-100 pairs of plastic shoes, and a large quantity of condiments (three sacks of 50 kg each of onions, peppers, Maggi cubes, spaghetti, and tins of tomato concentrate.)

Most of this merchandise is bought in Bamako and sold in the marketplace in Fana and out of the women's homes to a clientele made up of women and men. They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 22,500 F CFA. Part of the profit will be reinvested in their businesses and the rest used for daily family expenses. Their ambition is to diversify their businesses by taking up other money-earning activities such as dyeing cloth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items

loans.name: Ernelita

texts.en: Ernelita grew up on a farm because her parents are farmers. She learned farming from them. She is now 45 years old, married, and has eleven children. She is also a farmer now. She cultivates her land for rice crops, like most of the farmers in her town in Agusan Del Sur. When she learned about CEVI, she immediately joined to gain access to financial opportunities. She is now requesting a loan of Php 8,000. She will use this loan to fund her farm. She will buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Shakila Farid Group

texts.en:
This is the Shakila Farid Group which has three members. M. Farid is the group leader.

M. Farid is a young boy of 23 and a hardworking and responsible person as well. He has a general store where he works seven days a week and all his family members benefit through the income he generates. With the loan he would like to expand his business.

The second member is Shakila who has a bead-working business and through this she is popular in her area as her clients like her work. With the Kiva loan she will purchase necessary materials for her business.

The third member is Norma who is a tailor. She sews different kinds of clothes and with the loan she would like to purchase a new sewing machine to work in a better way.

All three would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Karen Maritza

texts.es: La joven Karen  vive en un barrio Arlen Siu,  de la capital de Managua, casada, y con dos hijos, es muy dedicada al trabajo para poder hacer las mejoras a su pequeña casa que junto con su esposo han venido realizando, el trabaja como cadete de taxi es propio y desde horas temprana sale a dar su servicios.  Ella trabaja en un supermercado impulsando productos y lleva varios años, lo que desea hacer con este préstamo es un anexo en la parte de enfrente de su casa como un porche para poder tener mas espacio ya que la sala es pequeña y no tiene mucha comodidad.  Ya que vive con su mama y abuelita que es la que cuida de sus dos niñas, su mama es costurera y trabaja en la casa y en conjunto se apoyan. Comprara materiales de construcción como: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines para comenzar la obra. Contenta con el préstamo que Afodenic a dado ya que solo mediante el financiamiento esta logrando las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
The young woman, Karen, lives in the Alen Siu neighborhood, in the capital Managua. She is married, has two children, and is very dedicated to working so she can make improvements to the small home her and her husband have been building. Her husband works as a taxi driver and leaves early in the morning to start work. Karen has worked in a supermarket promoting products for several years. With this loan she would like to build an annex onto the front of their house to service as a porch. This way they could have more space since the living room is very small and not very comfortable since she lives with her mother and grandmother, who look after her two children. Her mother is a seamstress who works from home. They all help each other out. Karen will buy building materials like: blocks, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and beams to get the project started. She is happy with the loan Afodenic has given her, since this is the only way she can make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials like: blocks, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and beams to start building her porch.

loans.name: Magaui

texts.en:
Magaui N. is 44 and married with 7 children (ages 8 - 28).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Magaui has many years of experience in this business.  Magaui needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2005, Magaui joined SPBD.    This is her 6th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Magaui's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Magaui N. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.8 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Casimiro Francisco

texts.pt:
Casimiro Francisco B. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 37 anos de idade casado e pai de 4 filhos de 15, 10, 4 e 2 anos de idade, os 2 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustente a mãe que vive com ela.
Saiu de Chibuto para Boane na Província de Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 8 anos, é serralheiro e possui um estaleiro de material de construção. Possui um ajudante, tem um rendimento de cerca de 5000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimo no NOVO BANCO e dividiu não continuar por vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material (cimento, pregos, parafusos, material eléctrico e outros) para diversificar e aumentar a quantidade de seu material no estaleiro. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar o seu estaleiro e concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Casimiro Francisco was born in the Chibuto District in the Gaza Province, South of Mozambique. He is 37 years old, married and the father of 4 children who are 15, 10, 4 and 2 years old. The two oldest are in school. He only went to school until the 8th grade and didn't finish due to lack of financial resources. He lives with his family in his own house and supports his mother who lives with him. He left Chibuto to go to Boane, in the Maputo Province, to look for better living conditions. He has had his own business for more than 8 years. He is a locksmith and sells building materials. He has one helper and earns around 5.000.00mt per month, which goes towards household expenses and a savings account. He has requested a loan with Novo Bank and decided not to continue for various reasons. He came to know Hluvuku through his friend who is also a partner of the institution. This loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, is his first. He intends to buy building materials (cement, nails, screws, electric material and others) in order to diversify and increase his inventory. He is committed to paying this loan on time in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, he would like to request more loans to increase the size of his business, finish his house and provide better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of supplies (cement, nails, screws, electric materials and others)

loans.name: Hope Sisters Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Fatu J. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. They named their group 'Hope Sisters'. They have formed themselves into a group of four in order to seek a loan of SLL 700,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, they can improve their business both in size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales, better profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

Their leader Fatu, who was born in Sanda village, northern Sierra Leone, is married and has seven children – two in college, two in secondary school and three businessmen. Fatu sells a wide variety of items at the Makeni lorry park. Some of the items she sells include Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, soap, toothpaste, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy Maggi cubes, salt, soap, toothpaste, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo Saúl de 36 años y sus hijos Alexandra de 10 y José de 05 añitos de edad. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Ella se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de zapatillas por pedido. Su forma de trabajo consiste en ofrecer los variados y bonitos diseños de una marca de zapatillas por catalogo a sus posibles clientes para luego realizar pedidos y venderlos según los gustos de cada uno de ellos. A Elena le gusta mucho su trabajo pues le da libertad para realizarlo, ella usualmente ofrece las zapatillas por la mañana y en las tardes realiza cobranzas a las personas a las que ya les vendió su mercadería, puesto que a algunas de ellas se las deja al crédito. Su esposo José también trabaja en el rubro de las zapatillas pero él lo hace para una empresa, es por ello que ambos en un futuro quisieran tener un gran puesto en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la zona en la que vive. Elena es una clienta muy antigua en MFP y en su larga trayectoria a demostrado mucha responsabilidad con los pagos, este es su séptimo crédito y se siente seguro de seguir cumpliendo como hasta ahora. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo derivará en la compra de zapatillas para cumplir con los pedidos pendientes que tiene en el colegio de su hija y de otros clientes que tiene, donde sabe obtendrá buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Elena is 36 years old and lives with her husband Saúl José (age 36) and their two children, Alexandra (age 10) and José (age 5). They live together in their own home. Elena has been selling athletic shoes upon request for four years. Her work involves offering different designs and brands of athletic shoes through a catalog to potential customers based on their personal tastes and delivering the merchandise to those who decide to order them. Elena enjoys her work greatly because it gives her freedom. She usually offers her products in the morning and then collects payments in the afternoon from people who have already received their merchandise, since she extends credit to some of her customers. Her husband Saúl José is also in the same line of work selling athletic shoes, except he is employed by a company. In the future, both of them want to open a large vending post at one of the busiest markets in the area where they live.

Elena is a long-time client of MFP and has demonstrated great responsibility with her payments throughout this period. This is her seventh loan and she feels confident that she will complete it as she has done with the others until now. The loan she requested will be used to buy athletic shoes so that she can fulfill pending orders from her daughter’s school and her other customers. She knows this will generate good earnings for her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase athletic shoes

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en:
Kudirat sells groceries and has been in this trade for many years now. She is requesting for a loan of NGN170, 000 to purchase more groceries to sell, this she said will reduce cost prize, transportation to market and increase her profit. Also enable her serve costumers better and improve on her care for the family.
Kudirat is 64 years old, widow and has three children. The family lives in Lagos state. Kudirat says thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena sells women's shoes at the central market in Uzhgorod town. She has been in this business for ten years. Her income is 3,000 UAH per month.

Olena is the kind of person who, if she decides something, goes slowly but persistently until she reaches her goal. When she started this business, she  wanted to be economically independent and she has now reached this goal. Today, she has many regular clients and a stable business. Olena is a very friendly person and has good relationships with her neighbors at the market. 

Olena would like to borrow 6,400 UAH to purchase additional inventory.  She hopes to make greater profit and improve her living condition.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Mugarama Parents Association, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Hard work and the creative nature of B. Robert has seen him operate a thriving business handling sales of local brew or liquor, commonly referred to as waragi, alongside his modest retail shop here in Uganda.

This married father of one child has been running his business for the last six years in Magarama, Ibanda. Over this time, he has faced a major problem of having too little capital to purchase the materials used, including bananas whose price of 75,000 shillings is what he gains on a weekly basis.

Therefore, with this this loan, Robert is looking at reviving his business by buying more sweet bananas for making local brew and also expanding his retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase more sweet bananas and more retail stock like salt, etc.

loans.name: Por La Gracia De Dios Group

texts.es:
Johana Isabel Cortez Morales, María Mercedes R. García y Yadira Elizabeth Cortez Morales tres mujeres joviales, emprendedoras y esforzadas quienes conforman el grupo Por la Gracia de Dios. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Cortez Morales se dedica a comercializar de todo un poco desde pupusas, elotes, cigarro, dulces, chiverías según comento.

Ella desde temprana edad se dedica a este tipo de comercio ya que ella le ayudaba a su madre a comercializar. El sueño de ella es ser millonaria eso dijo entre risas.

Sus compañeros de grupo son María Mercedes R. García tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace seis años y Jadira Elizabeth Cortez Morales se dedica al comercio de ropa.
texts.en:
Johana Isabel Cortez Morales, María Mercedes R. García, and Yadira Elizabeth Cortez Morales are three cheerful, enterprising, and hard-working women. They comprise the Por la Gracia de Dios (By the Grace of God) group. Mrs. Cortez Morales is the coordinator of the group. She says that she sells a little bit of everything from “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) to beans, cigarettes, sweets, and yogurt. She started this type of work at a young age because she helped her mother sell. She said with laughter that her dream is to be a millionaire. One of her colleagues in the group is María R. García. She has had a small mini market for six years. Their other colleague, Jadira Elizabeth Cortez Morales, sells cloths.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various products

loans.name: Silvia Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Silvia es una mujer emprendedora, madre de tres hijos, desde joven ha trabajado, aprendió costura el cual eran parte de sus ingresos, pero luego se dedica  ala venta de cosméticos  y ropa nueva el cual el cincuenta por ciento vende por encargo,  lleva varios años, afiliada con la Avon, ya que son productos, accesibles de precios, bonitos, y reconocidos por los clientes.
Lo que desea hacer para mejorar su higiene es la terminación de un sumidero y comprar el inodoro para instalarlo y poder estar en mejores condiciones.
Ya que no cuenta con las aguas negras. Lo que se le ha hecho difícil poder hacer esta obra, ya que no cuenta con todo el efectivo, es por eso requiere del financiamiento y poder pagar a plazos que es de beneficios para hacer las mejoras de infraestructura que son de altos costos.
texts.en:
Silvia is an enterprising woman and the mother of three children. She has worked since she was very young; she learned how to make clothing, which provided part of her income, but later she started selling cosmetics and new clothing. She sells 50% of her products in response to customer orders. She has been affiliated with Avon for several years, since the company offers products which are affordable, attractive and recognized by her customers. What Silvia would like to do is improve the sanitary conditions in her home by completing the construction of a drain and purchasing and installing a toilet. This will greatly improve the situation in her home, since she currently does not have a wastewater connection. It has been difficult for her to undertake this project before now, since she has not had sufficient cash on hand to complete it. For this reason, she needs a loan, so that she can pay the amount over time and reap the benefits of this infrastructural improvement project, which is quite costly.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a drain and installing a toilet to improve her home's sanitary conditions

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: For the past ten years, Oscar has been in the cleaning business for commercial and residential buildings. Three years ago, with the help of his wife, he decided to start his own business. He now provides maintenance, upkeep, and car-wash services to the buildings where he works. Oscar loves being his own boss because it has given him a new freedom. He is passionate about the business and is able to send his daughters to university. He is confident that starting his own business has created a better future for his family. Oscar’s first loan with ACCION USA allowed him to buy equipment for his new car-wash service. Now he will use his second loan to buy lists of clients and expand his advertising capabilities. This will allow him to reach out to clients in the greater Miami area. With a great attitude and many client referrals, Oscar is happy to report that his business is constantly growing. He strives to provide excellent services to his clients, which they expect of him. Oscar is grateful for ACCION USA’s confidence in his business and is looking forward to taking on new residential and commercial buildings as customers. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy lists of clients, expand his advertising capabilities and create a website

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Lunas, Barangay Kawit, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:   food vending/carenderia, a general store and a trisikad business. Her husband Angelito C., 32 years old, works as a carpenter & trisikad driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  

They have 6 children who are between 9 and 24 years old. Lilibeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in March, 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lilibeth has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, which she intends to use to buy more food and inventory for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Lilibeth C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her food vending and inventory in general store.

loans.name: Caterine

texts.en: Caterine K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal, bread and tomatoes at the gate of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Caterine is 29 years old and is married to a man who works as a driver. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house that she can rent out.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. Sylvia has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for five years and she works six days out of every week. Sylvia works in the Kisaasi market and sells on a retail basis. 

Sylvia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal and foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, beef and rice. She also generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for Sylvia include seasonality and defaulters.  

Her goal for her business is to own a hotel. She decided to join MCDT because she wanted additional capital. 

Sylvia lives in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal, bunches of bananas and a bag of rice

loans.name: Gema Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Gema Elizabeth tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La señora tiene en su casa una pulpería ella  vende leña, frijoles cocidos, frutas, golosinas, detergentes y granos básicos. Tiene 3 años de tener este negocio, el cual como una alternativa de fuente de ingreso, esto con el objetivo de brindar manutención a sus hijos. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Además, aduce la señora, cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil. Ella sueña con seguir adelante en su negocio, tratando siempre de que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.
texts.en: Mrs. Gema Elizabeth is 38 years old, is married and has 4 children, two are underage and in her care. She has a convenience store in her home where she sells firewood, cooked beans, fruits, candy, detergents and basic grains. Mrs. Gema has had this business for 3 years; she started it as a new way to earn income for her family. She wants this loan to buy different products since she wants to increase her earnings. Mrs. Gema adds that each day, her products are more expensive which has been a challenge for her since her country’s economic condition becomes more difficult each day. Mrs. Gema dreams of continuing with her business making sure that her children go to school and prepare themselves for the future.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana B. is from the village of Wigan Cordon. She is 48 years old. Juliana is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Juliana owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Juliana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juliana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Juliana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, de 59 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de su hermano junto a su esposa Martha de 22 años y su querida hija Jazmín de 1 año, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Los largos días de trabajo que Arturo tiene en sus chacras, le han hecho ver que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograr una buena calidad en sus cultivos. Todas las mañanas, junto a los primeros rayos de sol, camina hasta sus chacras de café, plátano y palta, las  cuales están a una hora aproximadamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 19 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos que usa son muy peligrosos. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Arturo, 59 years old, is a quite simple and hardworking man. He lives in his brother’s home along with his 22-year-old wife Martha and his beloved one-year-old daughter Jasmine. They are the main reason for all his efforts.

The long workdays that Arthur puts in on his farms have made him realize that one must work very hard to achieve good crop quality. Every morning with the first sun-rays, he walks to his coffee, banana and avocado farms, which are about an hour away.

What he likes about his job is cultivating his land and he does so with great care. He has been doing this for the past 19 years and believes that the hardest part is spraying his farmland, because the chemicals he uses are very dangerous.

In the future, he expects to buy additional land to expand his crops. This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he knows he has to pay his dues on time if he wants to be granted another loan later. He is a very active partner of his community bank. With the thousand additional soles requested, he will buy more fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: Buy more fertilizer to increase his production

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is thirty-one years old.  She is separated from her partner and she lives along with family members in the city of Reque, which is to the south of the city of Chiclayo and serves as an intermediary market for fish and other items.  She lives in a more rural part of the town, but her home has electricity and water.  She has one four year old son to whom she is very dedicated.

Celia owns a small herd of cows from which she harvests milk.  She sells the fresh milk to her neighbors and in local markets.  The milk either meets the basic needs of the population or goes to the larger milk dealers in order to be processed into other products.  She is proud to be able to play an important role in earning income for her family.

This will be Celia's first experience with a financial institution.  She has never taken out a loan before.  She plans to use the funds in order to purchase female pigs.  She hopes to be able to expand her business and better provide for her family.  She also hopes to be able to reduce her risk by diversifying her business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 25 year-old Aminata. She is married and has one 7-year-old child. Aminata's brother's wife also lives with her. 

In 2005, Aminata established her shoe business. She started her business because she wanted to be independent. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 972800 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3000000 to buy more shoes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 194560. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business, generate more income, and acquire new assets. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional shoes

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza V. is a 30-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a ready-to-wear clothes business. She lives in Purok Masinolondon, Brgy Paraiso, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her ready-to-wear clothes business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP.
Riza is now borrowing 25,000 PHP so that she could purchase more stock to sell. This will be her eleventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Riza aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Visitacion's Group

texts.en:
Visitacion S. is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Echague, Isabela. She is 30 years old. Visitacion is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Visitacion is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Visitacion owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Visitacion has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month from these activities.

Visitacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Visitacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Visitacion is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Visitacion's third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jhonatan; el tiene 21 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de creaciones de páginas web, el realiza páginas web a diferentes instituciones o al público en general, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere seguir mejorando en el trabajo de creación de páginas web. El  socio solicita el préstamo para su salud para operar su nariz.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Virgen Guadalupe-Cusco". The bank is located in the district of Cusco which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Jhonatan. He is 21 years old and is single. He alternates his daily activities with his business of designing web pages. He designs web pages for different institutions and for the general public. He works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. He wants to keep improving his work designing web pages. He is requesting this loan for his health, to have nose surgery. 

The member is happy for this loan and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: For his health, to have nose surgery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying used clothes for resale

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is a happy 34-year-old married woman, who currently cares for two orphans.  She sells common household items such as spoons, plates, cups and other necessary items.  Her store is well organised, clean and packed with things.  She has been working for 10 years and is open from 8 am to 6 pm every day of the week.

Gorette would like to use her loan to purchase more items for her store and expand.  With more profit, she will buy cows and believes this will be the start of a new and better life.

loans.use: To purchase more spoons, cups and other houseware supplies

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude, a 31-year-old father of two children aged four and five years old, owns a restaurant serving African dishes. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs for his restaurant, and with the profits he plans to feed his family.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for his restaurant.

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en:
Zacharia, 30, is a dairy farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. He is married with four children aged between 2 and 7 years. He has been doing mixed farming for two years and selling his milk to the local market. He has employed one farmhand. He gets additional income from temporary employment in a local secondary school.

Zacharia has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income generated from this loan to pay for the education of his children. He is also focusing on owning five dairy cows in the future.

Zacharia laments that animal feeds have become very expensive due to scarcity.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edith; la socia tiene 39 años de edad, separada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de tamales ella trabaja en el mercado central de la ciudad de Cusco (San Pedro), la socia trabaja todas las mañanas y en la tarde vende en la puerta de una institución privada, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como  manteca, maíz, entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Richary Runa Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Ms. Edith is 39 years old, separated, and has two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and a business selling tamales. She works every morning in the central market in the city of Cusco (San Pedro). In the afternoon, she sells outside a private institution. Edith is a cheerful woman with a great desire to succeed for her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy butter, corn, and other ingredients for her business.

Edith is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy butter, corn, and other ingredients

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, tiene 44 años, es conviviente, con tres hijos(de 16,12,3 años). Pertenece al Banco Comunal Lila.
Solicita un crédito de S/. 3 000. Tiene un multiservicios (librería).
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una fotocopiadora.
Norma es de profesión ingeniero civil, realiza trabajos de evaluación de predios, saneamiento físico legal de terrenos, declaratoria de fabrica, también cuenta con un Multiservicio (librería) ubicada frente a Registros Públicos en Ayacucho.
Está en FINCA Perú, desde el 2006, le agrada porque es una entidad crediticia sólida de garantía y  solvencia. Se practica mucho los valores, les enseñan a ahorrar y pasa momentos gratos con sus con socias.
Su meta es tener una ferretería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Norma is 44 years old.  She lives with her partner and has three children aged 16, 12 and 3.  She is a member of the 'Lila' community bank.

Norma is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles.  She has a 'multi-service store' and she will invest her loan in buying a photocopier.
