Norma is a civil engineer by profession.  She does evaluation work and submits legal paperwork regarding building work on plots of land.  She also has a 'multi-service store' which is located opposite the land registry office in Ayacucho.

Norma has been working with FINCA Peru since 2006.  She likes it because it is a solid, reliable credit company which promotes values, teaches its members to save and allows them to spend some pleasant moments with the other members.

Norma's dream is to own a hardware store and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Chauffeur de profession, Mr  Kokouvi est  né en 1962, marié à une revendeuse et est père de 04 enfants.  Son activité de chauffeur ne prospère pas comme il le souhaite et il a décidé d’avoir une boutique en 2008 pour  revendre des produits de cafeteriat (lait, sucre, nescafé, lipton, riz, huile végétale…). Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans sa boutique. Ce second prêt lui servira à acheter des produits  afin de renforcer son activité et avoir une boutique plus grande pour pouvoir satisfaire ses nombreuses clients et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: A driver by profession, Mr Kokouvi was born in 1962, is married to a retailer, and is the father of 04 children. His activity as a driver is not as successful as he would like and he decided to open a shop in 2008 for the sale of cafeteria products (milk, sugar, instant coffee, tea, rice, vegetable oil...).He buys his produce at the big market in Lome and sells them at his shop. This second loan will be used to purchase stock in order to reinforce his business activity and increase the size of his shop  to satisfy his numerous customers and better provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchase cafeteria products ( milk, sugar,nescafé)

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash is a father of three children between one and six, and lives with his family in Kitale, Western Kenya. His been farming for five years, producing potatoes, maize, milk, and beans which are all sold at the local market. Joash subsidizes his farming income with a hotel business he runs in the local town. 

Joash has made a request for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds which he believes will have a great impact on his productivity and his family's living standards. He is optimistic that his farming business will triple in five years. 

Joash however notes that fluctuating market prices and climatic conditions are still a challenge to farmers. He adds that Juhudi Kilimo loans have increased small farmers' living standards.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, Rose has operated a business making soap and selling detergent.  She sells the products from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby.  A major business challenge is the high cost of transportation.  She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs. 

Rose requests a loan of KES 60,000.  She will use the funds to purchase chemicals, wax, and detergent to make soap. She joined Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, wax and detergent to make soap.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI I  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de NIAZEKAN de l’ex arrondissement de KIMPARANA, dans la préfecture de  SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de SORO Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
CATHERINE utilisera son prêt actuel pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles  pour la culture. Elle s’approvisionne essentiellement  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI I comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25000 à 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
This BENKADI I  group is made up of married women from the village of NIAZEKAN from the former administrative district of KIMPARANA, in the prefecture of SAN, SÉGOU region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They live in traditional families. They have an average age of 35 and at least five children each. 

They grow peanuts. Wishing to make their agricultural ventures profitable, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After having correctly reimbursed their preceding loans, they are on their fourth seasonal, rural loan. 

CATHERINE will use her share of this loan to buy enough peanut seed, some small tools, and agricultural entrants for this year's crop. She buys her supplies essentially at the big market of Kimparana. After the rainy season, the harvest is stockpiled for a certain time to gain in value before being sold at the big open-air market of Kimparana and at surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele who generally come from the big towns. 

The members of this BENKADI I group each expect to make, after selling their crops, a profit of 25,000 to 55,000 F CFA which will be utilised to reimburse the interest on the loan and for everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to buy entrants, seed, and small tools and equipment.

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun is 51 years old and lives with her son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Tuv province in Mongolia.  Her son, who is 19 years old,  attends college. 

Oyun manages a shoe-making business in her town. She started this business in 2010. Before her shoe-making business, she operated a children's play center for 3 years. Now she makes all kinds of Mongolian traditional shoes that have become popular among her customers. 

Oyun is a polite woman who says "I want my son to get educated and have a better job in the future."   She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: purchase materials to make shoes

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro  de 58 años convive con Cirila de 45 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos que son el fruto de esta relación. Ellos viven en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Pedro, es agricultor, actividad que lo aprendió  desde muy joven y esto es gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron. Actualmente las labores de la chacra ya no lo hace bien debido a la avanzada edad que tiene. Es por este motivo que opta por abrir un negocio en su casa que  se encuentra frente al centro educativo de su localidad, ya que vio esta oportunidad puesto que no hay competencia alguna. Es así que tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas, por el cual ya tiene ganado una cantidad de clientes que siempre recurren a su puesto. Este es su segundo empréstito por el que celestino se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas muy puntualmente. Con lo 1.000 nuevos soles pedro comprará golosinas para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Pedro is 58 years old and lives with Cirila, who is 45.  They have two children and live in the town of Canayre in the Llochegua district.  

Pedro is a farmer who learned his trade when he was young, and he is thankful to his parents for teaching him.  Currently, he does not do field work very well because of his advancing age.  For this reason, he decided to open a business in his home, which is located across the street from a local school.  He saw an opportunity because there is no competition.  He has a business selling candy, and already has a number of customers who always return to the store.  

This is his second loan, and Celestino promises to be on time with his payments.  With the 1000 nuevos soles he requested, Pedro will purchase candy to set up his store.

loans.use: to purchase candy.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene  56 años, es un padre de familia ejemplar. Siempre lleva consigo la sonrisa que le da ánimos para salir adelante con sus 3 hijos; a los cuales cuida con mucho amor; ya que su esposa los abandonó. Él continúa su vida con mucho optimismo en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Palca. El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace 13 años, es la agricultura. Junto a su esposa conformaron su familia, siendo esta actividad su único sustento. Es por eso que ahora, después de su abandono, siente que no tendrá el apoyo de antaño. Pero le reconforta las palabras de sus hijos, que a pesar de ser pequeños, le brindan aliento para continuar con sus cultivos de papa y arveja. Es así que todas las mañanas, Francisco, se levanta para poder velar el crecimiento de sus plantas, fertilizándolo, limpiándolo y podando constantemente. En estos momentos de su vida, agradece el apoyo recibido por su banco comunal, ya que le brinda el medio económico para continuar con sus planes de progreso. Ya que planea más adelante, comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas donde puede obtener mayor rentabilidad en sus cosechas y así dedicarse a la mejora de tierra para sus sembríos, y vender a un mejor precio sus alimentos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santo Domingo” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Razón por la cual se compromete en cumplir con puntualidad el pago de sus cuotas. Francisco de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de papa de la variedad “única” como también varios sacos de fertilizante naturales para comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Francisco is 56 years old; he is an exemplary father.  He always has a smile on his face that encourages him to get ahead with his three children who he cares for with much love since his wife abandoned them.  He continues with his life with much optimism in his own house located in Palca.  

For the last 13 years he’s been a farmer.  He and his wife formed a family and this activity was their only source of support.  This is why he feels that due to her abandonment he will not have the same support as he did in the past.  But, his children’s words comfort him because, even though they are small, they provide him with the encouragement to continue with his potato and pea crops.  This is how Francisco heads out every morning to care for his plants fertilizing, weeding and pruning them constantly.  At this moment in his life he thanks the communal bank for the support it’s given him because it provides the economic wherewithal to continue with his plans to progress since his future plan is to buy fields of his own to get higher profits from his crops, to dedicate himself to improve the land for his crops and to sell his food at better prices at the city of Tarma’s wholesale market.

He belongs to the “Santo Domingo” communal bank and this is his first loan with MFP where he hopes for a small loan to continue towards his objectives.  Because of this, he commits to repaying punctually.  

If Francisco were to get support from you he will invest the requested money in the purchase of potato seeds of the “única” type as well as several sacks of natural fertilizer to successfully launch his next planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Verdianne

texts.en:
Verdianne is 31 years old and married with three children between the ages of four and nine years old. Her business is well organized. She employs one person in her business. Verdianne has two years of experience and she sells vegetables and cooking oil.

Verdianne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more vegetables and cooking oil to sell. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude lives in Uganda. She is single with two children, both go to school. She has one additional family member. Gertrude sells milk. She has been in business for the last 7 years and sells her product at the market. She works 6 days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of milk. 

Gertrude generates additional income through hiring out her motorcycle. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children. Her major challenge is transportation and seasonality. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Mrs. Hean is 32 years old and a married woman who is the mother of five children. Two of her children are married and live in separate homes while the remaining three are single and still live under her income. One of her married children is working as a food seller in front of a hospital in Phnom Penh where she earns a little in income. 

Presently, Mrs. Hean and her husband has an experience in farming business for a long time ago, is earning a profit an average of $4.5USD each day to attain their family’s needs . Besides crop-planting business, the couple is able to earn more profit by fishing in the river and lake around their community. As some fishing of them are broken down, and they have some issue of financial factor. Mrs. Hean and her husband would like to request some fund from HKL and Kiva to purchase nets for their fishing activity. For the rest, they will use to buy some farming materials, for instance seeds and fertilizers for their crop growing well. 

In her prospect, Mrs. Hean hopes to use with additional income, she will be using to buy more farm fertile in order to enlarge her farming business.
Note: Mrs. Hean and her husband were taken in the photo with their young kids.

loans.use: to purchase nets for their fishing activity and also purchase some farming materials.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old. She and her husband Alfred have three children. She has been operating her retail shop for the past eleven years, making a monthly profit of 15,000 KES. This is her fourth loan. She has been loaned 50,000 KES which she plans to use to purchase stock like cooking oil, sugar, flour, soaps, etc.

With her anticipated profit she plans to pay school fees for her children. In the near future she hopes to own a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase stock like cooking oil, sugar, flour, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Morrumbala, provincia da Zambezia, norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais 2 maiores de idade e 3 ainda frequentam a escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ele. 
Saiu da sua terra natal a procura de emprego, trabalha como segurança ha mais de 3 anos e tem um salario de 4.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material construcao de uma casa (areia, cimento, pedra, baarrotes, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra.Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.400.00mt, e 7.500.00mt, ambos para o andamento da sua obra.
No futuro vai solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e comprar uma viatura pra auxiliar no transporte dos produtos, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alberto was born in the district of Morrumbala, in the province of Zambezia in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of five children, two of whom are adults and three of whom attend school. He went to school through sevent fifth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports a niece who lives with him.
He left Morrumbala to find work. He's been a security guard for more than three years and earns about 4,000 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account. He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his third loan with Kiva, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, rebar, etc.) to continue work on his house. His first loans were in the amounts of 5,400 and 7,500 meticals, both of which he used for the scaffolding for the construction. In the future, he hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to buy a car to help with transporting his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, rebar, etc.).

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo is 50 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, he has been working hard to manage his bar and brewery, which serves drinks and food to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Festo has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more firewood to brew beer, and will help him to generate greater profits and pay for his children's school fees. He hopes that in the future he will be able to start up a retail shop. 

Festo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Festo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to brew beer.

loans.name: Manuel De La Cruz

texts.es:
Manuel De La Cruz tiene 57 años de edad es casado   tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de treinticuatro, veintiocho, veintiséis años de edad en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, Parroquia puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol las compras y las ventas las realiza en san Jacinto. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte,fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda para poder cambiar y tener un buen rendimiento de los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia y negocio.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente son:  la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es poder  mejorar el estado económico para poder ayudar a los dos nietos que tiene para que puedan culminar los estudios.

En los tiempos libres le gusta trabajar, hacer deporte y disfrutar en compañía de los nietos que tiene.
texts.en:
Manuel De La Cruz, 57, is married and has three children. He lives with his wife and children who are 34, 28 and 26 years of age in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  

The “San Nicolás” communal bank is located in Recinto San Nicolás, Puerto Pechiche Parish that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn farmers.

Manuel farms corn, rice and beans.  His purchases and sales take place in San Jacinto.  He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and farm supplies like urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizer and weed poison to keep his crops in good condition.

The loan will be of much help to change and have good income produced for his family’s and his business’ wellbeing.

The challenges he faces are frequent: competition and pests.  His dream is to be able to improve his economic state to help his two grandchildren finish their schooling.  In his free time he enjoys working, playing sports and enjoying the company of his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Bessy

texts.en: Bessy is 46 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have six children between 3 and 28 years old. They are currently in school and live at home. For the past three years, she has been selling used clothes in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She hopes to become a big businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Heberto Simeon

texts.es:
El señor Heberto Simeón es  soltero y se dedica a la actividad de transporte de carga, habiéndose desempeñado como conductor además de trabajar con todo tipo de automóviles y buses. Su actividad consiste en realizar viajes a diversos lugares ya sea con los productores en el acarreo de sus cosechas, como a la empresa azucarera, donde traslada semilla de siembra para renovación de otras areas,   ya que tiene 30 años de ejercer esta actividad de la cual tiene un mercado de servicio estable por su reconocimiento y honradez en sus compromisos adquiridos.
Una de las necesidades que atraviesa es la de comprar llantas para brindar un mejor servicio, Por eso visitó Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para seguir laborando, satisfacer la demanda y obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia , además es un pequeño productor de granos básicos, como otra alternativa económica.
texts.en:
Heberto Simeón is single.  He works hauling cargo having worked as a driver and worked with all sorts of automobiles and buses.  His activity consists in making trips to various places perhaps to help farmers transport their crops to the sugar processing plant or transporting seeds for planting in other areas.  He’s been doing this work for 30 years and has a stable market because he’s known for his reliability and trustworthiness with respect to his commitments.

One of the needs he’s presently facing is to buy tires to provide better service.  Because of this he came by Ceprodel to get a loan so that he can stay in business and meet customer demand earning income for his family’s wellbeing.  Besides, he’s also a small producer of basic grains and this is an alternate economic activity.

loans.use: to buy tires and inner tubes.

loans.name: Bup

texts.en:
Bup lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She lives with her husband and two children. Bup runs a small food stall in front of her house selling meals to her customers in her local community. She started this business seven years ago. 

Bup intends to expand her business by taking a loan to buy more kinds of food and ingredients to make better meals. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education

loans.use: To buy more kinds of food and ingredients to make better meals.

loans.name: Bidii Shg Group

texts.en:
Grace is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG group. Grace and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Grace and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Grace takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school and secure enough food for her family and community. In the recent 2011 season, Grace had an excellent maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. 

Before joining One Acre Fund, Grace was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Grace will educate her children and save in business and livestock rearing for future use.

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Grace is pictured with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer as shown in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 60-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Fatima does embroidery from her home and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase materials needed for her project (cloth, thread, needles, etc.)

Fatima is looking to expand her business through selling her products in the shops in nearby areas.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her project ( cloth, thread, needles, etc.)

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 26, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. Her husband is a worker in a plastic company. She lives with her son and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thao has been in business for four years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish

loans.name: Nicomedes

texts.es: Nicomedes, de 40 años de edad, es un hombre de buenas ideas y modales, además de alegre y amable. Convive con María quien es ama de casa. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de su hijo de 15 años de edad. La actividad que realiza Nicomedes es la agricultura, tiene un terreno de 30 hectáreas que compró hace 8 años donde siembra plátanos pero principalmente yuca, tiene una extensión de 3 hectáreas listas para ser cosechas y otras recién sembradas. Para ello cuenta con 02 peones para las labores de cultivo y cosecha del producto a los que paga un jornal de 20 nuevos soles diarios a cada uno. Le gusta su vida y trabajo, además que gracias a ella puede suplir la necesidad económica y así tener un ingreso para solventar los gastos de su familia a la que quiere mucho y son la motivación de seguir trabajando. Por ahora desea continuar en su actividad y ampliar con la siembra de palma aceitera, ya que ha visto que está comenzando a tener bastante demanda como cultivo alternativo. Este será el préstamo número 11 con MFP, se siente agradecido por el crédito concedido para continuar con su negocio, y desea seguir contando con ese apoyo, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la siembra de más extensiones de yuca, planeado incrementar su producción por la demanda que tiene este producto, para ello comprará semillas de yuca.
texts.en: Nicomedes, who is 40 years old, is a well-mannered man who has good ideas.  He is also happy and friendly.  He lives with María, who is a homemaker.  They live in their own home together with their 15 year old son.  Nicomedes's business is agriculture.  He has 30 hectares of land that he purchased 8 years ago on which he plants banana trees and, primarily, yucca.  He has an expanse of 3 hectares ready to be harvested and others that have recently been planted.  He has 2 farm workers who help with the planting and the harvesting.  He pays them a daily wage of 20 PEN each.  Nicomedes likes his life and his work.  Thanks to his work, he is able to meet the financial needs of his business and also have an income to take care of his family's household expenses.  He loves his family very much; they are his motivation to continue working.  For now, Nicomedes wants to continue with his business and expand by planting palm oil trees.  He has seen that palm oil trees are starting to have quite a demand as an alternative crop.  This will be Nicomedes's 11th loan with MFP.  He feels grateful for the loan he has received to help him continue with his business, and he hopes to be able to continue counting on this support.  He promises to comply with his repayment plan, as he has done with his previous loans.  With the total he has requested of 1000 PEN ($375 USD), Nicomedes will invest in planting more expanses of yucca to meet the increased demand for that product.  To do that, he will purchase yucca seeds.

loans.use: to purchase yucca seeds.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 27 years old, married to Yusuf and they have one child. 

She sells clothes and she has been in business for five years, earning a monthly income from the business of KES 20,000.

She is borrowing her first loan from KADET Ltd. of KES 20,000. She will use the funds to add more stock,  i.e new clothes, Muslim female clothing, gear  and scarves. She plans to open another business with the anticipated profit. 

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and diversify to other businesses.

loans.use: To add more stock to the business.

loans.name: Donnabelle

texts.en:
Donnabelle is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Donnabelle is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed, hogs and fertilizer.

Donnabelle has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, hogs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Santa

texts.ru: Санта, 48 лет, замужем, сыну 10 лет. Санта в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 2007 году с 7,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Санта на сегодняшний день имеет: 3 коровы, 32 овцы, также есть 0,70 Га земли, где она выращивает органическую кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Санта обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 7 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины.

loans.use: to purchase seven sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda lives in the Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. Two are in primary school and the other two are in Secondary school. Hilda keeps chicken broth broilers and layers. She supplies chicken meets and eggs to different restaurants in the Temeke district of Dar es Salaam.

She has nine years experience in this business. Limited with capital, Hilda fails to meet the demand of her customers. She is in the process of expanding the size of her business. The additional capital of USD 1000 will help her suffice this requirement. The expansion strategy will help her increase her income. Next year, her third born will join secondary school and the extra income will help pay for school fees.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sudmila

texts.en:
Sudmila has a small store where she sells foodstuffs. She started this business 4 years ago.
This business has allowed her family to have a better income.
Having borrowed $400 she bought foodstuffs.
Now she needs a loan of $600 to expand the area of her store.
Sudmila is 40 years old. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli  region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on the front line in the Fizuli region. Sudmila is single.

loans.use: To expand the area of her store

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn S. is a father of two children, is 35 years old, and lives with his wife and family in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  He is a tuk-tuk driver and can typically generate around $10/day of income.  His wife, meanwhile, works at the local garment factory and can earn about $3/day.  Furthermore, one of his children is a student and another is too young to begin school.  S. hopes to use the loan to purchase one moto Tuk-tuk in order to run his business.  In the future, he would be really grateful if he can extend his current business and make more income to supply his family with.

loans.use: To purchase Tuk-tuk (motorbike with passenger cart) for his business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes F. R. (pictured with one of her grandchildren) is a 42-year-old mother of three: Jenifer (14), Johantan Obispo (14) and Wilna Demerva (25). Lourdes is requesting this loan to expand her business selling fresh vegetables and dairy products to neighboring communities. She will use the loan capital to travel to regional markets where she can stock up at wholesale prices, then sell at the local level from her store. Lourdes also has a refrigerator to store products over a longer period of time. This cuts down her traveling expenses and allows her to purchase goods at a lower price by buying in bulk. This loan will go far in developing her business.

NOTE: Lourdes is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Purchase plantains, eggs, tomatoes and other food staples

loans.name: Burhan

texts.id:
As the head of his household, Burhan earns his living to supports his family from his motorcycle dealer business. However, his business has uncertain monthly earnings. Sometimes on a good month, Burhan may earn $150 per month, but many times he earned nothing when no one buys his motorcycle. On periods like that, Burhan has to rely on his wife's $3.5 per day earnings as a seamstress. After learning about DINARI, Burhan applied for credit to purchase a new sewing machine, so his wife may work from home as a seamstress. Currently his wife pays a royalty of 25 cents per piece to her employer. His wife usually can work on 5-7 pieces in a 4 hour workday, so by going on her own working from home, Burhan's wife can get $1.25 additional earnings per day. Burhan has no child yet, he plans to use his savings to fix his home in Java.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sebagai seorang kepala rumah tangga Burhan menghidupi keluarganya sebagai Makelar sepeda motor yang pendapatannya tidak pasti, kadang-kadang sebulan bisa menghasilkan uang Rp.1.500.000 kalau sepeda motornya ada yang membeli, kadang-kadang sepeda motornya tidak laku sehingga Burhan hanya mengharapkan pendapatan istrinya yang sebagai buruh menjahit dengan upah Rp.35.000 perhari. Setelah memperoleh informasi mengenai DINARI, Burhan langsung mengajukan permohonan kredit yang rencananya akan dibelikan mesin jahit sehingga istrinya bisa menjahit dirumah sehingga pendapatannya bertambah, karena pasuh yang dijahit bisa dikerjakan dirumah dengan upah Rp.2.500 per potong pasuh. Karena istrinya bisa mengerjakan 5 – 7 potong pasuh selama 4 jam sehingga pendapatannya bisa bertambah menjadi Rp,12.500. Walaupun Burhan belum mempunyai anak, semua pendapatannya rencananya digunakan untuk memperbaiki tempat tinggalnya yang ada di Jawa.

loans.use: Purchase of new Sewing Machine for His Wife's Seamstress Business

loans.name: Ana Baudilia

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Ana Baudilia and I have been working in a small grocery store situated in my home for three years. My income from this business covers my family's living costs as well as other business-related expenses with suppliers. Because of this business, I have been able to move ahead with my two sons. I am a single mother. I need to keep my store well-stocked since the next grand sale is approaching; I would like to offer my customers a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombres es Ana Baudilia, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación, desde hace tres años, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, Gracias a este negocio he sacado adelante a mis hijos, ya que soy mardre soltera, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la epoca de mayor venta y asi poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy chicken, rice, sugar, soft drinks, dairy products, instant soups, hygiene products

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
An Lac is a poor region of Soc Son District due to the threat of floods constantly which make it hard to maintain stable income. To fight against poverty, women of An Lac has worked hard year-round and Mrs. Bui Thi T., 50 years old, is a prime example. During 2001, she had courageously joined YTM to request for a business development loan. Everyday, she brings eggs from her farm to sell in the Ni-Trung Gia market, earning about 2.5 to 3 USD of profit. She also encourages her husband to learn the welding trade and used half of the last loan to open up a store and buy raw materials for him to produce buckets and basins. Because of that, she had met no difficulties in the last loan payments and this time around, she would like to ask for a loan of 1200 USD to buy poultry eggs and corrugated iron and expand her business. Her family monthly income is about 200 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

An Lạc là một vùng quê chiêm trũng, nghèo khó của Sóc Sơn, quanh năm lụt lội, việc làm kinh tế rất khó khăn. Chính bởi sự nghèo khó đã thôi thúc chị em phụ nữ nơi đây quyết chí làm kinh tế vượt qua đói nghèo trong đó chị Bùi Thị Tuất, 50 tuổi, là một điển hình. Năm 2001, chị đã mạnh dạn tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Hàng ngày, chị đi lấy trứng tại các trang trại rồi đem bán tại chợ Nỉ - Trung Giã, mỗi ngày cũng thu được khoảng 2.5 - 3USD tiền lãi. Chị động viên chồng đi học nghề gò hàn và dùng một nửa số tiền vay từ Quỹ để mở cửa hàng và mua nguyên liệu sản xuất thùng, xô, chậu. Do đó, việc trả tiền tuần rất thuận lợi với gia đình nên vòng vốn này chị quyết định xin vay 1200 USD. Hiện tại, thu nhập của gia đình là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy poultry eggs, corrugated iron

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: “I live in Lahore the second largest city of Pakistan. I have five children, two boys and three girls and all of them go to school except the youngest one who is only two. My husband and I want to pay-off our Rickshaw (local three wheeled vehicle) which we bought a few years ago. With a loan we will be able to pay off the cost of the Rickshaw and it will be ours and we will save on interest payments. Besides driving the Rickshaw, my husband does gardening, which brings in extra income. Hence, we would have no trouble paying off your loan.”

loans.use: Pay-off a Rickshaw

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Creating pants and shirts is a skill not everyone has, because it is a task which requires much interest and, above all, ability for fabricating clothing. Mr. Carlos Manuel is commonly known as "the tailor" at the market of Bisne in Chinandega. He has worked as a tailor for 16 years.

He started his business with lots of trouble because he has no customers and in addition he had the urgent need to support his 4 children, who are now teenagers. Through the years, he has developed his business through loans requested from Ceprodel to improve his business. Nowadays, thanks to 27 loans, Carlos Manuel, "the tailor", has acquired tailor products and has invested in buying a new sewing machine in better conditions than the one he had previously. His greatest desire is to increase his clientele to be able to keep supporting his household.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La elaboración de pantalones y camisas es una destreza que no todas las personas poseen por ser una labor que se necesita de mucho interés y sobre todo mucha habilidad para su elaboración. El señor Carlos Manuel conocido comúnmente como “el sastre” en el mercado Bisne de Chinandega se dedica a la labor de la sastrería desde hace 16 años.

Comenzó el negocio con mucha problemática ya que no poseía clientes y además tenia urgentemente que mantener a sus 4 hijos que hoy ya son jóvenes. A través de los años ha venido desarrollando su negocio por medio de créditos que ha solicitado en Ceprodel para el mejoramiento de su negocio. Hoy en día, gracias a 27 créditos otorgados Carlos Manuel “el sastre” ha adquirido sus productos de sastrería y además ha invertido en la compra de una nueva maquina con mejores condiciones que la anterior. Su mayor anhelo es captar mas clientes para seguir manteniendo su hogar.

loans.use: Buying sewing materials (Compra de materiales de costura)

loans.name: Bombay 1A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Dorothy S.. She is currently in the business of selling herbal medicine and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Dorothy is 43 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 8 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Dorothy makes approximately UGX 300000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a retail shop. Dorothy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 1000000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Dorothy is joined in her small group by Samalie N., Jane K., Hawa N., and Christine N.. Samalie N. has a business in poultry farming and wants to purchase more chicks and poultry feed. Jane K. is currently operating a public pay phone business and wants a loan to purchase more airtime cards. Hawa N. operates a business making and selling candles and wants to boost the business. Christine N. is currently in the business of selling arts and crafts and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To add to a herbal medicine business and expand it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: With the new credit she could improve her business and expand its location

loans.name: Arthasallay Group

texts.en: Members of the Arthasallay group need additional funds to buy supplies for planting and maintaining their farms. Wurie C. is the group leader. She is 55 years old and has 5 children. The group of 5 members also work together, helping each other on their farms. The group's aim is to expand their farms and produce rice, vegetables and pigeon peas for consumption and income generation. The group therefore is requesting a loan of Le.2, 500,000 ($875 USD).

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Mr. S. Lopéz is orginally from Guatemala City, the capital. He currently resides in Cantón Chotacaj, Totonicapán. He got his start by working for an auto body and painting shop in Guatemala City, but later married in Totonicapán, where he now lives. He opened his own auto body and paint workshop. He later noticed that the business didn’t have much income because there weren’t enough vehicles in the town, so he didn’t have that business for very long. He asked a friend in Quetzaltenango for a job in a shop that made metal structures. He worked there for 5 years, after which he took the initiative to open his own business. He opened a shop in the county of Cotacaj, where his products gained wide acceptance since there were none like them in the region. With the loan he is requesting, he plans to increase his work on metallic roofs (synthetic ball courts, salons, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Originario de la Ciudad Capital, actualmente con residencia en el Cantón Chotacaj, Totonicapán, Inicialmente laboraba para una empresa de Enderezado y Pintura de vehículo en su ciudad natal, luego contrajo matrimonio en el municipio de Totonicapán donde actualmente reside, en donde instaló un local para el enderezado y pintura de vehículo pero tiempo más adelante observó que en el lugar el negocio no tenía mucho ingreso porque la cantidad de vehículos no era suficiente, no muy tarde dejó este negocio. Pidió trabajo a un amigo en Quetzaltenango, Guatemala que laboraba en estructuras metálicas donde laboro 5 años, después tuvo la iniciativa de emprender su propio negocio, instaló su local de trabajo en el cantón chotacaj, donde este producto tuvo una aceptación ya que la misma no existía en el medio . Con el crédito que solicita pretende aumentar su trabajo en techos metálicos (canchas Sintéticas, Salones etc.).

loans.use: Working capital to be able to buy metalwork materials

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.en: Moustapha, 52, is married and has a son. He lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is a furniture repairman and he needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 in order to bring in more equipment, so that he can expand his business and be able to repair a wide variety of furniture. This is the first time Moustapha has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to purchase furniture repair equipment

loans.name: Petty Traders Group

texts.en:
Jariatu K., Aiafu K., and Isatu S. named their group Petty Traders. They want a loan of Le 1,500,000.

Jariatu, the leader of this group, was born in Sanda about 30 miles from Makeni. She now lives with her husband here in Makeni where she also does her business. She is 32 and has 4 children. She sells slippers and has been in this business for the past 10 years now. Previous loans have helped Jariatu a lot. They have helped her business grow. She was able to pay her children's school fees and also handles most of her numerous problems. With a new loan Jariatu's stock of slippers will increase from 6 cartons to 12 cartons.

Aiafu also sells slippers. Previous loans have now helped him get a total of 4 cartons of slippers. He use to have only 2 cartons. With a new loan, he is expecting to get 6 cartons. Isatu sells items like gums, biscuits, batteries, mints, lollipops, etc. She thanks God for the previous loans she got from Kiva. Such loans have helped her business grow, and out of the proceeds she is able to make a livelihood.

loans.use: Buy more cartons of slippers

loans.name: Amelia Margoth

texts.es:
Amelia is 27 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank Señor de Martha II”. She has as a goal to open a clothing and cosmetic boutique. With her sad face she tells us that she is married and with two children, and her most difficult moment was when she delivered her two children by caesarian section and the recovery was difficult for her.

Today she sells clothing and cosmetics in her mother’s house, located to the north of the Quillcay river, and she distributes her merchandise to her established clients.

With a loan of s/.600.00 soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy shirts, jackets and items for children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Amelia tiene 27 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Martha II”. Ella tiene como objetivo instalar una boutique con ropas a la moda y cosméticos; con su mirada triste ella nos dice que es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Nos cuenta que su momento más difícil fue cuando tuvo cesárea en sus dos partos y que le ha sido difícil recuperarse.

En la actualidad vende ropa y cosméticos en la casa de su madre ubicada en el malecón norte del río Quillcay s/n, distribuye su mercadería entre sus clientes fijos. Estos productos los trae desde lima desde hace cinco años.

Con el préstamo de s/. 600.00 soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará polos, chompas e implementos para niños.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and items for children

location.town: Malecón Norte del Rio Quillcay, Ancash

loans.name: Kilimanjaro Group

texts.es:
Nora es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella inicio su negocio de venta de ropa para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa comenzó con este negocio hace 5 años vendiendo enfrente de su casa y actualmente vende en mercados rodantes cercanos a su casa.

Blanca inicio su negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo a darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas y que no les faltara nada. Inicio hace poco mas de 1 años comenzó como snack vendiendo refrescos, frituras y dulces, actualmente surtió su negocio con más cosas de abarrotes, ya que desea tener su tienda mejor establecida en un futuro.

Nely inicio con su negocio ya que necesitaba una actividad que le permitiera atender a sus hijos y a la vez poder obtener un ingreso extra. Comenzó con este negocio hace 2 años vendiendo para otra persona, pero poco a poco hizo sus clientes por lo que decidió vender independientemente y asi obtener mejores ganancias.

Ellas forman el grupo Kilimanjaro y necesitan $1125 que pagaran en 5 meses para poder comprar mercancía para sus negocios y poder así mantenerlos. Ellas confían que con tu apoyo esto será posible.
texts.en:
Nora is the coordinator of this group. She started her business selling clothes to be able to help her husband with the household expenses. She started this business 5 years ago, selling in front of her house, and she currently sells in street markets close to her home.

Blanca started her business to help her husband give their daughters a better quality of life and make sure they were not lacking in anything. She started a little more than 1 year ago, selling snacks like sodas, chips, and candy. She has currently stocked her business more like a general store, since she wants to have a better established store in the future.

Nely started her business because she needed an activity that would allow her to tend to her children and at the same time obtain an extra income. She started with this business 2 years ago, selling for another person, but little by little she got her own customers so she decided to sell independently in order to obtain higher profits.

They form the group Kilimanjaro and they need $1125, which they will pay back in 5 months, to be able to buy merchandise for their businesses and thus be able to maintain them. They trust that with your support this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying merchandise

loans.name: On

texts.en:
Mrs. On S., a resident of Prey Kla Tboung Village in Takeo Province, owns a small plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her field is currently infertile, so she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and more pesticides.

Mrs. On S. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one five years old and the other six months old. Her husband, Mr. Neang Veasna, a fisherman, is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and more pesticides for her field.

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Amah est né le 12/12/1960 à Lomé. Agriculteur de profession, il est marié et a à sa charge trois personnes. Il est spécialisé dans le maraîchage auquel il associe l’élevage de lapins. Face à l’élargissement de son marché, il envisage agrandir son espace cultivable et son enclos. Ainsi, il sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra d’arriver à cette fin.
texts.en:
Mr. Amah A. was born on December 12, 1960 in Lomé. A grower by trade, he is married and has three people in his care. His specialty is in market gardening, with which he has included the raising of rabbits. Given the broadening of his market, he envisions expanding his arable land and his fenced area. He is therefore requesting this loan, which will enable him to achieve his goal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise rabbits and to grow vegetables for market

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy Q. V. is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank.  She is 39 years old and is married with two children. Nancy has a stand in the Jesus Nazareno Market, where she sells spices, which she prepares herself. She also sells dry goods, ready-to-use (pre-soaked) beans and grains, homemade ice cream and popsicles. Her son helps her with the business.  Nancy needs a loan of $975 to buy hot peppers, milk and oil.  Nancy’s dreams are that her children will graduate with professional degrees, to open a store in her home, and to offer a wider variety of merchandise in her store. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: Buy hot peppers, milk and oil

loans.name: Mrs. Sothim Poa Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan includes twenty-one people in Liek village in Kandal province. All the members plan to use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Sothim P. is a village bank president and she is a farmer. She cultivates rice on 0.3-hectare field to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. SoV. Nheb, is a construction worker. In this business, he now faces a problem because he does not have enough construction equipment for his business. So Mrs. Sothim P. is requesting a loan to buy all kinds of construction equipment for her husband's business.

Mrs. Sothim P. is 43 years old and the mother of three children; two are employed in a garment factory, and one attends the local school. Mrs. Chan Mean, who is a group guarantee, is also pictured with the group members.

loans.use: Buy all kinds of construction equipment for construction business

loans.name: You

texts.en: You C., 60, pictured here with her oldest daughter, is a widowed farmer who lives with three of her children in the Bati district, Takeo province. She grows vegetables and weaves mats to sell at the local market, earning about $1.3 profit each day. She is also supported by three of her children who work as tailors. Mrs. You C. would like to request a loan of $1,200 to purchase cloth to expand her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to expand tailoring business.

loans.name: Norma Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Norma Margarita es una microempresaria que se dedica a la venta de quesos, ella cuenta con su cartera de clientes ya que tiene años vendiendo, 
Su esposo le manda un ingreso extra ya que el se encuentra en los estados unidos trabajando y le manda su dinerito cada semana, ella le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su casita pero ahora tiene el proyecto de terminar la losa de concreto del frente de su casa
Para darle un estilo diferente y más moderno es por eso que esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs Norma Margarita is a small business woman, she sells cheese. She has her own clients' portfolio since she has been selling it for many years. Her husband sends her an extra revenue since he is working in the United States and he sends some money to her every week. She has been doing improvements to her small house but now her project is to finish the concrete slab in the front of her house in order to have a different and more modern style; that's why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build concrete slab in the front of her house.

loans.name: Las Gardenias Group

texts.es: El grupo " Gardenias " esta representado por la señora Elena María y compuesta por 14 miembros los cuales residen en la misma zona. Una mayoría D. los socios (as) se dedica al comercio D. productos como los abarrotes, cosméticos, celulares, peluquería, refrescos, comida, zapatos, verduras y a actividades como el transporte público D. pasajeros.  A pesar D. la competencia que existe en el mercado las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y las ganas D. sacar adelante a sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y D. esa forma brindar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. En general las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR. debido a trabajos anteriores en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, todos los socios (as) saben el manejo D. los fondos así como la responsabilidad que se requiere para un financiamiento.
texts.en:
The "Gardenias" group is represented by Elena María and consists of 14 members who live in the same area. The majority of the members work selling products like groceries, cosmetics, cell phones, hair care, soft drinks, food, shoes and vegetables, as well as activities like public transport. Despite the competition in the market, the partners know how to succeed thanks to their experience and their drive to get their families ahead. The funding will be used for the purchase of materials, inputs and tools to improve their incomes and thus give their families a better quality of life. Most of the partners have experience in solidarity groups in their previous work with institutions just like Fundación Agrocapital. All of the members know how to manage the funds and understand the necessary responsibilities.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Babayeva

texts.en: V. is a mother of three children.  She has been in the farming business for five years.  V. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  She settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Seyidahmadli village.  Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to  buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides to improve her farming business.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Wastara Group

texts.en:
Mpenami is 26 years old, married, and has four children aged 12, 10, 8 and 6. Mpenami has been a bites (bread-like rolls) and porridge seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar since the past two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US $70. She works at her business for seven hours daily.
 
She requests her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more items to expand her business. She hopes that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. Mpenami will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Hidaya and Maryam, who also have their own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy flour and other items to expand her business

loans.name: Ma. Eva

texts.en:
"I started tilling a two hectare land last 2007. I own the farm. I got it from my parents. My husband is the one managing our farm business. And to supplement our income, I also grow vegetables in our backyard," says Ma. Eva E., a 35 year old mother of three children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase herbicides, fertilizers, and certified seeds. The loan will really help her get better income from her farm. She thinks that buying these farm necessities will result in a better harvest.

CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, fertilizers, and certified seeds.

loans.name: Claver

texts.en:
Greetings from H. Claver, a Rwandan entrepreneur. He is 43 years old and married. He and his wife have two children, ages 25 and 17 years old, and one 14-year-old orphan. This entrepreneur lives in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.
Mr. H. owns a retail shop in his district. He has one and half years of experience in this business and has one regular worker to help him. His monthly profit is approximately $275 and his wife produces a monthly income of $55. He starts working at 5:00 am and closes at 10:00 pm. He is seeking his first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company. With this loan he will buy more merchandise for expanding his shop. He will be reinvesting his profit in the same business.

loans.use: To diversify and expand inventory

loans.name: Mery Marleni

texts.es:
La señora Mery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga” ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 25 años, es soltera y posee estudios de educación superior (técnico en prótesis dental) y vive en el Barrio Santa Bárbara Nº 306.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 para la compra de CDS, ella tiene diferentes negocios de acuerdo a la época. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 800.00, para poder invertir en su actual negocio que es la compra y venta de lanas de diferentes colores.

Su deseo es poder ejercer su profesión.

A ella le gusta la solidaridad de sus compañeras y las importantes charlas que su banco comunal realiza para llevar a adelante el negocio de las mujeres.
texts.en:
Señora Mery belongs to the Niño Jesús de Praga (Baby Jesus of Prague) Communal Bank located in the Yunguyo District, Chuchito Province, Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, single, and has an upper level education as a dental prosthetics technician. She lives in the Santa Bárbara neighborhood. Señora Mery has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for three years now. With her first loan of 300 Sols, she bought CD's. She has had different businesses at various times. She is currently seeking a loan of 800 Sols so she can invest in her current business which is buying and selling wool of different colors. Her dream is to be able to practice her profession. She likes the solidarity of her partners and the important discussions that her communal bank provides to keep the women's businesses moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool of different colors

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Doña Martha Lorena tiene la edad de 46 años, reside en el bario  Reparto Shick en la capital de Managua,  madre soltera de cinco hijos tres casados y dos estudiando, trabaja como conserje medio tiempo y vende vigoron y golosinas desde hace siete años, los cuales ha podido salir adelante con sus hijos, ella inicio con fondos propios y a través de su salario. Con este crédito quiere invertir en golosinas y productos para preparar el rico vigoron, y pode seguir ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes. A futuro  lo que mas desea es tener un kiosco fijo donde pueda vender sus productos y dejar de trabajar para dedicarse totalmente al negocio y poder tener mejores ganancias. Y poder terminar de construir su casa a si como ayudar a sus pequeños que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is 46 years old and lives in the Reparto Shick neighborhood of the capital, Managua. She is a single mother of five children - three married and two students. She works half-time as a janitor and for the past seven years has sold "vigoron" (a typical Nicaraguan dish of cabbage and yucca) and other snacks. She and her children have been able to get ahead through this business, which she started with her own money from her wages. With this loan she wants to invest in snacks and ingredients for making "vigoron", to be able to continue offering her products to her customers. In the future what she really wants is to have a fixed kiosk where she can sell her wares, and then to leave her job in order to dedicate herself completely to her business and earn more. She could then finish building her house and help her children to finish with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snacks and ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda M. is from the village of Puntod. She is 59 years old. Nilda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Nilda cultivates fruit trees, and harvests and sells the fruit. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2000, Nilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to expand the business. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This will be Nilda's 14th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima K. is 46 years old and married with five children of school age. She runs a café where she provides meals of her national cuisine. She is a cook and finished special cooking school. The café is located in the central local market, which allows her to have many clients, the majority of whom are those making purchases in the market. The business has been generating a stable income for the last seven years.

Now, Rahima is planning to make repairs to her cafe and improve working conditions. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan for the first time. Today she thanks all of those supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To make repairs to her cafe

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira Q. is from the town of La Libertad. She is 46, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a specialized retail store, where she sells animal feed & farm-related products in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, her first from PMPC,  which she will use to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Revocutus

texts.en: Revocutus N. is a Tanzanian small businessman. He runs a food shop at Yombo Kiwalani ward in Dar es Salaam, selling a variety of food crop products. He purchases the goods directly from the producers and sometimes from the wholesale shops, and sells retail from his shop to customers. He manages to meet his family's daily demands from his business income. He has been in the business for the last five years. He needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business stock

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 43 años, es madre D. tres hijos uno D. ellos es mayor D. edad, se dedica a venta D. churros (postre dulce) en las afueras D. un colegio, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, él es chofer D. motocarro(propio). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” desD. hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en golosinas, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar insumos para la elaboración se sus churros (postre dulce). La meta D. Celia es tener una tienda D. abarrotes en general.

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de churros.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is fondly called ”Elena” by her co-villagers. She lives in Parog-Parog Solana Cagayan. Magdalena is a widow and mother with four children to support. Three of her children are currently attending a local school in their community and the other is still too young for school. She is a farmer who manages two hectares of rice field. This business allows her to save for the education of her children.

Magdalena plants rice and some vegetables on her rice field twice a year. She needs additional capital and has decided to borrow PHP 15,000.00 through KIVA lenders. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her crop production. 

With her patience and sacrifices, she can earn a net income of PHP 25,000 per harvest season. She uses this to meet the needs her children and to pay her debts. Magdalena hopes that she can produce more rice and vegetables to earn more income.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy farm supplies needed for farming

loans.name: Ailini

texts.en:
Ailini T. is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Vaisala. She is married and has eight children. To make a living, Ailini operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Ailini has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 400 Samoan tala a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ailini joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailini has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Ailini is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Ailini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Puthy Pen Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eighteen people who all live in Khnar Thum village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Puthy P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members and they will each use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land where she cultivates rice. She is also a weaver, and owns a small grocery store at home. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more raw materials and more grocery products to resell to earn more income. Mrs. Puthy P. is a 48 year old widow with a child who is enrolled in the local school. All the members are presented in the picture but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials and more grocery products to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working as a furniture maker since 2004 with ten years of experience in this field. He cooperates with his family to provide better life conditions.

Today, Mahmoud is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy more merchandise in order to increase his sales and so his business income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is from the village of Baybay, Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 20 years old and is single.

To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the market. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Agnes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: La Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre La Primavera, se conformó en fecha 29 D. enero del 2009, gracias a que la Directora General, la Sra. Juliana B. D. S., quien es artesana, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya informándose con respecto al programa y  D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto  en el  3° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa
El crédito  va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. bebidas, venta D. carbón,  venta D. mercaderías para la despensa arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta D. ropas, venta D. miel, venta D. tabaco, venta D. artesanía, venta D. helados, venta D. frutas, etc.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya. 
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The women’s group named “La Primavera” was formed the 29th day of January 2009, thanks to the Director General, Ms. Juliana B. D. S. who is an artisan. She approached the Fundación Paraguaya to inform herself about the program and the kind of work that the Women Entrepreneurs Group (el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras) had available. Once she was informed about the program, she managed to gather together 21 women who are working very comfortably in their 3rd cycle, in a supportive group within the program. The loan will be used for different activities like: the sale of drinks, coal, merchandise for grocery stores-(rice, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, yerba (mate), etc.), clothing, honey, tobacco, handicrafts, ice cream, fruit, etc. They all work in these activities to earn money; they help each other to reach their common goals within the group and with the Fundación Paraguaya. They actively participate in the weekly meetings and they work with impeccable solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the grocery store( rice, sugar, yerba, dairy products, baked goods, soft drinks, etc), to buy ingredients to make honey, to buy fabrics, sewing needles, to buy products for the beauty salon, to buy coal, ingredients to make snack foods, drinks, tobacco, etc

loans.name: Pipule Money Group

texts.en:
These are members of "Pipule Money" group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the city of Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. These women want a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to boost their businesses. With such a loan, they can add more goods to their businesses. This will attract more customers, sales will improve, and consequently they can improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is 31-year-old Augusta, on the right in the photo. A mother of 4 children, she is married to a miner. Augusta’s children are attending school – 1 in secondary school, 2 in primary school; the last is not of school-going age. Augusta sells fried cakes and gara lappers (locally dyed cloth, sometimes with fabricated designs). She has been in this business for 6 years now.  With her share of this loan, she will buy a bag of flour, gallons of cooking oil, bags of sugar, and baking powder.

loans.use: Buy a bag of flour, gallons of cooking oil, bags of sugar, and baking powder

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 33 years old and married with five children between the ages of 7 and 22. All of the children are attending school. She is a dairy farmer in the Nyamira area of Western Kenya. She's been farming for over twenty years and sells milk within the community. She also earns income from a small retail kiosk and employs one person. She says that the main challenges to her business are poor marketing of milk products and drought.

She has requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the added dairy cow will help her to be able to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she'd like to expand her dairy farming to produce 20 litres of milk a day.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers life insurance and a medical aid program. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto vive con su esposa, la pareja tiene una vivienda que es propia. También cuentan con 3 hijos mayores los cuales son independientes.
