Modesto y su esposa tienen un taller de chapería y también tienen un vehículo con el cual trabaja como taxista. La competencia es alta en el rubro de chapería, pero cuenta con clientela  que demanda sus servicios por la calidad y acabado que imprime en los trabajos que realiza. En el auto transporte, la competencia es alta, pero la demanda también lo es ya que es el medio de transporte mas rápido, contando con clientes que requieren de este servicio.
Con el crédito procederá a la compra de llantas y realizara el correspondiente de mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo. Este es su Cuarto  crédito al que accede, con excelente cumplimiento de pago demostrado en sus préstamos anteriores. Modesto tiene excelentes referencias personales y morales.
texts.en:
Modesto lives with his wife. The couple own their residence. They have 3 older children who are independent. Modesto and his wife have an auto repair business and a vehicle from which he works as a taxi driver. The competition is stiff in the business of auto repair, but they can rely on customers who demand their services because of their quality and the way they complete their work. In passenger transportation, competition is significant, but the demand for rapid transportation is also high, and Modesto relies on customers who require this service. With this loan, he will purchase tires and maintain and repair his vehicle. This is his fourth loan. He has an outstanding record of repayment and excellent references with regard to his moral character.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph G. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old, is a widower, and has one adult child. Joseph owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Joseph joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to pay for registration, franchise and licenses. This loan will be his first loan from GDMPC. Joseph plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for registration, franchise and licenses

loans.name: Salvador Sebastiao

texts.pt:
Salvador Sebastião M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 59 anos de idade casado e pai de 12 filhos os 9 já maiores de idade e 3 de 16, 14, 11 anos de idade, destes os 3 vão a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe não continuou porque na altura era a única classe que tinham acesso. Vive na casa propria com a sua família sustenta 2 familiares que vive com ele.
Nunca saiu de Boane, é motorista de profissão numa empresa privada, não possui nenhum empregado e o seu salário mensal é de 4.900.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
 Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 12.200.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, pregos, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 9.600.00mt, 11.000.00mt e 13.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na conclusão da sua casa, oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Salvador Sebastião M. was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. He is 59 years old, married, and has 12 children. Nine of them are already adults and the 3 younger children, who are 16, 14 and 11 years old, are in school. Salvador only finished 4th grade. He didn't continue because at the time he didn't have access to further schooling. He lives in his own house with his family, and also takes care of two relatives who live with him. Salvador never left Boane. He works as a driver for a private corporation. He doesn't have anyone working for him and brings home a monthly salary of 4900 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account. Salvador has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who also works with the institution. This is his 4th loan, for the amount of 12,200 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, stones, nails, sand and other items) in order to continue work on his construction project. His earlier loans were for 9600, 11,000 and 13,000 Meticales, and all were used for the same purpose. In the future he would like to get more loans in order to finish his house, to offer better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, nails, stones and other items)

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal lives in the Absheron region with his family. Vusal is 33 years old. He is single. Vusal Q. sells the thingss for beach. How you saw in this picture he sell a chaise lounge. Vusal has been in this business for 3 years. Now this young man needs a loan of 2000 Azerbaijani manat to improve his business.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Yesenia Benita

texts.es: Yesenia Benita tiene 34 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general.  Por lo que  tiene muchos créditos con Fundación y le han sido beneficiosos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Ella se levanta muy temprano, para ir a comprar sus productos que son muy importantes para así ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Actualmente ella está solicitando el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para caballeros, cosméticos, ropa para damas y para niños. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad.
texts.en:
Yesenia Benita is 34 years old. She runs a general store. Yesenia has had a number of loans with Fundación, and they've been extremely helpful. She has been in business for nine years, and she has three children to care for, as well. Yesenia gets up early to buy the products that are most important to her customers. She has applied for a loan so that she can buy men's clothing, cosmetics, women's clothing and items for children. All she hopes is that she'll be able to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sinoyia Ole

texts.en:
Sinoyia Ole N. is 42 years old. He is married to Nauruai N. and he is the father of two children. 

Sinoyia is a farmer and has been farming his land for the past ten years.
  
He learnt about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan. He is planning to prepare fifteen acres for wheat planting which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. With the profits, he plans to re-invest in his farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and to be able to plant one hundred acres of wheat

loans.use: to prepare fifteen acres for wheat planting

loans.name: Alvin Joephet

texts.en:
Alvin Joephet A. is from the village of Lumbia Cagayan de oro City. Alvin Joephet is single and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Alvin Joephet provides taxi services to local community members. Alvin Joephet has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Alvin Joephet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Alvin Joephet is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP. This loan is Alvin Joephet's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Kumba N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Togetherness. She is 38 years old, single and has two children who are 7 and 24 years old respectively. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 6 years, she has been selling ladies' handbags and blouses at Redlight Market, Paynesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She started her business by selling popcorn, peanuts and juices with a little amount of money. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more ladies' handbags and blouses. She describes herself as an earnest person.

Her goal is to grow her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more ladies handbags and blouses.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
La señora  Elsa Marina C.  se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace cinco (5) Años,  ella  solicita un segundo crédito KIVA para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que cada día trata  de  surtir su producto para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Ella vende güipiles, blusas, cortes, fajas, suéteres, ropa de niños, rebosos y bolsos para damas en estos días le ha agregado a su negocio la venta de pasteles que ella elabora lo cual significa una ayuda mas para seguir al luchando al lado de su esposo para lograr metas y sueños que toda pareja tiene y al ver crecer a sus dos (2) niñas.

Ella dice que los créditos que ha tenido en FAPE, le han ayudado a ir logrando que su negocio  cada día esté  más grande, ya que con ese capital tiene la oportunidad de llevar a cabo sus planes.
texts.en:
Elsa Marina C. has been selling typical clothing for five years. She is requesting her second Kiva loan in order to continue investing in her business. She tries to stock her store everyday to meet her customers’ needs. She sells “güipiles” (a traditional embroidered shirt for women), blouses, “cortes” (traditional skirt), belts, sweaters, children’s clothes, shawls, and purses for women. She has now added the sale of cakes, which she makes, to her business. This means more help as she continues to struggle at her husband’s side to reach goals and fulfill the dreams that each couple has as they watch their two daughters grow. She says that the loans she has had from FAPE have helped her to have her business get bigger everyday. With this capital she has the opportunity to complete her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Continue investing in stocking her business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is from the village of Pobalcion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Juliet is married and has two school-aged children. Juliet owns and operates a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from making & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Juliet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding the business

loans.name: Saf Niep Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAF NIEP est créé le 28 décembre 2009. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de THIEO. Il est composé de 14 femmes issues du même village.

Madame Thioro D., assise au milieux et levant la main sur la photo, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants

Elle fait de la restauration. Elle vend le petit déjeuner dans son quartier. Elle maîtrise bien son activité pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois il ya deux ans.

Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter 2 sacs de niébé, 20 paquets de pate alimentaire et 15 litres d’huile.

Avec ses bénéfices elle compte payer le ravitaillement pour la nourriture de sa famille et payer des frais médicaux pour d’éventuels cas de maladie.
texts.en:
The SAF NIEP solidarity group was formed on December 28, 2009. It is a member of the THIEO Banc Villageois. There are 14 women from the same village in the group. Khady T., shown in the picture sitting in the middle and with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is a 55 years old married woman with four children. She has a restaurant business. She sells breakfast in her neighborhood. She has been successful in this business since becoming affiliated with the Banc Villageois two years ago. This loan will allow her to buy two bags of black-eyed peas, 20 packets of pasta and 15 liters of oil. With the revenues, she plans to pay for her family's food supplies and for any future medical expenses.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two bags of black-eyed peas, 20 packets of pasta and 15 liters of oil

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 45 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two children. To make a living, Jocelyn runs a general store to sell a variety of different products in the local community. She also cooks meals that she sells at her store. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years. Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She also plans to buy piglets and chickens to start her livestock venture. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training programs through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell. She also plans to buy piglets and chickens to start her livestock venture.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora María trabaja como empleada domestica, hace tiempo se separo de su esposo, sus hijos ya son grandes y están casados, y ella vive sola en una casa que ah ido construyendo poco a poco con ahorros, ella requiere de este préstamo para colocar una losa en uno de los cuartos de la casa de la señora María. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida y sentirse mas segura en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María works as a domestic employee. She separated from her husband a long time ago. Her children are all adult and married. She lives alone in a house she’s been building little by little with her savings. She needs this loan to install stone flooring in one of the house’s rooms. María is a very hard working woman who wants to have a better quality of life and feel more secure in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For concrete paving stones.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Having ventured into the business of cattle, hard working  Wilson T. has no regrets from listening to  the advice he got from friends to start his current business which he operates from Musaana, Rukungiri. In his culture, in western Uganda, people own large heads of cattle This 40 year old has benefited a lot from his farming business. He deals in selling cattle for hides, skins and beef,  products he gets from his cattle business. His motive to acquire this loan is to help buys sprays for cattle to kill ticks and also de-worming medicine to treat against diseases that affect the cattle. This will help him increase production as well as revenue as he  looks to further restock more cows on the farm.

loans.use: To Buy more cows to raise

loans.name: Nanci Paola

texts.es: La señora Nanci Paola F. M., quien se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa, para dama, caballero y niño, de manera ambulante ha retomado de lleno a esta actividad, pero  ahora cuenta con un pequeño local que alquila ha cercanía del  mercado local de  su comunidad,  ha  este cambio ella ha introducido la venta de zapatos y  ropa americana clasificada, ella comenta que las ventas son buenas porque las  personas saben de la calidad de su producto y que  el haber vendido durante casi nueve años ambulante le  ha dado a conocer a  mas clientes, ella cuenta con la ayuda de  su esposo quien la acompaña a realizar sus compras y a la vez se dedica a la elaboración de muebles, de sala comedor, y la que ella apoya también con las ganancias de este negocio, como pareja tienen el sueño de agrandar sus negocios, y brindarles una mejor vida a sus niños quienes van creciendo, y afrontan a los cambios de la vida.
texts.en: Nanci Paola F. M. works selling clothing for men, women and children; she used to work traveling around but now she has a small storefront that she rents close to the local market in her community.  Now she has begun selling shoes as well as American clothing.  She mentions that sales are good because people know the quality of her product and, since she has sold for 9 years, she knows many of her customers very well.  Her husband helps her as he accompanies her to buy her goods; he also works making furniture for the living room and kitchen; this business helps to support the family as well.  As a couple, they dream of growing their businesses and offering a better life to their children who are young and growing.

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N., 45 years old and married to Gilbert Okibiro, is the mother of three children: Joshua, 25, Rosemary, 22, and Kevin, 21 years of age.

Alice has a retail shop and is applying for her second loan of Kshs 50,000 to buy one sack of sugar to add to her stock. Her business having improved since her first loan, Alice's monthly income is now Kshs 10,000. Her profits will be used to pay school fees for her children, who are all attending university.

Alice desires to open another shop near the shopping center and also expand the current one into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: To buy one sack of sugar

loans.name: Elsy Noemy

texts.es:
Elsy, de 29 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y su hija, este negocio lo realizo con la ayuda de su esposo y tiene ya 5 años de administrarlo con la ayuda de su hija; ella tiene la dificultad de no tener energía en su vivienda y a la vez no posee un inventario de los materiales que utiliza para la preparación de tortillas, por esta razón solicita un préstamo que le ayude a salir de esta problemática, dándole un mejor servicio a los clientes y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Su objetivo es cancelar este préstamo puntualmente y seguir trabajando con esta ayuda para progresar en el negocio.
texts.en: Elsy, 29, lives in Jiquilisco, a town in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Usulutan.  She operates a business making and selling tortillas.  She lives with her husband and daughter.  She built the business with help from her husband and she has run it these past 5 years with her daughter's help.  She faces two problems: her house is not wired for electricity and she doesn't have enough money to buy supplies for her food business.  She is applying for a loan to address both problems.  She will be able to better serve her customers and also improve her family's living conditions.  Her goal is to repay the loan on time and, with this help, grow and improve her business.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business and install electricity.

loans.name: Johny

texts.en:
Johny M. is from the village of Holy Friday, Mallig, Isabela.  He is 31 years old. Johny is married and has 1 infant-aged child.  To make a living, Johny owns and operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale.  Johny has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Johny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Johny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.  Johny is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Johny from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Flaurentine

texts.en:
Flaurentine is 35 years old and is married with four children. She runs a hotel in Taba district in Rwanda.  She and her husband both work hard in order to get all of the basic needs for their family.  Flaurentine has been running her hotel for six years, and it is well-known and organized.  She works from 6am until 8pm every day.

Flaurentine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her hotel. Flaurentine will use this loan to purchase additional products like beer and goat. With any profit, Flaurentine plans to continue to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more goat and beer to serve to clients.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna D. is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: a frozen foods business.  She lives in Brgy. Babajuba Junob, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

 By working hard in her frozen foods business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,500.  Anna is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she  can continue to fund the operations of her frozen foods business.   This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Anna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her frozen foods business

loans.name: Mercedes Del Milagro

texts.es: Mercedes del Milagro R. D. A., resiD. en Sensuntepeque, departamento D. Cabañas. Ella vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, y así mismo vive junto a cuatro hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar.  Mercedes es un apersona muy responsable quien trabaja en su propio negocio en el que comercializa diversos tipos D. productos como: cosméticos, peluches, canastas, cajas y bolsas para regalo, flores artificiales y otros más, el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado D. Sensuntepeque, y cuenta con varios clientes debido a que es una venta muy apropiada para muchas personas por el tipo D. productos que se venden. Mercedes solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo D. surtir su negocio y D. esta forma aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Mercedes del Milagro R. D. A. lives in Sensuntepeque, in the departament of Cabañas. She lives with her husband, who works in agriculture, and her four young children who all attend school.  Mercedes is a very responsible woman who runs her own business selling a variety of products like cosmetics, stuffed toys, baskets, gift boxes and gift bags, artificial flowers, and other items.  Her business is located in Sensuntepeque's market and she has a good number of customers because the types of products she sells fit what a lot of people want.  Mercedes is requesting this loan with a great desire to stock her business and thereby increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, baskets, toys, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Walter; el tiene 47 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, el trabaja haciendo desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar la atención de restaurant. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, carne y verduras para cocinar en el restaurant.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Walter is a member of the “KANTU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Walter is 47 years old, single, and has 5 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his restaurant business.  Walter works making breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  He works from 8.00am to 9.00pm and, through his business, he gets his children ahead in life.  Walter would like to improve his restaurant business and is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, meat and vegetables to cook in his restaurant.

Walter is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, meat and vegetables to cook in his restaurant

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter K. N. is 33 years old, married, and  has five children to whom they hope to give quality education to the university level. His business is located at a busy area known as Athi River and he is served by the Kitengela branch. He owns a food cafe from where he sells tea, doughnuts, and other snacks. He has been in this business for six years and has provided employment to three people. Peter says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of  20,000 KES to buy flour to make more doughnuts since the demand for snacks is high in the busy area. He hopes to expand his business and start supplying to other towns.

loans.use: To purchase flour

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar, ella vende cervezas y gaseosas, ella trabaja desde las 4:00 p.m hasta las 1:00 a.m y por medio de esta trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de bar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Elena, a member of “HATUN RUMIYOC”, a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Elena is 51 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. She alternated her daily chores with her activity as bar owner: she sells beers and fizzy drinks, and she works form 4 pm to 1 am. Thanks to this activity she is able to provide for her children. She would like to enlarge and improve the bar premises. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the wholesale purchase of fizzy drinks and beers.

Elena is happy about the loan, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her shares.

loans.use: To invest in the wholesale purchase of beers and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Nelly Mirtha

texts.es:
Nelly  tiene 38 años D. edad, es divorciada y resiD. junto a sus cinco hijos en su domicilio en el caserío Cruceta ubicado  a 15 minutos del distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes D. la zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida desD. hace 3 años, adicionalmente Nelly se dedica a la venta D. comida. Con estas actividades ella solventa los gastos económicos D. su familia.

Nelly desea compra más productos como útiles escolares, abarrotes, sillas y mesas para su  pequeño negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.

Nelly es una mujer bastante trabajadora y D. muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Nelly is 38 years old, divorced and lives with her five children in her home in the village of Cruceta located 15 minutes from the farming district of TambogranD., a farming area in the Piura region, more than fours hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has a small grocery store set up in her home. There she sells to her neighbors and customers from the area various everyday consumer products, such as essential products and groceries. Her business has been favorably received for 3 years, and additionally Nelly sells food. With these businesses she clears the financial expenses of her family.

Nelly wants to buy more products such as school supplies, groceries, chairs and tables for her small business. For this she thinks it best to request a loan of 1500 nueves soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Nelly is quite a hardworking woman and of very good character, the people that know her think very highly and are very fond of her.

loans.use: Buy school supplies, groceries , chairs and tables for her store.

loans.name: Uruila's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group, Uruila C., 46, is a proud mother of three boys, the youngest of whom is 19 years old. Uruila is a well-experienced farmer who works the entire spring, summer and fall, knowing from her life experience that earning money is not easy. Although farming offers a steady source of income because food is always in demand, it also carries risks due to weather conditions or factors such as the economic or political situation of the country.

Uruila has been farming for 10 years in a town in Uzgen in southern Kyrgyzstan. Her major crops are sunflower seeds and a special type of Uzgen rice unique to this region and requiring special care. Uruila is thankful to live in such a productive area and earns a monthly income of about 16 000 soms. But Uruila is sure that her energy will help her do more if she is able to achieve additional financial support, and so is requesting this loan in order to purchase 100 kg of seeds and 300 kg of fertilizers. She hopes to achieve a rich harvest in the fall because she will use the best fertilizers.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Entrada A Chunazaca (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Entrada a Chunazana esta formado por 11 mujeres y un hombre, viven en la comunidad de Chunazana que es de clima frió, su gente es muy amable y hospitalaria, se dedican a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades, nuestras socias son personas muy trabajadoras que se sacrifican por el bienestar de sus familias.

La Señora. Martha M. vive por el sector  Entrada a Chunazana, es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue su hermanan quien la  invito a formar parte de este grupo.
 
Ella tiene 25 años, es casada  en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 9, 6, 4 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como jornalero y con el trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Martha se dedica a la cría de  cuyes, pollos, gallinas, borregos y ganado a los mismos que los vende en su comunidad.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos y más animales.
 
Su meta es tener luz eléctrica en su casa.

En esta ocasión nos acompañan en la fotografía los esposos de dos socias, los cuales estan vestidos el uno con camiseta verde y el otro con una chompa azul con verde. Nuestro socio se encuentra vestido con una chaqueta negra.
texts.en:
The 'Entrada a Chunazana' community bank is made up of eleven women and one man.  They live in Chunazana community which is a cold climate area.  The local people are very kind and hospitable.  They raise animals, farm and many go to the city to work in different businesses.  The members of this group are very hard-working people who make sacrifices for the well-being of their famlies.

Martha M. lives in Chunazana sector.  This is the first loan that she has accessed through her community bank.  She was invited to join the group by her sister.  Martha is 25 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 9, 6, 4 and 1.  Her eldest two children are attending a local elementary school.  Her husband works as a laborer and, through their joint efforts, the couple have managed to build their own home.  Martha's business is raising guinea pigs, chickens, hens, lambs and other livestock which she sells in her community  She will invest her loan money in buying more chickens and more animals.  Her goal is to have electric lighting in her home.

On this occasion, two ladies' husbands are accompanying them in the photograph, one is wearing a green t-shirt and the other is wearing a blue sweater with some green.  Martha is wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy chickens and other animals

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos. Vive en casa propia,  en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la crianza de aves de corral pavos y gallinas contando los cuales engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 5 años en la parte posterior de su casa. 

Rosa desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus animales y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old.  She lives with her partner and has four children.  She owns her own home in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Rosa's business is raising poultry such as turkey and hens which she fattens and then sells in her local market.  She keeps the animals in an area behind her home and has been in this business for more than five years.

Rosa would like to acquire balanced feed in order to improve her animal production and make more profits.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 years old is married and her husband has a business. They have one 16 year old child who is going to school but lives with her mother.  
For 7 years Josephine has been in business. She has a table in the market where she sells oil, rice, bath soap and other dry products. She started the business with money from her husband and she likes being able to save money for herself. 
Josephine has requested a loan to purchase rice, oil, soap and other goods to sell. In the future, she wants to save enough money to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, soap and other goods to sell

loans.name: Hebron

texts.en:
Hebron is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya, doing mixed farming with the help of three farmhands in the farm and producing tomatoes, potatoes and maize, all of which are sold to the local market, He is married with four children aged between 16 and 4 years.

He has made a request for a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry business by buying more birds. He says improved performance of the poultry business will help in the education of his children as well as providing basic needs like meals. He hopes to expand his farming and acquire more acreage for better farming.

Hebron notes that the poor transport system has been a great challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry.

loans.name: Zenzele Group

texts.en:
Hawukelaphi is 57 years of age, and a widowed mother of 6 children aged 11 to 26. She runs a retail business in Nkandla, South Africa (KZN). In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

Hawukelaphi has been in the business of selling fruits and vegetables at town shelters for 10 years. She also earns income from the government’s child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is facing rainy and cold weather when she sells, because the shelter she usually sells in is an open shelter. She requested this loan from WDB and Kiva to buy more fruits and vegetables. She adds that the extra income from this loan will help her earn profits so she can grow and sustain her business. In the future she would like to build a house for her family.  She gives thanks to WDB and Kiva, and will be pleased if they can help her build a stable shelter to sell in.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.en:
Nematullo has been dedicated to the business of purchasing and selling horses for the last 10 years. This business requires a lot of dedication because it  takes a lot of effort to carry out the breeding.  Dedication is necessary because the work requires strict control of every animal and at the same time feeding and caring for those that are older.

Through this business, Nematullo is able to support his spouse and his 5 children.   He is soliciting a loan through IMON International to buy more animals, which he will raise and sell in the market. Nematullo has gained a reputation for being responsible with his financial obligations and for keeping his word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchase more horses

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife is a tailor who owns a clothing-making business. His older two daughters, age 11 and 13, go to a local secondary school while the youngest, who hasn’t reached school age, stays home. 

Lhagvasuren manages a welding business in his town. He started his business in 2007 and is planning to expand in the future. In addition, he manages a taxi service business and uses his own motorcycle to supplement his earnings. Lhagvasuren is planning to buy a container, which can be used as his workshop, to increase his business sales and service new customers. He is a hardworking man who says, “I want to buy more equipment in order to provide quality service for my customers, so I can expand my business.” 

Lhagvasuren is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment

loans.name: El Manantial De Donaciano Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana ella es originaria de la localidad de Donaciano Ojeda y se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías de ocoshal, ella hace lo que so paneras, tortilleras, fruteros, aretes, hueveras, jarrones, floreros etc. Tiene con esta actividad aproximadamente 5 años, comenta que empezó a realizar este trabajo para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar ya que su esposo o puede trabajar debido a que tiene una hernia y trabajan ambos en su casa haciendo artesanías y cuidando a sus hijos. Comenta que vende sus artesanías en Cd. Hidalgo Michoacán, Tuxpan Michoacán y Toluca  estado de México. Doña Juana esta pidiendo un préstamo para la compra de ocoshal, agujas, hilo, cloro y detergente para lavar el ocoshal. La señora Juana esta casada con el señor Tomas el cual es artesano y jornalero ellos tuvieron 9 hijos pero nada mas viven con ellos 7 de nombres Miguel de 16 años el no estudia ya que les ayuda a sus papas con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hermanos pequeños, después sigue Alma de 11 años, Rafael de 9 años, Eduardo de 7 años ellos tres estudiantes de primaria, luego sigue Tomas de 5 años y Cristal de 4 años. Doña Juana comenta dice que desgraciadamente no puede salir a cuidades lejanas a vender sus artesanías  ya que las vende a muy bajo costo y no le conviene ir tan lejos porque no le alcanza para los gastos y es una de las problemáticas que tiene con su actividad, comenta que el préstamo les ayudara de mucho ya que comprara mas insumos para elaborar las artesanías.
Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Gregorio, Maria Crisanta y Efrén ellos están pidiendo sus créditos para invertirlos en la producción de tabique de concreto y insumos para el cultivo de aguacate.
texts.en:
Señora Juana is originally from the village of Donaciano Ojeda. She makes her living making artisanal crafts from ocoshal [pine needles]. She makes things like bread boxes, tortilla holders, fruit baskets, earrings, egg baskets, vases, flower baskets, etc. She has been at this for approximately five years. She says that she started to do this work to help her husband with the household costs because he can no longer work due to the fact that he has a hernia. They both work in their home making crafts and caring for their children.

She says that she sells her crafts in Ciudad Hidalgo, Michoacán; Tuxpan, Michoacán; and Toluca, Estado de México. Doña Juana is requesting a loan for the purchase of ocoshal, needles, thread, bleach and detergent to wash the ocoshal. Señora Juana is married to Señor Tomas who is an artisan and farmworker. They have nine children but just seven of them live with them. Miguel is 16 years old and he no longer studies as he now helps his parents with the household costs and his younger siblings’ education. Then there is Alma who is 11 years old, Rafael who is 9 years old and 7-year-old Eduardo, all of whom are primary school students. Finally, Tomas is 5 years old and Cristal is 4 years old.

Doña Juana says that unfortunately she cannot go to cities that are far away to sell her crafts because she sells them at a low price making it unprofitable. She does not have enough money for the expense. This is one of the issues she has in the business. She says that the loan will help them a lot as they will buy more supplies to make the crafts.

The other members of the group are Gregorio, Maria Crisanta and Efrén. They are requesting loans to invest in the building of a concrete partition and supplies for avocado cultivation

loans.use: to make pieces from ocoshal [pine needles].

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 63 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos ya independientes.  Isidora tiene estudios hasta 2do D. primaria.
DesD. hace seis años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que utilizó para invertir en la venta D. granos D. la región.  También se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados como ovinos y vacunos.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos vacas para su respectivo engorD. por cuatro meses para luego venderlas a mejor precio.  En el negocio le ayuda su hija.  
Su sueño es tener más capital para tener una planta quesera y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad  y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Isidora is a member of the communal bank "Virgen D. la Asunción,” located in the district and province of Yunguyo, department of Puno. She is 63 years old, widowed, and has two children who are independent. Isidora has studied through the second year of elementary school. 

She has been working for six years with the Manuela Ramos movement. Her initial loan was for 500 Peruvian soles, a loan she used to invest in regional grain sales. She also works buying and selling livestock such as sheep and cattle.  

With her new loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles she will purchase two cows for their respective fattening for four months, in order then to sell them at a better price. Her daughter helps her in the business. 

Her dream is to have more capital in order to have a cheese-making plant and thus improve her income. What she likes about the communal bank is its punctuality and the earnings she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Мавлюда  родилась в г. Каракол ( Иссык-Кульская область),  где сейчас и  проживает.  Она родилась  и выросла в среднеобеспеченной семье,   после окончания школы вышла замуж и в 1986 году родила первого  сына.  Для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью всем  необходимым, ей приходилось много работать . Сейчас у нее трое  детей( дочка и 2 сына), младшие сын и дочь учатся в школе.  В 2004 году, Мавлюда решила начать свой бизнес в торговле товарами широкого потребления. Начав деятельность со стартовым капиталом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS), она сумела развить свой бизнес и на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль около 10,000 сом в месяц.  Небольшой торговый павильон Мавлюды (площадью 2х3 м) пользуется популярностью за счет хорошего ассортимента товаров, но к сожалению не позволяет увеличить объем торговли. Поэтому Мавлюда решила обратится в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для увеличения ассортимента товаров. Планируемую прибыль она хочет вложить в покупку еще одного павильона на местном рынке.  
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Mavluda was born in the town of Karakol in the Issyk-Kul province where she now lives. She was born and raised in the middle income class family and after graduating from school she got married and gave birth to her first son in 1986. To provide for her family with all the necessary things she had to work very hard.

Right now she has three children - a daughter and two sons. Her youngest son and daughter go to school. In 2004 Mavluda decided to start her own business in the trade of consumer goods. When she began her business with a starting capital of 20,000 soms (KGS) she was able to develop her business and to this day her monthly profit is around 10,000 soms.

Mavluda's small trade pavilion with a size of two by three meters is very popular due to a good variety of products offered, but unfortunately it does not allow to increase the volume of sales. This is why Mavluda decided to come to Bai Tushum and Partners to ask for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to increase the variety of her products. She plans to invest the profit in purchasing of another pavilion on the local market.

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to expand the variety of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell products (fish, meat, rice, flour, oil, soft drinks, juices, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like canned foods, groceries etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last nine years. She is 50 years old and married to Benson. They have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all of her previous loans on time. She has been loaned 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which she plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

In the future, Virginia hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Grace has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional products from NATASHA and AVON for resale.
Grace has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products from NATASHA and AVON for resale.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her salon where she does hairdressing for local women. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase equipment needed to do special braids and will help her generate greater profit to buy new clothes and food to feed her family. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to open another larger salon. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Faridah's future prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Don Luis de oficio albañil, sigue trabajando cada dia, para el bienestar familiar, su esposa lo apoya al laborar como estilista, pues como objetivo ha sido la construccion de su casa, en donde ha hecho bastante mejora con sus ahorros y financiamiento en Afodenic.
Hoy en dia hara un bajarete en la parte de enfrente, ya que al llover el alero esta corto, y se le mete el agua, y desea poder cubrir esta necesidad, y repellar paredes interna en la parte de atrás.
Contento por que se le ha hecho mas facil, las mejoras a su vivienda, al avanzar mas rapido, ahorandose el costo de la mano de obra, ya que el mismo la trabaja, con su credito anterior logro terminar la instalacion de cielo razo.
texts.en:
Luis is a bricklayer by profession.  He continues to work every day for his family’s wellbeing.  His wife helps him out working as a stylist because their objective is to build their house; he’s done quite a few improvements already thanks to his savings and loans from Afodenic.

Nowadays he wants to build a lean-to in the front because the roof's overhang is short and when it rains water gets in and he wants to take care of this need; he also wants to plaster the inside of the rear walls.

He’s happy because doing home improvements has been easier and he’s made faster progress saving on labor costs since he does the work himself.  With his previous loan he was able to finish installing the ceiling.

loans.use: to some home improvements.

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es:
Martha lucia es una mujer casada, que en compañía de su esposo decidieron independizarse laboralmente  y emprender su propia microempresa, desde hace 5 años tienen una tienda en el barrio donde viven, en la cual venden productos en general de la canasta familiar, ella dice que les ha ido muy bien y han tenido muy buena acogida gracias en parte a la buena asesoría que han recibido de su suegro quien por mas de 50 años se dedico a esta misma labor. 

Actualmente, y con la intención de continuar creciendo, se ven en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para aumentar el surtido y la variedad de sus productos, en especial comprar granos y gaseosas, que son productos que tienen muy buena rotación en su negocio, todo con la ilusión que al paso del tiempo pueda ampliar su negocio, ofrecer mas variedad y calidad en servicio y productos a sus clientes y al tiempo que aumenta sus ventas, ingresos y proporcionalmente mejora su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha Lucia is married.  She and her husband decided to become independent workers and to establish their own small business.  For five years they have had a store in the neighborhood where they live.  They sell basic needs products.  She says that it has gone very well for them, and it has been very well received.  This is partly thanks to the good advice they have gotten from her father-in-law, who did this same work for over 50 years.

With the intention of continued growth, they now see the need to request a loan.  The loan is to increase their stock and the variety of their products.  They will especially buy grains and soft drinks, which are the products that have a good turnover in their business.  This is all done with the hope that, in time, they will be able to expand their business.  They will be able to offer more variety, more products, and quality service to their customers.  When their sales and income increase their quality of life will improve proportionately.

loans.use: to buy products, especially grains and soft drinks, to stock their store.
